This second full-length Lone Ranger feature does n't measure up to the 1956 classic but is a fine film with a good cast, fine direction and some excellent location shooting. The Lone Ranger is still around in the early 1950s, having made its first full-length appearance a few years ago, and this time it is based on an old western radio drama which had originally aired in 1931, and a sequel which followed in 1932, both titled “The Lone Ranger: The New Adventures of ‘Tonto, The Lone Ranger and The Tontos”.

Sure, it has its pretentious moments, it plays like art-house, live-action Fantasia, but it also has moments of deep beauty and humor. Omnibus films are always a problem, but I have always had a keen interest in them. I will now rate the segments individually.Nicolas Roeg - "Un ballo in maschera" - This segment may very well spoil the film for some people, because it is absolutely the worst of the whole bunch. It is difficult to follow, mostly because it tries to adhere to a clear plot (a hackneyed one, at that).

I played Sam ( the porter , Lou 's sidekick ) in the Film `` Dead Rail '' Which later on became a feature movie . But the thing that sticks out the most to my mind are the various things that I had to do , such as :

When I was doing '' Dead Rail '' I remember that they were shooting it in a real railway station . It was a long day , I was shooting for 3 hours . The station was closed , and they told me to be in a particular spot at this certain time which I was , but I didn't really feel like it .

I own the miniseries on DVD because I love this story so much . This is one of the best I've read . Received for free in exchange for an honest review

I can't find the other review to compare the books but I would like to note that I have watched this movie and the series and it has some really good things going for it , but there are several things I don't agree with. The story is great, the characters are great the acting is great. But for me the one thing that stands out is the ending.

Don't watch this movie expecting the Jane Austen wit, crisp dialog or clever social commentary. This time around, the premise of Northanger Abbey has been updated in a very sensual way! In this version,Catherine's erotic daydreams are not just silly fantasies, but a connection to the world of adult sexuality she is just peeking into with her daylight adventures. By day she is very prim and demure, and her swain Henry treats her with the utmost courtesy. But as her own sexual nature awakens, her daydreams shift every so subtly from mild to steamy to lurid!

Hands down , the best drama/comedy show on television . A cleverly written show about a young mother and her teenage daughter that explores all aspects of modern living. The writing is sharp and funny , the directing is top notch and the acting is so good , you actually want to laugh at some of the situations . The show can get a little cliched at times , but it's still very entertaining . Highly reccomended to anyone with a good mind , and a funny bone . I just want to thank everyone who voted.

This 1959 soap opera film takes us into the lives and loves of three young women in the publishing world as secretaries. This follows the same idea as THREE COINS IN A FOUNTAIN a few years before. This takes place in New York while COINS takes place in Rome, Italy. Our three beauties are Hope Lange, in her first starring role, Suzy Parker and Diane Baker. Lange does well and holds her own opposite some strong veterans in the business, namely Joan Crawford. Suzy plays an obsessive woman who has a hard time losing her beau.

I watched the first few moments on TCM a few years ago but stopped after about 15 minutes . I'm a big fan of the original film and have a lot of respect for Lee, but the first two sequels were awful and the new one was the first one I saw. I saw it on Netflix a few years ago and thought it would be worth watching again but it just didn't do anything for me. They really messed up on the story and the tone was off. I'm hoping this one will be a lot better.

10 respected directors each shot a short film with operatic arias as the inspiration ( and music ) . I’ve always loved this idea, but have been unable to put it into practice. This month I’ll be doing it with my “D’Anna” opera and will be putting it up online. I’d love to have you take a look. It will be a little while before it is complete. This was a fun project to do, and now I’m thinking I’d like to have a similar project in the future based on my other operas.

Come on . Anyone who does n't understand the greatness of this here cartoon should be kicked off any critic site they're on. It's like the Simpsons or South Park, the best satire of it's time in history. I don't care how "old school" you might think it is, it's so over the top and out there in a way that makes me think that this was done specifically to make people stop and think about the ridiculousness of what we were doing, or to just have some fun. There are no real characters in it.

The tunes are the best aspect of this television film which has admittedly better-than-average production values , but very surface story telling and lack of character development are a serious detriment to a work which at its heart should be something much deeper. That said , if you're just looking for an excuse to be entertained this might be worth checking out. If you haven't already , you should know that this film will take place in the midst of the Civil War . This television film is based upon one of the best known songs of all time - The Star-Spangled Banner .

As a dedicated lover of all things Egyptian this is a classic piece from the 50's, along with my other favourite, Land of the Pharaohs". The sets and colours are just wonderful and everything seems so "neat" in the production quality. I thought Victor Mature was well cast and Peter Ustinov a real gem! The whole look of the movie (along with others made in this era) has an appeal that you just don't get with modern movies with all their digitized effects (I have yet to see the 1999 movie "The Mummy but am sure I will love it!

15 Park Avenue , well the name mystifies initially being an address from New York and film being set in London. However, it is actually a building in New York, which is very well known as being a prestigious address. It is also the residence of the President of Columbia University in New York. In fact it is also the home to the University’s film studies department, and the place that where Stanley Kubrick wrote the screenplay for “2001: A Space Odyssey”. The University and its building also have their own website where they keep fans up to date with all the University’s activities.

During the War for Southern Independence , GENERAL SPANKY mobilizes his forces to defend the local women & children against marauding rebels. In one of SPANKY's last adventures, he sets out to avenge the massacre of hundreds of innocents. At the outbreak of the war, Confederate General SPANKY and his troops were engaged in the defense of Atlanta from invading forces. One day, his forces were ordered to assist in the defence of Turner's Gap, Georgia, where local civilians were engaged in a pitched battle with marauding Union forces. When SPANKY entered the battle, his troops were ordered to pursue the retreating enemy.

Fata Morgana, the 1971 documentary-like film by German filmmaker extraordinaire Werner Herzog, filmed over several years in the late 1960s, is one of those rare DVDs that should be listened to with the commentary turned on. It is a visual feast of North African (mostly Saharan) imagery that is timeless. You simply could not tell that it was made over thirty-five years ago. The soundtrack to the film, including German classical music (Mozart and Handel), and rock music by Blind Faith and Leonard Cohen, also lends its timeless quality.

Our America is multi-cultural, with so many sub-cultures. This movie simply tells a story of a snapshot in time within one of these sub-cultures. It is basically an objective look at a group of forgotten people, living their lives oblivious to the rest of the world. Generally, a good movie. It entertained, provoked thought, and showed lives that would not be seen otherwise, right in our own back yard. Should be seen by all. Having lived in the U.S. all my life, I had no idea that there were citizens here that didn't know they were citizens.

When I was engaged, my fiance and I would frequent the adult bookstores. He would look for his favorite mags, and on occasion a video that caught the eye. As much as I enjoyed the one-on-one with him that the media caused, there was never a video that I really enjoyed. I had seen only one other movie way back when there was a satellite channel called XXX (it dealt with a private eye unraveling a case) that actually had a proper plot and was enjoyable. All the others were grunting and puffing and blowing and whatnot.

A couple of cowpokes help a group of Mormons cross some rough country on their way to a new settlement. This low-key Western is unusual for Ford in that it lacks any big stars. Johnson gets top-billing but his is basically a supporting role, although he and Carey work well together. Dru is given little to do other than provide the love interest. The best performance is given by Ford favorite Bond, playing the leader of the Mormons. In fact, this role helped him land a starring role in the long-running TV Western "Wagon Train" before his untimely death at age 57.

I came across this movie in an Australian hotel room at 3 am . My brother and I were channel flipping and landed on it. It is a great action movie with the main focus on action sequences. There are about 2-3 good ones, but it could have been a bit better. I recommend watching it, even to those that might not watch a lot of action movies, this one is a good pick. The last thing I want to talk about for now are two new movies that will be on the DVD/Blu Ray this summer.

This movie is complex and interesting in so many ways. It is a non stop plethora of emotion and taboo subjects. Sex and love. Women's emotional abuse of men, Men's physical abuse of women, Sexual child abuse, Fresh approach to religion in real life, and all tied together with very raw and powerful blues music.I promise you that if you sit through the first 20 minutes you will find the tie in and bettering of all the characters. And the ending will be more pleasant than you can expect.

The best bit in the film was when Alan pulled down her knickers and ran the cut throat razor over her bum cheeks and around her bum hole. It was also brilliant to see Alan's bum going up and down like a fiddler's elbow later on in the film.Alan was tough as hell in it like when he got annoyed and pushed the four eyed wimp onto the sofa.I've been laughing for days about the cut throat razor bit. A brilliant idea by the script writers. Alan must be brought back into Eastenders so he can do the same to Peggy.Alan is back, and this time he's armed with a razor.

I'm absolutely disgusted this movie isn't being sold. All who love this movie should email Disney and increase the demand for it. They'd eventually have to sell it then. I'd buy copies for everybody I know. Everything and everybody in this movie did a good job, and I haven't figured out why Disney hasn't put this movie on DVD or on VHS in rental stores. At least I haven't seen any copies. This is a wicked good movie and should be seen by all. The kids in the new generation don't get to see it and I think they should.

I only gave this nine stars instead of ten because i really don't approve of pornography all that much. pornography has a useful purpose in society(can't say i can always think of one)but it probably does.personal viewpoints set aside, i really thought this film was pretty funny. i didn't buy this movie because it was pornography, i bought it because i am one of those 'Alice' obsessives who will watch anything about 'Alice in Wonderland'. i own just about every version there is on DVD so it was an obvious choice to complete my DVD collection with this.

When I saw the preview for this movie, I figured to myself, "here's another dumb TV movie that's written with the thought and complexity of a soap opera," but when I saw it I was surprised. Tiffany-Amber Thiessen stars (and proves that she can indeed act if given the chance) as a woman who falls in love with and marries a man (Now and Again's Eric Close) but begins to lose trust in him when a series of rapes begin to take place in her community.

This was such a great series for Black folks at the time . We loved it so much . It’s a shame that they stopped making them. I hope you do another series . My favorite series from the 80’s is The Brady Bunch . I wish they would make a series about it . They were the perfect family . Thanks for everything . God bless . The Brady Bunch did a wonderful job at raising wholesome children, but I think there were too many kids. That’s why I enjoy the newer series of the Brady Bunch so much, you only get 3 kids.

This film had me spellbound this evening. Thanks to Fox Movie Classics for showing it uninterrupted. John Voight, this cast of little known black actresses and most of all, the children, made this a worthy way to spend a Sunday evening. How wonderful to see the early work of this seasoned actor, as well as Paul Winfield's excellent portrayal of Mad Billy. I can't see why anyone would say that Hume Cronyn is miscast in the role as superintendent. Who would they have chosen? The shrill character actor, Charles Lane?

The Ma & Pa Kettle characters were highly popular AND controversial. The films that featured their brood paved the way for television sitcoms that came after it and sought to emulate its winning formula. One obvious reference is 'The Beverly Hillbillies,' where the new home was bought with oil money, not having been won in a contest. You could even say the 1980s sitcom 'Newhart' borrows its idea of backwards rural characters from this series. Still, I wonder if Betty Macdonald, the Washington-based author who created these characters, didn't do more harm than good.

I saw this movie when it was first released and thoroughly enjoyed it. What a movie. I am in my 40s now and have 2 teenage kids and I would like them to see this movie. I would recommend it to anyone who loves a romance movie or older Elton John music.I have searched most of the stores that sell both new and old movies but have not come across any.I bought some old movies like " Melody" in Hong Kong, who had quite a collection of old movie, but they did not have this.

I've seen 'nurse betty' twice in september 2000 on the international film festival 'films by the sea' in vlissingen, the netherlands. It impressed me so much that I kept on smiling the whole day after I watched it for the first time and almost all evening again when I took the movie as the final taste of the festival. What I knew about 'nurse betty' was in short that renée zellweger would play a girl in love with a soap-opera-star. But what I saw was much more than that! Splendid roles for morgan freeman, chris rock ànd renée zellweger.

If this is not my favorite movie of all time , it definitely is in the top five . I saw the film about a month before I graduated from college , and it was not only the last time I saw it ( I still have the ticket stub ), but it was the first time I was able to make sense of what it had to say . I saw the film in a college theater in the summer of 1983. It had not yet been adapted into a musical on stage , and it was the first time I had seen the entire work performed .

I was drawn to `` Friends '' by the soundtrack scored by a very young and yet to be famous songstress. The film was a cult favourite and it was clear from the start that the screenplay was written with a lot of affection. So when I read on the credits that the writer/director was a little girl I got excited. She had the potential to turn the whole situation on its head and create something really wonderful. As a writer I wanted to see if she could pull it off. And she did. I hope you enjoy the results as much as I have enjoyed seeing this movie again.

Flawless writing and brilliant acting make this unusually delightful and witty plot-twister one of the best American films I have seen in years. This movie takes us back in time to another era, a simpler time, but one that we can never return to. The plot is one that has been seen before, and done better. But, as we watch the movie, we begin to realize that what really makes this movie so special, is the acting. This story, though, is not just about two girls and two guys.

The Reader is an exceptionally well done and very sweet short . Every element of the piece assists in eliciting sympathy from the reader for the plight of the victim and it's easy to find yourself rooting for the young protagonist who is an excellent role model for children. There are some nice touches to the writing that make the piece stand out. The Reader is a tale of hope, a story of love and redemption that will leave the reader with a warm and fuzzy feeling of satisfaction at the end and a warm place in your heart for the young protagonist.

The Box is one of the strangest movies I have ever seen . To explain my experience , let me say this . I have seen most of the movies made by Wes Craven , and for a horror movie to work on a whole , it must meet at least three of four criteria . 1 ) A strong story , and a logical ending. 2 ) The use of fear , and gore , and shock. 3 ) Characters you can root for , and characters whom you don't like . 4 ) An acting performance to give it some life.

I saw this film on TV in the UK some 25 years ago and it has resonated with me ever since. This is a documentary made by the BBC about one of the world's most remarkable women - Margaret Thatcher. In my opinion, it is the best ever made about one of the great women of British history. The documentary has been made from a large number of interviews with those who knew Margaret Thatcher and who worked closely with her in her public and political career. In many respects, this documentary is a history lesson as well as giving us an insight into Margaret Thatcher's life.

Me and my roommate got free tickets for a Pre Screening I guess you would call it in Atlanta, GA at Atlantic Station. Walking in I was expecting something controversial, provocative, unnecessarily overdone, etc.. But the film is much more than that. It's a story of two people helping each other. It's not overdone, and the film is done in a careful balance as to not make you cringe or say its unnecessary.It's put together really well and doesn't take itself too seriously. Thats the beauty of it.

I first saw this one afternoon in the 80's on network T.V. I think I was like 9. (Picture seeing a violent horror flick nowadays on regular television). Anyway, I've seen it again years later and it's like I remembered,it's really good,scary flick. I think the reason why it might of gone unnoticed is cause it wasn't followed by a ****load of sequels i.e. Friday the 13th. But it's one of those movies that takes the original idea and does it better.

Nurse Betty has that odd but winning combination of a repellent , unease-inducing plot with extraordinary characters . In the new movie , directed by Peter Segal and produced by NBC , this combination of traits is turned into a high octane thrill ride that is so far above your average TV movie that i can't find the words to accurately describe it . however , i will try to describe it as honestly as i can , since i'm too busy enjoying it myself to worry about whether you get my description or not . . . and , as always , feel free to comment below .

This is the best movie I have ever seen. It has it all tragedy and happiness love and hate. And a deep friendship that not even war can destroy.The most splendid casting I have ever seen. Patrick Swayze and James Read were top grade in this movie.If you see part 1 you will want to see it all. Some of my friends watched part of the movie at my home then went out and bought the movie.I am a civil war buff but this movie got my grandchildren interested in history. Any movie that can get children to learn history is great.

Excellent entry in the RKO Saint series with well-written original script, good camera work and transitions, good directing to handle some twists in the plot, good editing to keep the flow constant, and good acting. George Sanders is suave and witty. Jonathan Hale simply is Inspector Fernack. Paul Guilfoyle plays a mobster who goes straight (and drinks milk) because he cannot take the pressure. He will return in a later entry in the series. Story begins on an ocean liner headed to the U.S. where the Saint meets but cannot connect with Wendie Barrie.

Sweeping drama with great sets, costumes and performances  though some folks are channeling Rhett, Scarlett, Melanie and even Lady Macbeth. Patrick Swayze and James Read are excellent as two men trying to maintain a friendship despite the ties of family and location. Splendid villains  you'll want them all to come to a very bad end. Lots of strong female characters in this one  both good and bad. Secondary story lines also are well developed. Several cameos by major stars of past eras. Good representation of history and conflicts for those caught between friendship and politics.

I absolutely ADORED this movie as a child and still do as an adult. To say that is even an understatement. My sister, brother and I watched it one year at our grandparents' house during Christmas vacation. They had taped it from TV. Our parents were glad it kept us occupied for the one night but they thought we would tire of it and be ready for outdoor activities the next day. Not so! We became mesmerized. They could not have unglued us if they tried. It became a cherished yearly tradition.

George Cuckor, known as a director of women, couldn't have hoped for two more talented and beautiful women for his last film. Itself a remake of Bette Davis' campy "Old Acquaintance" written by John Van Druten, this film is definitely dated, but still delightful.Bergen and Bisset sparkle as best friends who compete at everything, but manage to remain friends. Liz Hamilton (Bisset) is a "serious" writer, intellectual, and elegant. She meets her lifelong best friend Merry Noel at an exclusive girls school and they begin a lifetime of not always friendly competition.

I viewed The Reader at Sugar, which is not an optimal venue for viewing anything, and the movie was by far the highlight of the evening. The technical elements were well meshed and it was obvious that Duncan Rogers had chosen his designers and crew well. But it was the story and it's delivery that truly made this short shine. Duncan Rogers' tight script was just what this evening of "shorts" needed. It neither meandered, as several offerings did, or preached to us. The Reader was simple story telling in it's best form, well cast by Rogers and beautifully acted.

If you want to see a movie with nudity, sex, drugs, alcohol, brutal beating of a woman and child rape, this movie will satisfy you. If you want to see a man creatively exact revenge on the treasure of a wife who left him, this movie has it. You've already heard the wonderful music that keeps the raw emotion going. The surprise is that in a story of violence, action and music a climax can come in a moment of silence, without a pedantic speech, which transforms the movie.

I saw this film on the same night I saw 6 other shorts . This one was leaps and bounds better than the other films I saw the same evening . A very funny film that takes us into the heart of the character's lives . Very funny and clever film that is so true to its source that it could easily be mistaken as a book. The story is based on true events, but as the film goes on it becomes more and more believable until it is just a wonderful comedy of real people, their situations, and their everyday lives.

Guess a few upscale film directors were sitting around sipping their absinthe , grappa , aramangac or jungle juice someplace when one of them said to the group, " What the hell kind of movie was that?!?" "I mean , this was a big- budget picture, the kind of picture we see all the time, you know. And it was so bad. " One of those directors then turned to the other, and said , " It was terrible! It was just so terrible !!!!!" " Yeah , it was just terrible , man !"

One of the many backwoods horror 's that came out in the early eightes and fortunately this is one of the better ones. This was a B- movie at best and some of the stuff they use in it was pretty clever. There is some great stuff in it. The first half of it is pretty great. It's a very strange movie that doesn't really know what its is. It's not scary or funny, but it is fun to watch. After the first hour is done and the first big reveal happens you get a pretty good idea what the hell this movie is about.

Gosh, I am learning pretty fast that sometimes when you see a film as a youngster and then again 20 years later you gain a different view -- primarily because in 20 years you learn more. For example, I had no idea who George Cukor was - how great of a director he was and how much of that made this film fly. All I can say is..I really liked this film for it touched on an area that paralleled my life: lifelong friendship between two women. Can that EVER exist?

Personally, I regard "The Egyptian" in an extremely favourable light.It was introduced to me by a well-known Australian movie commenter & critic named Bill who was renowned for his insight & broad vision of people & places & particularly of films. This movie fitted the Bill perfectly & I came to appreciate his commentary & enthusiasm for this movie that emerged all the more as I watched it, as I was literally drawn into it, minute by minute, beyond his introductory comments, on my initial viewing many years ago.To me, it was propelled, layer upon layer, within half an hour, into an intriguing & fascinating production!

I saw this movie when it was first released and thoroughly enjoyed it . What a movie . I am not going to comment on the movie plot or anything like that , but it was just the right kind of movie for my liking. I like movies that leave a mark in the viewer and this was no exception . The movie is so well done and well crafted . It is like a masterpiece . I don't know what it is all about and I dont think the director knows what he is all about but this is one of the best movies I had seen till date .

Believe it or not , the Mona Lisa actually got stolen once , and was missing for nearly two years

A man named Robert L. "Bob" Stinson III has confessed to the crime. Stinson had worked for the Louvre for almost twenty years as a guard. He had access to the painting and the passcode to the lock. On October 31, 1911, while on his lunch break, Stinson, with his girlfriend, the cook Mona Lisa Giroux, decided to steal the Mona Lisa while on a boat ride to the Louvre in Paris.

The first thing I wanted to do after watching this film was watch it again ( because I 'd missed it the first time around ). The second thing ( and the biggest surprise for me) was how good the film was. It is as funny, clever, touching as the first time round, and the fact that it is now showing in 3D has only enhanced its charm. What makes it great is how well all the characters are handled, and how each one has such a unique personality which you can easily recognise ( and love ) no matter who played them.

I played Sam (the porter, Lou's sidekick) in the Film "Dead Rail" Which later aired as "Alien Express." And, I have to say that for my part I thoroughly enjoyed watching this film. As a struggling actor this was a chance for me to work with fantastic people, it gave me great scenes to include on my reel, and it allowed me to work on a dream job for a month and a half (no waiting tables!) Turi(the director) And Steve and Scott (the producers) Were very kind by giving me this opportunity to participate in the production.

I think that Mario Van Peebles movie Posse is a very important film. It is an excellent entry point film to a side of history many are not aware of. This is a story of early black settlers, cow boys and infantrymen returning from the Spanish-American War with a cache of gold. The main character Peebles is haunted by memories of his murdered father. The racism applied to the new black settlers and infantryman is explored in this film with excellent casting including Melvin Van Peebles (Marios father), Billy Zane, Stephen Baldwin and a wonderful performance by Big Daddy Kane.

I had no idea who Bruce Haack was before seeing this film . I had just seen the MOOG docu-drama , “Moguls and Movie Stars” . It was quite interesting, if not a tad depressing, but it was a fascinating look into how moguls operated back in the day. The film focused mainly on two moguls, Jack L. Warner and Irving Thalberg. Both of whom had amazing relationships with famous actors and actresses. There were a lot of people involved in the film who worked at the studio, but most of the actors/actresses were left out of this film.

This film is remarkable in how unremarkable it is. This is the true story of one woman and one man and their quest for happiness amid the dull, rote life of a housewife and "man of the house". It could be any couple, any family, in any town... but that's what makes the story so moving. It touches each of us in some way and reminds us of someone we know and love, or of ourselves. I laughed, I cried, I couldn't stop thinking about it... and what more could you ask for from a film, really?

I have just seen a very original film that I would recommend to everyone including ` the young & the old. ` It is so funny that this film could happen in 2017. ` It is very entertaining. It is also a must for those who like to laugh but also those who have not seen much of the funny films. It is not the most sophisticated film. It does have a few flaws which are not too noticeable but I can see where the director wanted to go with the film. ` If I have to find fault it is the fact it does not make it all the way over.

This one started excellently. The photography and audio are the best I've experienced in years (okay, months). Especially the use of 'warm' and 'cold' colours in single sequences is astonishing. Also, making Jennifer Lopez whisper most of her lines is an idea in itself, but I'm not sure what Singh wants to accomplish with that.Now for the minuses. The screenplay was awful. Lopez's part turned out to be irrelevant or totally worthless to the plot. She seemed to star the movie only to sell herself and the pic. The three beds seemed just too obvious.

It's hard to know what to make of this weird little Aussie crime flick - on the one hand, it's an enjoyable little film with a great sense of humour; but on the other, it just lacks a certain something that ensures the film never reaches above it's boundary that keeps it trapped within the merely 'interesting' territory. That being said, Two Hands is a well plotted film that excellently juggles several stories at the same time, which allows several small climaxes throughout the movie, and that in turn helps to stop the film becoming boring.

For my money, probably the best film - or at least the most purely cinematic film - director Ford ever made. The dialog is swift, clipped, to the point.l The story starts at the very beginning and only ends with the final credits. Ford uses a relatively small cast, but directs them and photographs them with a verve and a sweep of epic proportions. Grimly realistic, warmly amusing, brilliantly acted (hard to believe Johnsonj couldn't become a leading man after this), with the best photography and editing in any American black-and-white film.

I saw this fine flick shortly leaving college . As I sat there happily watching Alice go from repressed virgin to willing sex fiend in under two hours I thought “What is the name of this movie?? ?” I had never heard it before and I don't remember seeing it in a video store or anywhere else. So , if anyone can help out with the title and the director of this great flick please post a comment! I think we would all like to read your opinion on this! Thank you very much for your help,

I have no idea but I have found it before.

Well its a great work by Aparnaji and some where people like this makes us believe that there is a lot more concepts till now which has to be expressed and the film is a great media to do that. Well all great actors together hence nothing to say about acting or directing but the film gave us a great message through out. It has nicely predicted the conditioning of human minds with that of the patient. We all believe that what we believe is true with our own point of view and we want to solve all the problem accordingly.Hence from the professor to the maid servant all tried their own ways.

The Tempest has been interpreted in many different ways ranging from more or less traditional views as dealing with Art, Poetry, Philosophy, Magic, etc. However, this essay will approach it as a sort of Science Fiction (SF). I do not know much about SF, but this is what I understand:

SF is a mixture of different elements. I will try to explain some of them here. The idea is to see if I can use the elements of SF to shed some light upon the interpretation of the T.A. 1.

I finally received my DVD today , viewed it and I 'm pleased to announce this is the original theatrical cut with the extra scenes. Although I have no real comment other than that they have done an admirable job on the DVD version. It looks great , has sound and picture that are both good with the usual minor imperfections . It 's even got a decent commentary which I haven't heard in a long time. In other words I am pretty happy with the DVD and would recommend it for fans of the original theatrical cut.

For those who still prefer films focusing on human relationships , 51 Birch Street is a must see.By training the film is more like a play than a film, with actors taking on a number of different roles. In fact, the whole movie is a sort of “living theatre“, with actors switching between various roles.This makes it more than difficult to follow the story, because you have to constantly keep track of what is happening in the story.In fact, the whole story seems to unfold in three different plots, which make it very hard for me to remember what is going on in the story.

I saw MESSIAH 2 a few months ago and didn`t get to see the original teleplay untill a few days ago and this is far superior to the sequel . Okay it`s not a million miles away from the plot of SEVEN but it`s still compelling . Much of my praise has to do with Ken Stott`s performance as DCI Red Metcalfe a policeman who seems to have led a very unlucky life and someone who has a terrible secret . It`d be easy for Stott to go over the top but he plays the role in a fairly subtle way .

This was another great episode from season 11 of South Park. Cartman fakes having Tourette syndrome in order to be able to say whatever he wants without getting in trouble. He is able to swear at the other kids at school. Kyle tells the Principal that Cartman is faking it. But, she doesn't believe it. Chris Hansen is planning on having Cartman to be on Dateline to talk about Tourette syndrome live and uncensored. But later on, Cartman starts to get so addicted to be able to say whatever he wants, that he later on starts to accidentally say embarrassing stuff.

i love this show! it is amazing...i can never miss an episode even if i've already seen it. the actors are perfect for the parts......i love Gilmore girls! i've gotten all my friends to watch it. even their parents watch it now. i watch it daily and i usually watch it more than once a day. i wish my mom was like Lorelei. my friends say that i talk and act like Lorelei. Lorelei and Rory have a wonderful mother-daughter relationship. it is a great teen show because they actually kind of learn from watching it.

"The Cell" is a rather difficult film to classify. If you read the plot outline, "a psychotherapist journeys inside a comatose serial killer in the hopes of saving his latest victim", you might think it's a thriller with a touch of science fiction. But that doesn't really do this movie justice. There is a fantasy aspect within the sub-conscious minds that is stunning, with lavish visuals and incredible mind-tripping scenarios. There is drama as the aforementioned psychotherapist (played by Lopez prior to her becoming a solely romantic comedy component) makes contact with the child within and witnesses his terrifying upbringing.

The most enjoyable pet movie since Scooby Doo and Garfield . The story revolves around a 23 year old inventor, Frank, who just got married . One day he discovers that the world was created in 6 days and that it will all fall apart in 7 days if it doesn't stop the earth from freezing. The only thing is he's not sure why it's happening because he has no clue what the purpose of the universe was. So he takes his cat and dog on a road trip to the city where he was born to try and find out what's up.

I think the problem with this show not getting the respect it truly deserves is that it comes after Seinfeld. When Seinfeld first came out, everyone who was anyone in Hollywood had seen it and everyone who didn't want to admit to having seen it would say something like "What is that show, Seinfeld?" Then, when the show ended, everyone that had seen it said "Oh, it's not nearly as funny as Seinfeld was" and "Jerry was kind of a schmuck, no one liked him."

This film was made soon enough after Karen's passing that perhaps Richard Carpenter and the people closest to Karen were feeling a little guilty as to how they may have contributed to her health problems. As the years have passed (almost 25 to be exact) it must have gotten easier to deny any complicity. Richard has spent the years after Karen's death endlessly remixing and recompiling the recordings he made with her. He married his cousin, Mary, and from what I have read, it looks like he may be planning a next generation Carpenters with his children.

The make -or-break of a love story for me is whether or not I like the characters and also if I feel like I am in control. So when I first heard the news that a movie about the famous love triangle between the three main characters in "Glee" was coming to fruition, I was a little hesitant to watch the trailer. After all, I'd already seen three "Glee" episodes and found the first two to be a little lackluster. So I decided to trust in the filmmakers and give "Love, Simon" a try.

This film blew me away . I thought I knew a little about the Attica prison riot . After watching The Attica Prison riot , you will learn a lot about this tragic event, and also learn a little something about yourself . In this film , we witness a very human side to the very inhuman events at Attica . The human side , in this case , being the inmates and the guards , are not portrayed as evil but as people making very bad choices . We learn the facts about this event, , the history of the prison , how the riots occurred and the aftermath of these events .

Just see it ! It 's a smart movie but too hard to understand the first time . See it again if you missed it first time . You 'll see it in a different way , a way which is more meaningful to you , and you 'll recognize the movie in your memory . The basic plot is about an American girl and her family moves from California to France for a better life . But things are not as smooth as she expected and she finds that French life is different from what she expected . The story is really cute and it 's really easy to enjoy the movie .

This was on odd film . I liked the adventure of it though it seems to be aimed at children. I did not know there was ever a movie of it before but it's not a bad one. I do not understand what the film is saying or why there is a story behind it but it does have some good acting from the main actors and the special effects are very good indeed. I do not think it would be suitable for older children or young adults. I liked this film a lot.

After seeing Meredith in `` Beyond the Prairie '' I had to buy another film with her staring . I had to see this one too. I'm so glad i did . I like the fact that it's different then the other ones that we have seen in this genre . This one had some good laughs . This is not a stand-alone movie. It is a story that can be followed after the other movies. But the story is only about 30% of the movie. So, if you like one of the first four, you will probably enjoy this one.

It 's interesting to watch how late 1950 's society is depicted in this film . Men are lecherous , women are manipulative , children are selfish and adults are apathetic . However it 's a very well written script and the acting is well done . An adaptation of the popular book 'The Feminine Mistake ' . The original novel was about a young woman who is seduced by one of her teachers . The film , though , is about a middle aged man , married to an older woman and having a relationship with a much younger , married woman .

As a European, the movie is a nice throwback to my time as a student in the 1980's and the experiences I had living abroad and interacting with other nationalities, although the circumstances were slightly different. Klapisch (the director) went to the New York Film School from 1982-85, so one would think that he is drawing on this experience.It is interesting how the film balances the message that "one should not generalize" with the notion that "for every stereotype, there is some underlying truth". For example, the Italian character is based more on the pothead aspect than on any well-known Italian stereotype.

`5 Years ago if you were to watch an Australian film you would expect to see crocodile hunters, stories of war, drag queens, kangaroos and koalas, and Australians in general being represented as nitwits living off the land, saying words like cobber' and generally being the classic underdog.Luckily Australian film has evolved over the last couple years and is churning out modern day classics' such as Blackrock, Moulin Rouge, Chopper, Yolngu Boy and Sample People.In this evolution of film we also find Two Hands.Set in Sydney's Kings Cross, Two Hands is a black comedy about crime and survival in the rough end of town.

An stunning look at the ocean and the life in it.The Good:The camera work was absolutely phenomenal. Every shot is done beautifully.It was interesting seeing all the different animals that I could have never even imagined.David Attenborough has the perfect narrator's voice. No one could have done any better.The Bad:There were one or two different times where there was a reference to the Earth being 1 million years old ( I hold a different belief). Overall a TV series anyone can enjoy. I highly recommend buying it. 10/10 stars.

In my opinion dads army is thee best British sitcom of all time . I believe that if you just googled 'Best British comedy' it would show dads army in the top three , it is a genius sitcom . If you haven't watched it , watch it and see for yourself how brilliant it is , it's brilliant , brilliant , brilliant , brilliant , brilliant... It is not a sitcom about family, it is a family sitcom. If you're referring to Dad's Army then I've already said that it's the best of the British comedy series.

I really think this movie deserves some Oscars! I really don't care what people can say badly about this movie...because it's a really well played parts from Samuel L. Jackson, and mainly by Christina Ricci!! I'm a big fan of hers, right since I saw her in Addams Family...been trying to watch all things she makes, and this is absolutely one of the best parts she played!! I love her looks (even though people say she's not pretty...I think she is...and I love her eyes)!!

I'm seen this documentary in its feature-form, in a movie theatre. And... wouah! The pictures are astonishing, one really wonder how by Jove did they manage to film those waves, those animals, those... is that a plant ? a predator ? a creature from the movie Abbyss ? Anyway, it's remarkable. Sure we've seen a lot of such documentary on TV, with weird animals and so on, but none with such a beauty, a precision, a deep emotion. The only downside is the commentary.

i love this movie . is it on air anymore ? what can i do to get it on air , i live in florida . i have the movie in VHS and also in Dvds i got it in the mail , i live in Orlando . please help me find this movie for me , thank you . hey guys, i’m looking for an old horror movie that i watched when i was a kid. I’ve only got the VHS and I remember that it was really scary. There was a dark tunnel, and I think someone came out of it.

I absolutely fell in love with this girls . let me tell you something : I am from Romania and it is a beautiful thing to get to know some girls from all over the world ! First of all I want to thank to this site for being so nice and for this beautiful girl for giving me such a pleasure . Hi, my name is Marius and I am 17 years old boy living in Bucharest (Romania). It's my first time and I think it will be my last to do this thing, but I didn't want it to go away so fast.

I saw this fine flick shortly leaving college. As I sat there happily watching Alice go from repressed virgin to sexual adventurer, I got to wondering why her sexual encounters seemed familiar. Then I remembered-- Intro Psych 101 Lecture! One of the lectures dealt with the Psycho-Sexual Stages of Developement, basically the shift over time on what part of the body and its attendant stimulations gets our main attention, as well as the changing emphasis on what gives us pleasure. Alice's first encounter is being bathed, with emphasis on the genitals and bottom.

The Further Adventures of Ma and Pa Kettle almost seamlessly picks up where The Egg and I left off . It’s 1939, just before the beginning of WW2. The Kettles, along with their daughter and a friend, are on a trans-continental road trip back home to Iowa, when they get involved in a minor accident. They decide to stay in a nearby town and wait for a mechanic to take a look under the hood. There the trio meets the local mayor, whose car had a flat tire. The mayor’s mechanic is black.

10 respected directors each shot a short film with operatic arias as the inspiration (and music). I'll do each one separately:Nicolas Roeg (dir)--Giuseppe Verdi (music). A story about an assassination attempt in 1931 Vienna. Theresa Russell (Roegs wife) plays a man! Not bad--very beautiful and exotic. Russell is great.Charles Sturridge--Verdi. No story but there is some haunting black and white imagery that fits perfectly with the music.Jean-Luc Godard--Jean Baptiste Lully. Horrendous. Pointless, boring, no plot, no nothing.

Great period piece that shows how attitudes have changed in 40 years. Great production design, appealing stars, great lines ("Miss Bender, I don't care if you beat it out on a native drum! ", says Joan Crawford's Amanda Farrow to Hope Lange when Lange incredulously asks how she is expected to read a summarize a large amount of manuscripts in a very short time). If you've seen this movie panned and scanned on TV and not in the letterboxed version on pay-TV or AMC (American Movie Classics) you haven't really seen it.

This is a film that is far more enjoyable than its rating of 7 would suggest . In many ways its an extremely entertaining film with a terrific performance from Robert Duvall as the villain . In other ways however the film has some rather glaring weaknesses in its storytelling . But these problems are all part of the charm of this film . It’s quite a fun time . The film begins in present day where an elderly man ( Robert Duvall ) sits in a chair at a nursing home . He has no idea who he is or what his story is .

I went straight to the big screen to view this kicker. This is the only flick that I know of that Tarsem Singh has directed but boy was it intense. This movie was a total mind stimulant and one of the best special effects flick of this kind.The characters were vibrant and and nothing short of beings created in your own mind or nightmare. This movie is scary and interesting and totally bombs the senses with fear and exhilaration. This movie compares to no other I have seen except for the level of being beautifully odd. In that respect it is a fairly large step above `A Clockwork Orange.'

honestly .. this show warms my heart , i watch it EVERYDAY on fox family and now that the new season has begun it all gets more interesting . the new season was great and the new characters that are coming in i hope they are all good or i might lose interest . i hope they bring in some really good stories and i hope that we see some characters die so i can start over and i hope the show is as entertaining and heartwarming as last season . i hope the new show comes on this summer .

George Cukor is and always will be one of my favorites. The unsung hero of his generation. Nobody mentions Cukor in the same breath as John Ford, Howard Hawks, William Wyler or Billy Wilder and yet, look at his filmography. From sparkling comedies "The Philadelphia Story" "Adam's Rib" "Holiday" Psycho melodramas "Gaslight" "A Double Life" a great semi western "Heller in Pink Tights" not to mention "My Fair Lady" or "Travels with my Aunt" He was at the service of his actors, he never put himself in front of the camera.

Just watched Conrack for the first time . Although the last third of the movie leaves something to be desired, I thought it was terrific. The acting was great and the story is very good. It is about a small group of people on a ship who come across a treasure of gold. There's no real conclusion to the story though. It's not about the treasure or what happens when it's gone. It's about the people in the story. The characters are very interesting and well developed in my opinion.

It happens often, while growing up, a Hollywood movie impresses a youth. It not only lasts a lifetime, but inspire him to study ancient cultures as a career. Such was the case, with the 1954 film entitled "The Egyptian." Audience were awed with the sets, costumes and great acting of this film, so much so, other films soon followed in like vain. This is the story of a young Egyptian boy who was left parent less soon after he was born. With such a dubious beginning, it is not hard to wonder why he will spend his life, asking questions.

I had no expectations when I started to watch this movie. How surprised I was! This is a great, beautiful, twisted movie which will give your mind a good work-out! It's not simple. If you only enjoy Police Academy style, no-brains movies, this is not for you. The Cell is a deep, complex film with influences from movies like Cube, Silence of the Lambs and The Lawnmower Man, along with lots of completely new ideas. Wonderful, twisted environments, good acting and a compelling story makes this one of the best films I have seen in a long time!

I saw this film on the same night I saw 6 other shorts. This one was leaps and bounds ahead of the others in terms of quality of acting, directing, filming and originality of story. It comes together with a professionalism often lacking in short films.This is a great short film for the following reasons: 1. Amazing performances. The 2 actresses are both compelling and believable instantly. Their chemistry is palpable; the depth of their relationship is conveyed, even though the film is 10 mins long. The acting and directing are very powerful.2. Beautifully shot.

Almost 20 years before Frank Marshall brought tears to your eyes with his mesmerizing epic "Alive", there already was the legendary Mexican exploitation director René Cardona who used the same drama as an outline for his ambitious film "Supervivientes de los Andes". The unforgettable fatal flight of Fairchild 571 that crashed in the Argentinian Andes on October 13, 1972. This terrible accident cost the lives of many passengers, most of them members of a professional rugby team. But 16 people of them were eventually rescued thanks to their strong will to survive and because they fed on the mortal remains of their unfortunate fellow-passengers.

George Cuckor , known as a director of women , could n't have hoped for two more talented and beautiful actresses to play opposite one another in any of the films he directed. They had both won Academy Awards as best actress, and were two of the greatest movie stars of the 1930s -- Jean Harlow and Carole Lombard. In the early morning hours of July 1, 1932, Lombard's house was burglarized. The burglars stole some jewelry and cash but also took several of the most important items of her collection: her passport, her driver's license and her Academy Award.

Almost four years after the Iraq war started and we're in a bigger hole than ever. That's right, so all those flag wavers who were so sure of the right and might of the American way are now chasing their tails, isn't that true? You bet it is. This movie said so from the beginning. It is kind of freaky how much the film,or should I say, filmmaker, knew what was coming. It is almost like going to a fortune teller and hearing what was going to happen in the future.

this is a really great series . i love the show and i am so glad it is n't canceled. i love all the charactors especially gabrielle who is my idol lol

Ok this show is not the greatest but I must say I love it. And I am not even a fan of this genre. I think that it would be a good idea to let the fans vote to decide whether this show will get canceled. If the fans vote it will get canceled and that is why people are complaining. So it is not fair for the critics and the fans to let the show get canceled.

I must say it was a let down. Overall its great to see the way Aparna Sen has handled the issue of schizophrenia, I am not much knowledgeable on this and got whatever it was depicted in A Beautiful Mind, and here too its interesting portrayal.But the thing that caused the let down for me was the artificial dialogues and over use of English. Its true that a new class is being formed/ has been formed in India which talks in English even at home, but I am sure its not as formal as in the movie. Moreover, Waheeda Rehmaan did not seem very comfortable talking everything in English.

I would give this movie high marks for the cinema-photography and performances. I just read a user comment concerning the performance of the actress who plays a conniving courtesan who fleeces Sinuoeh, the lead character. I remember a mini-biography of this actress following the movie the last time I saw it. Apparently, she was a Holocaust refugee, discovered by a French husband and wife in the movie industry who were taken with her extraordinary beauty. She died very young and under tragic circumstances. Gene Tierney is also outstanding in this film.

Forget about Donnie Darko . I open with this because it seems that a good portion of the reviews I've read for the movie have focused more on this aspect of the movie than the actual movie. The fact is, as a stand-alone piece of art, Donnie Darko is a pretty bad movie. I don't think anyone can reasonably argue otherwise. But when the film is placed within its cultural context it is an entirely different animal entirely. The cultural context is where Donnie's brilliance lies. Without that context, this film would be a pretty good movie at worst, and at best an over-wrought art film.

This was a pretty good episode . Though no `` Trapped in the Closet '' or `` Cartoon Wars , '' this did have a few laughs and had a great premise . This time they were trapped in the bathroom . The setup is pretty cool . A woman is in the bathroom getting a facial when her son walks in and sees her in the mirror . He is so freaked out by the situation he pulls the toilet paper out of the roll and wraps it all around his body so he can be in the other room . Then he pulls the shower curtain down to the bathroom so no one will know .

The philosophical , meditative tone of this movie renders it one of a kind . I 'd give it 10/10 without a doubt . If you didn't see it in the theaters then I can assure you that you will be seeing this on DVD soon. The DVD is coming out on August 9th. This is the kind of film that you should own in your movie library. This film is definitely worth the watch and I'm glad that you have the chance to see it on the big screen as well. This film is rated R and it is for those adults who have an appetite for this kind of film.

Being an avid Carpenter Fan , I really loved this film ( although the wigs do leave a lot to be desired !). I'm not a big fan of the Carpenter movies because I think he only has two good ones, " Halloween " , and ' The Fog '. However, I think this film has some of the best parts of the Carpenter movies and I'm glad that it's getting a remastered Blu-ray release from Scream Factory on the 23rd of November. My favorite parts of this movie are :1) Laurie's (Scream's) transformation.

I saw this film at the 2005 Palm Springs International Film Festival. I went in with the assumption that if it stars Chiwetel Ejiofor and Hilary Swank it had to be at least decent. Well, after a kind of a slow start, I was far from disappointed. In fact, I was quite pleased with the final product.I must admit the Afrikaaner and Xhosa(?) accented English of some of the actors were kind of hard to understand but like seeing "Waking Ned Devine", "Trainspotting" or any other film with heavy-accented actors I adjusted after about 15 minutes.

This was a pretty good episode. Though no "Trapped in the Closet" or "Cartoon Wars," it had a lot of things going for it. The character of Al Gore and that bizarre-as-hell "super cereal" thing was pretty darn funny. But, the scene that made me adore this episode was one I'm sure everyone will agree was one of the greatest Cartman/Kyle moments ever. When Cartman is superstitious of Kyle that he'll be stealing his gold(which of course is fake! ), and he comes within inches of his face.

In the midst of a documentary about his parents, the filmmaker's mother dies, but he continues making the documentary, discovering a story he did not anticipate. The result is an absorbing drama that has the quality of fiction in the best sense of that word, where a likable but unknowing narrator unwittingly privileges the audience. The narrative thus has a double weave, the story of the documentary and the story of the documentary-maker.Our admiration is with the filmmaker, not only for doggedly pursuing his story though it risks his entire notion of his parents' relationship, but also for never giving in to sensationalism or melodrama.

Nurse Betty was definitely one of the most creative movies that 's been released lately . It was funny , smart and just all around well worth the watch . It was also a very different type of comedy which I really did not expect to get from a movie . This was the kind of comedy that actually made you laugh as much as I did . I know what you may be thinking at this point in reading my review , "Sure she thinks it's a movie about nurses but what did she really think it was about ? "

I do n't usually like to see movies while they 're still in theaters because of high ticket prices but I did this time because the kids wanted to. It is a very popular movie with lots of action and suspense. The film is well done and the kids liked it. This one is definitely one that I 'm sure you 'll want to go see! I really enjoyed this book, and I liked the way the story unfolded. I 've read other books with the same concept but this book was original and the characters were very well written.

It would be something to try and tell someone what Fata Morgana is very simply about. Or, maybe it isn't: Herzog goes to the Sahara desert and nearby villages to film assorted landscapes and the locals. But this is just the broadest stroke. It's a feat that you either surrender yourself to, or you don't. He gets into the form of the world around him entirely, without a story, bound only to certain aspects of written poetry, as his camera (shooting on supposedly discarded film stock) wanders like in a pure travelogue.

This movie just might make you cooooo. The film was WELL worth the dark trip to town. Betty (Renee Zellweger)is the lone "acceptable" soap groupie out there. Her character is SO charming and SO convincing that you find yourself in forgiveness over her being such a goof. I might even allow myself to get lost in Bettys' adorable fantasy, if it weren't for the fact that Dr. Ravell's real name is George... And speak of the devil; "looker" Greg Kinnear fills his role VERY well.

In `` Black Snake Moan , '' writer-director Craig Brewer is so obsessed with heavy symbolism that part of me wanted to just skip the movie all together, just so that the message could finally get through. It's about a white teenager who, after being held captive and brutalized for three months by a serial rapist, kills him in a hail of bullets. When the police come for her, they find that she had a tattoo of a black snake wrapped around a white skull. I didn't understand how a movie with this kind of symbolism could even exist.

I have n't seen a film in a long time that moved me and gripped me in such a way that I could never forget it. “Black Panther” is such a film. It was released in February of this year and had the largest number of screenings in a theater I have ever experienced. I know I am in the minority in my feelings towards this movie and that it is probably going to be heavily condemned by most people who read these articles. However, I will still explain why it is so incredible. First off, the production values are mind-blowingly impressive.

This film predates the Australian films Road Warrior and Priscilla of the Desert , and its influence on them is obvious. In particular, it has a very strong effect on Road Warrior , which began filming a month after this finished. I've always been fond of this film, but I don't recall much from it that I found particularly memorable, and that may be the case with others as well, though there are some elements that I really like. I'm not even sure if I like it as well as it's predecessor, though there's certainly an influence of it in that film.

It happens often , while growing up , a Hollywood movie impresses a youth . It not only lasts a long time , but it also changes his or her life forever . I remember , it was one such movie that changed my life as a child . As I grew up I realized that this movie was not just a nice piece of entertainment . It changed my life in many ways and for many years . It was the movie ‘THE DARK KNIGHT’ directed by Christian Bale . It was this movie that started me on a journey to become a screenwriter .

Daffy Duck has signs hanging from every inch of every available tree announcing that it's rabbit season. But, you guessed it - it's really duck season. Elmer Fudd appears: he's the only hunter dumb enough to fall for the gag.He's even dumber than that. When Bugs Bunny strides up to him and asks how the rabbit hunting is going, Elmer admits that he hasn't seen a rabbit yet. This is more than Daffy can stand. He emerges from his hiding place and immediately points to a rabbit: Bugs Bunny. "Shoot him now!"

I watched this film in a Singapore theatre yesterday ( 4 February , 2006 ) and came away with a different perspective. I did so not as a critic, but as a film goer. What I realised from watching this film in a Singapore cinema yesterday is that this is a film not for the West. This is a film for the East, and specifically Singapore. For the simple fact that it is set in Singapore. If you are from the West , I believe this film has not much to offer you ( unless you live here in Singapore ).

`` Two Hands '' is an entertaining , funny story about Australian lowlifes . The screenplay contrasts the world of small town life in New South Wales with the modern world of city life . The plot centers on the actions of a young schoolteacher who finds himself drawn to the life of a gang member . The movie '' Two Hands '' has received mixed reviews from critics in the United States . Many of the people who enjoy the movie in the United States see the movie as a low budget version of the '' Reservoir Dogs '' . But '' Two Hands '' has also been well received in the United States .

This was the one movie to see about the Civi War. My aunt actually played in this movie as an extra in the Justin and Madeline wedding scene, and my uncle was an extra on a horse. The script was genuine, and accurate. The costumes were tastefully done, the seqence was in order and even the accents were good. I dearly love Patrick Swayze and James Ried. They were the best 2 choices, and it even had a great supporting cast. The Civil War is my favorite thing in American History, and I love movies about it.

Gregory Peck and Gig Young are competing for the same girl and after Peck sends Young on a very dangerous mission, Young takes his place to carry on the fight for his life. Young also has to save his own life. But in the end, neither man wins, both men lose, and we find that neither man really had it all that wrong. When I was young, I hated the idea of romantic movies. I thought they were too corny. I never thought that they were any more than corny.

This is how I interpreted the movie: First things first. There was not a single scene in the movie where u see the bad guy (Taylor) torturing or nailing Ben's hands to the wall. However the same cannot be told of the gals. In the end too, u see Taylor disappear as he walks. Looks like the message there was "There was no Taylor". And the whole movie was a figment of imagination of Ben. Also, there was no scene during the torturing moments wherein any of the gals confront or are in the same frame as Ben.

One of the biggest French success of the year 2002 , `` l'auberge espagnole '' was also very well greeted in Spain , with more than 12 million spectators . The film was very successful at home , and its total box office was around 150 millions of francs . The plot is relatively simple , in a small hotel in the south of France in the early seventies where there is the son of a famous detective ( Philippe Torreton ) . The hotel is run by a couple with a daughter of 21 ( Marie-France Valois ) , and his son ( Pierre Sabatier) .

The movie is good and I think Tiffany Amber is very beautiful . I liked the movie . Can anyone suggest any more movies that are similar in this genre? Thank you

I've been a fan of this type of story since I first saw "The Twilight Zone" episode about a guy living in the future who meets an old friend and they reminisce of their life in the past. That was in the first year I got a television, around 1959 I think. That's the one I first saw and I have loved that type of story ever since, it's the most fun one.

I like movies that show real people `` Americans '' and tell truth . The movie is simple and that is a good thing about it . The characters are real and that is a bad thing about it . When a movie shows real life it makes us think of real life . And this movie does that very thing. In this movie we see people who are afraid of something happening . And that is all we see in the movie . It is about the fear that people have . We see no action in the movie . Just the fear that these people have .

Rabbit Seasoning is one of three cartoons that feature Bugs Bunny/Daffy Duck/Elmer Fudd in a war of words and wits about whether it's rabbit season or duck season. Love Bugs and Daffy stirring up "pronoun trouble" with Daffy always the victim of Elmer's shotgun resulting with his beak always getting dismembered. Then there's the rabbit's cross-dressing that always gets Elmer in his love struck mode. Chuck Jones and Michael Maltese are always favorites of mine in the writer-director team category because of these hilarious hunting trilogy cartoons I've laughed at since I was a kid.

I'm not gonna lie. To say that this movie is confusing is like saying the sun is hot but not really. And if you've seen cult director Richard Kelly's previous films, "Donnie Darko" and "Southland Tales," you know that's gotta mean something. When I went to see this movie, there were about 50 people in the theater. Before an hour into the film, about half of the audience had already walked out. By the end, there were only 15 people left wondering what in the hell did they just see.

The Killing Yard is a great film, although uneven at times. Morris Chestnut puts forth a phenomenal effort as a mentally wounded and judicially jilted prison inmate, and the presence of Alan Alda as his defense attorney is none other than genius. The emotion and raw reality portrayed in this film's "flashback" scenes have the ability of putting viewers directly into the midst of the events being pictured. I was not even born when the Attica riot took place, however, through extensive research, I find that "The Killing Yard" does the story all of it's fair justices.

1981 's Just Before Dawn is one of the best tales of wilderness horror out there . It 's one of the most brutal horror films I 've ever seen as well. It is also one of the best examples of how to write a film with an original idea while still telling a decent and well-crafted story. It 's also one of my personal favorites among Stephen King stories. The plot is well-written, well-paced and well-executed, even though it is an original idea and not something already written before by him. The story is about a couple of teenagers that are camping out for the summer in New England.

Pity the poor reviewer who disliked / didn't understand this wonderful film. What a sad life he must lead!This movie has more to say about life and relationships than most I've ever seen, yet it's not dark or preachy like the "ordinary people" type of film. It is mostly humorous, though not technically a comedy.The whole thing feels a little like a fantasy, perhaps Shakespear's "Midsummer Nights' Dream." Beautiful, intelligent women abound, with wonderful cinematography and a non-insulting screenplay that doesn't miss a beat.I look forward to seeing it every time this film is re-run on cable.

Having read the other comment about this superb piece of TV drama I felt compelled to balance things a little, and so I offer my (rather less complimentary) take on 'The Missing'. If you want to know where you stand with this kind of drama, read on...

First things first. When the programme was first announced I thought: "Oh please, let this be good - it needs to be, after all!" And it was. The BBC drama, which ran for two series of five episodes each, has become a very good, well-crafted and thoughtfully-made piece of TV.

This is a really great film ! It gets you thinking about your parents . How we all have fragile little egos that we protect as much as possible from ourselves and others . It is a hard concept to grasp at times because it takes a huge amount of self-knowledge to get to that place of understanding . It will help you to better understand why some people need so much love and attention from you. It also shows how difficult it is to accept that your parents didn't always want to be the best people for you and still you feel compelled to be the best for them.

When I saw the preview for this movie , I figured to myself , `` here 's another dumb TV-movie where the hero is an astronaut and his love interest is another astronaut. ' So , I wasn 't exactly blown away , but I still thought it was worth checking out . The first half hour or so or the movie was a little dull , with a good looking cast and good production values , but , the rest of it was pretty dull too . At first , the hero of this story , an astronaut named Sam (Jason London ) , gets into trouble on a space mission to some distant planet .

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are `` Blue '' . I think I heard it mentioned in an interview and it stuck with me the whole time . I don't know what the heck that is supposed to mean , but whatever , if it means being more aware of all this shit , then why the fuck wouldn't we be more aware , right ? The thing that makes me feel like an ass is the part where you say , "Oh , no , not like that , you mean being aware of it 's not a bad thing , just different " .

This twisted comedy is well acted and directed. Very funny and the production quality is outstanding. It is easy to see why this short film has been accepted into so many festivals and won awards.Everyone can identify with Calvin having a bad day, bad week, bad life. Travis Davis plays the role superbly! Richard Moll as Tim brings darkness and foreboding that gives this film just the right twistedness. The old man adds to the humor of the story. And who wouldn't love the suicidal goldfish!This short will bring lots of laughs.

Absolutely , I agree with my previous commentator in describing this as a riveting , fascinating and certainly beautiful film. In terms of what we are doing , we are doing it in part because of this film. This film, in my view, illustrates in a very direct way and in a very simple way, what this group is doing and I would suggest to you, ladies and gentlemen, that the things we have said about this, the things we have said about what has gone on previously , the things we have said about what goes on today is not new and certainly not original.

Forget about the plot of this movie . Forget about the fact that it is wonderfully acted by Vince Vaughn ( I would have liked him to have played it straight, though), or the fact that it is a great thriller . I would like to know what it is about because I have seen this movie at least 50 times now, but I just don't get it . The best I can do is give you my opinion of this movie, and I will do that to make sure that you, the readers of this review, get to see the movie, too, when you read it.

First of all , ignore the comment about how South Park should make fun of Republicans . Everyone is doing that , and it is not really funny. It was made a few months after the 2008 election, so it is an obvious attempt to mock the left , and make it easy to ridicule them . It is also a poor attempt. It's not funny, and you're not being funny. And it doesn't matter, because it's just an attempt . South Park isn't there to mock every single issue , or mock the left .

Even for a 17 year old student who loves history and caught glimpses of emotion and excitement in his childhood years of this series, its coming to DVD was a blessing for all time. North and South truly is a series about friendship,love,honor... you name your own list of feelings you get from watching this series. I can still remember the first time I caught a glimpse of this series on TV when I was about 8 years old. I though wow this looks exciting. To bad I never had the chance to see book one and two on TV in the Netherlands.

I saw Riverdance - The New Show and loved it from the very first moment! It is an energetic tribute to Irish dance filled with brilliant dancing, music and choreography! The leads, Jean Butler and Colin Dunne had me captivated with their exquisite dancing! May they always keep shining and keep dancing. Their on stage chemistry was amazing, and the unity between them on stage was obvious. They look like they were made to dance with each other! This show is my absolute favourite, and probably always will be. Long Live Riverdance!

North and South is a miniseries from the `` golden age '' of television miniseries in the 1980s , which was broadcast on BBC2 in three weekly episodes on Wednesday nights at 7.00 pm in the first half of November 1983 . Based on the events of the American Civil War from 1861 to 1865 , it is set during a year when the Confederate States of America were fighting to keep their independence from a United States in the process of forming, and during which many battles were fought on both sides of the border . Although the miniseries was a success, it was not well received by its audience when it came out.

This is a very well done film showing the life of international students during their "Erasmus year" in Barcelona which by the way is one of the most beautiful towns in Europe and is an ideal location. The idea itself with all the different languages is great and gives the film an original atmosphere. There are some clichés about the countries but most of them are true! The characters could not better represent their different countries.Having experienced "Erasmus" on myself during my exchang semester in Italy I can say that is movie is incredibly authentic.

This is a simple episode ad so far after watching all of the Season 11 episodes (with the exception of the Imaginationland trilogy) this is the one that made laugh the most, definitely is my favourite so far of Season 11. So basically Cartman sees at a toy store a kid who has the Tourette's syndrome and a new idea comes to Cartman. You can imagine, now Cartman has Tourette's syndrome and is great since Kyle once he knows about this is like "he's faking". Cartman is certainly on fire, saying whatever he wants to the teachers, to the principal, to anybody.

Just see it! It's a smart movie but too hard to understand the first time. See it more than once. Everything that is seen or heard on the screen is intentionally crafted to evoke a feeling, sensation or tone. The clarity of certain visuals and the crispness of certain sounds are deliberately contrasted with blurred images or pops, crackles, hisses and barely audible sounds. The structure is non-linear and cyclical. Motifs recur as time runs both clockwise and counterclockwise. Expectations regarding "plot" and character" are broken signaling a non-traditional use of film to tell a story that is both contemporary and as old as humanity.

First love. Teenage love. We all have experienced it even if it was not as sweet as the one the protagonists share. "Friends" could be considered an adaptation of the classic "The Blue Lagoon", originally from 1949, and its remakes from 1980 (the most popular one, with Brooke Shields) and 1999 (with a young Milla Jovovich). While "The Blue Lagoon" puts the two young lovers in a desert island, with no contact with civilization, "Friends" goes the opposite route and it is sure to ring much more true and be a more difficult movie with contemporary audiences.

spoiler--In 1993, African-American director/actor Mario Van Peebles followed up the tremendously popular urban-action film New Jack City with "Posse". The film was co-written and directed by Van Peebles, who also stars as the main character, Jessie Lee.Plot: The film begins at the turn of the 20th century, when the United States was embroiled in the Spanish-American war. Apparently a time when the U.S. justice system could send convicts into military service, Jessie Lee finds himself an unwilling enlisted man, serving with an all-black cavalry troop in Cuba.

The year 1950 saw two very different and interesting westerns: 'The Gunfighter' by Henry King, and 'Wagon Master' by John Ford. 'The Gunfighter' was historically notable as it clearly influenced Zimmerman's 'High Noon' (1951) and later revisionist westerns.However, I personally find 'Wagon Master' superior to it's contemporary counterpart. Ford's minor masterpiece isn't much about storytelling; it should be conceived more as a poem describing conceptions of old west.
