Although optimistic and warm at heart, we are deserved from naivety because it's completely free from pretentious underscoring.

This is definitely one of the better documentaries I have seen looking at family relationships and marriage. I saw "capturing the friedmans" a short while ago and have to admit I thought this was better.The story is not an incredibly shocking one, but it is a great examination of trapped personalities and relational cold war. Block deftly guides the viewer through diaries, family footage and after-the-fact interviews; his interview style is sensitive and probing, and his insights are clear and measured.51 Birch Street is a great examination of personalities and relationships over 40-50 years of social change, the social fallout, and potential for redemption.

I wanted to watch this, to get a inside look at the show. It told the story more of Robin Williams, then Mork & Mindy. Still, thought it was great. We got to see, Robin always being 'on', no matter what. The performance of Diamontopolous was awesome.The introductions of the main players, seem so real to me. Roebuck as Garry Marshall was wonderful. He was so charming in this, which helped me get through all the Williams energy. The little behind the scenes pieces of his other shows (Happy Days, and Laverne & Shirley), was enlightening.

I thought I was wasting my precious 50 bucks going to watch this movie. But at the earnest request of my friend who is an ardent fan of Aparna Sen, I decided to turn up for the movie. Going at this cheap theater really bothered me, cos I had seen King Kong for 50 bucks at one of the best theatres in town. Anywasy the movie starts of and surprisingly I wasn't complaining. A great story and some really wonderful wonderful acting on Shabana Azmi and Konkona Sen Sharma's part. Shabana Azmi a divorcée who has dedicated her life to the well being of her mother and step sister.

I saw the movie in 1972, and like other people who have commented on it here ... I went back many more times to see it over and over ... I think 9 times in all. Just great is how I would describe it ... I was taken by the sound track, the beautiful panoramas of the south of France, the life style the kids began on their own. An ideal way to live is what they had set up ... of course the powers that be have to intercede, but when I forget that part I find myself wanting to be in the movie and live like that!

Forget about the plot of this movie. Forget about the fact that it is wonderfully acted by Vince Vaughn and Vincend D'Onofrio. Forget about the fact that it is one of the few movies starring Jennifer Lopez that I can stomach. Although the story made be impossible to believe and much of the dialogue seems contrived, the one and only important thing to remember when contemplating watching this movie is that it contains some of the most amazing and disturbing imagery ever put on film. It is as if Salvador Dali decided to make a crime drama.

It would be something to try and tell someone what Fata Morgana is very simply about . Or , maybe , to have the experience yourself . I have found it can be a very good experience , but I can't say anything to anyone who is new to this . It really is just like a dream and you can choose to go where you want in it . I have found that there are some things that make me happy and some things that make me sad , but overall , it's not like any normal dream you might have . It is just for me .

As I was reading through the comments , I was surprised to come across one that said this movie was better than the actual Star Wars . I'm not a Star Trek fan and the first two movies I didn't enjoy all that much but for this movie I liked it better than the original trilogy ( and I don't like the new one much ). It had good action , good story , good acting . I loved the first two Star Wars movies because of the way it told a story. I had no idea how Luke, Leia and Han would be involved in a war.

Bluff I really think this movie is very good.Is basic a different kind of Colombian movie. Is hilarious and the actors uses local expressions that are so much fund to listen.It shows a different face o Bogotá and I think that's very important because Colombia is a diverse country and we need to show that to the world This is the first movie of the director Felipe Martinez and I really except this movie will be the beginning of a great career as a film director.We need to continue support Colombian filming industry, because this movie and others good films are the beginning of something big.

I have wracked my brain for another film that reminds me of this one . I really ca n't come up with another, but I will keep searching. If you know of any others, let me know in the comment section. I'm not interested in any remakes, just films with a similar feel and atmosphere . I'm not into horror/thriller/comedy/romance/gangster type of movies. I am not into big budget movies with big name stars and big effects. If the budget is low to medium then you can bet I will love it, no matter if it is a remake or not.

So we saw this on DVD at our apartment here in Paris . We 're all here on an exchange program in Paris and so I saw the movie here. It didn't make a lot of sense so we watched it back at our place and then we went out and looked for something else to watch on DVD that we thought would make sense . We bought this movie and that's what we watched it at home. I'm going to talk about the movie. So we're going to talk about the movie . Okay. Let's talk about the film.

I guess my husband and I are a little slow . We do n't usually warm up to a series in a few episodes but we did with these two and were really hooked. It is about a guy named Will Graham ,who is a psychologist who has a relationship with a girl who is having multiple personalities . This is based on the book by a man named Robert D . Harris . The book was called " Multiple Personalities" and was published in 1981. It is a good book to read. The show was based on this book and there was a tv series made from the book.

The Gilmore girls is about a mother who had a daughter when she was 16. Now the daughter is 16 (in season 1) and they live like sisters. Sharing everything, trusting each other completely.I like The Gilmore Girls but I am not sure why. The mother, named Lorelai (Lauren Graham), and the daughter, named Rory (short for Lorelai, played by Alexis Bledel), are both very beautiful women, they are both funny and they are charming in their own ways. There are some funny supporting characters, such as Luke (Scott Patterson).

In "Black Snake Moan," writer-director Craig Brewer is so obsessed with heavy symbolism that part of me felt like dismissing the entire film as pretentious--a sweltering Southern parable with some oh-so-risky subject matter. The movie also contains a heavy spiritual subtext where religion is being hauled into the picture--again, this is integrated without subtlety. After the darker opening scenes, the film increasingly blunts its edge until the entire production comes off with the artificial quality of a stage play (and I'll admit, the last 15 minutes go way too far into "Happy Ending" territory for my liking).

This story has held a special place in my heart for the last thirty-one years . As a boy , I spent my summers camping and hiking in the Rocky Mountains in Banff, Alberta . At the time, I had absolutely no idea of what was in store for me when I met and fell in love with my wife . The summer of 1975 was magical and memorable in more ways than one. My wife and I went camping , hiking and canoeing through the Rockies . In the process, we met a few people that changed our lives.

Not knowing a great deal about the Truth and Reconciliation commission , I can only look at this as a good thing. It will help people understand the past and, perhaps, help prevent the re-occurrence in the future. We can't forget the horrors of the past, and we need to learn from them to ensure that the future will be better for all Australians, black and white. It would be great to see an official statement from the government regarding the commission, to ensure that all citizens can celebrate and learn from this important moment for all Australians.

This show is really great. It's smart.It's funny.It's great acting and writing. This show is really the fastest show I've ever seen. The Dialogues are really funny and well acted. Lauren Graham and Alexis Bledel have a great chemistry.You really do believe they are mother and daughter. This show really showed that mother daughter relationships really don't have to be just mother and daughter, they can be best friends but on the same time it shows that it's really hard sometimes being more than just mother and daughter especially with Lorelai and Emily.

Fantastic documentary . A movie within a movie . I 'm so glad Block forged on after his Mother 's Passing . As much as this movie is great and worth seeing (and I do , because it's so inspiring ) , I'm glad I saw the documentary first , because I want to give a more personal review. It 's very inspiring to see and hear these people talk about how they got into the business and how they've overcome all obstacles . I 'm not gonna lie . It was great to see the interviews , but more than the interviews , it was great to actually see this movie .

Surprisingly good made for T.V. Thriller. I wasn't expecting too much from this one but I'm glad to say that this is one of the best of it's kind. It's fast paced and features solid acting and interesting events. The story gets you hooked on since the beginning and with many hits, you can't help but find the movie very interesting.The background story of Thiessen's character is hard but it turns into a nightmare when her husband is something much worse than her childhood friend's step father.The "stranger" concept and his actions are disturbing if you consider that it is a common disease in society.

Blue Planet ... Wow ... Where do I begin ? The years of hard work paid off in what is arguably one of my most favourite pictures I have taken. This shot took over 2 days to compose as there are so many different aspects that can be considered, some obvious, some hidden. I spent a very happy two days in Bali in October 2009, as a guest of the Indonesian Marine Biologist association (IBA) who organised a workshop where I met a few very talented marine photographers who shared their techniques with me.

The tunes are the best aspect of this television film which has admittedly better-than-average production values, but very surface and slightly altered biography. Dramatizes Richard's discovery of "We've Only Just Begun" and Karen's marriage troubles admirably (the "Superstar" montage was a nice touch), yet notably leaves out the disagreement with Neil Sedaka, the contribution of Tony Peluso's guitar solos, etc. Gibb is sweet in her Karen persona, but it doesn't include the tomboyish and gutsier sides of the real Carpenter's personality.

Brilliant film! I am sorry to say that it resembles to me a bit like Pulp F. but thats how it is with post pulp era. Many pictures get automatically likened to it for only being a gangster flick. But this one is well written, funny coincidences, ordinary gangsters who are family men, resemble something from Tarantino, which is a good similarity!Anyway the film's about a guy bloke in Australia which is getting mixed up with a hard- core crime gang, and ends up in a debt and deep s*it.

I just started watching The Show around July . I found it by mistake , I was channel surfing during a break in work and it was on. There are a lot of other shows I enjoy , but this is one I’m hooked on. There’s not a day that goes by without me turning it on in my car and in my house. Every week it’s something new and fresh. It keeps my mind stimulated and helps me keep my sanity when it’s so hard being a single dad with a full time career.

"Boy Next Door" is a hilarious romp through male neurosis. In just over fifteen minutes, the film takes us on a journey that most full-length features can't even match. Great performances, excellent camera work and editing---this short is a classic from start to finish. Kudos to Travis Davis for pulling double duty as both director and star. He's the funniest nebbish since Woody Allen. And what a treat to see Richard Moll back again. If you thought all he could do was play "Bull" the bailiff on "Night Court", think again.

A good old-fashioned flight-and-revenge western , given a twist and a touch of gravitas by injecting a little black social commentary . 
 " Unforgiven " was directed by John Huston and starred Robert Duvall as " The Man " and Kevin Costner as Duvall's former law partner . Duvall plays the baddie , a bad old outlaw , who goes back into hiding . However , his past catches up with him and so he returns to town to exact his revenge . 
" Unforgiven " has plenty of twists , plenty of guns , plenty of violence and some pretty graphic scenes .

I didn't have very high expectations about Just Before Dawn. I don't know why I keep buying these slasher movies when I know it's all the same every time. Maybe I'm a bit masochistic? Anyway, I'm glad I bought this one. Yes, it's all the same. No, it has nothing original. Yes, it's about a little group of teenagers going in the woods to camp, drink and have sex. Yes, they get killed one by one by a maniac. And you know what? It's just magic!

Recently I saw this movie again ( after 25 years ) . In the original there is a scene in the opening which is quite interesting . It is one of the few movies which I would not miss for anything . I think it might be worth your time to see it at least once if you haven't already . There is also another interesting scene , which has been quoted in a book about the making of the movie , which was written by the director . So I think it would be interesting to read it as well. The following is the story of this movie as I remember it .

I thought I was wasting my precious 50 bucks going to watch this movie . But at the earnest request from my husband ,I gave in to his pleas and agreed that this movie should be watched atleast once . So I watched this movie on the same day that I watched “Munni Badnaam Hui “. This movie also stars the “Dishoom “ cast members. Well, as per the title of the movie , it is definitely a “Breezy” watch. And it is just that. Now coming to the story . It has a simple story . It tells a simple story .

I watched this movie for the first time around 1990 as a young kid and it scared the Jesus out of me. I loved it so much and I was dying to get my hands on it.In 2002, I remembered that this movie existed but I had no idea what it was called, so, I went to the I Need To Know section on IMDb and explained what the movie was about and tried to get the name of it. Anyway, eventually someone on IMDb told me, so I researched and tried to buy the movie.

Yes , this is one of the better done television movies and I would n't expect less from Joe Sargent who has directed some good movies, but I think that this is a better directed than a better written. I think the story was a little contrived and the chemistry between the 3 main characters a little off- putting. This was not a great movie but I enjoyed it. The acting is very good and so is the directing by Joe Sargent. The premise of this movie is fairly simple and it is not very original, but that is not why it works.

Jimmy ( Heath Ledger ) is given a simple job by Pando ( Bryan Brown ) a underworld kingpin to go undercover in a rival gang to assassinate a member of his crew, Jimmy reluctantly agrees to carry out the mission. During his time undercover he must decide what his real agenda is and if he will stay loyal to Pando or if he will reveal himself as a mole. I have to be honest I didn't really enjoy this film. There is a very interesting storyline but it's not played well at all and the ending doesn't work at all.

Successful films on metaphysical subjects are rare , but Fata Morgana is a good case . You can chalk up the film’s success to a couple of things: a good script , a decent director , a smart leading actor , and a talented production team. However , the film is also successful in its metaphysical approach. I don’t mean the subject is discussed , as that would be obvious , and I don’t mean it’s a film about life , because that would be a given in a film about reincarnation . What I mean is that the film is really about perception .

During the War for Southern Independence, GENERAL SPANKY mobilizes his forces to defend the local women & children against a Yankee invasion.In 1936, Hal Roach decided it was time for his popular OUR GANG kids to branch out into occasional feature-length films. With the big success of Shirley Temple in two Civil War period movies in 1935 (THE LITTLE COLONEL, THE LITTLEST REBEL), it was only natural that Roach would look in that same direction for his GANG. Although given a rather lavish production and distributed by MGM, GENERAL SPANKY was not a critical or box-office success.

I 'm surprised by some of the comments on this site because I really liked this film . If you think about it a little , it really tells you a lot . We see a man who tries to do something for his country . He also tries to do something for his country's family . He loves his family . He really wants to do for them . All he wants is to be able to make sure his wife and kids are taken care of . It's his right , and we feel for the characters . We don't like him and we don't feel for him at all .

This film was made soon enough after Karen 's passing that perhaps Richard Carpenter and the people closest to Karen are still getting over it, but the end result is a truly remarkable documentary on an extraordinary woman. It's very hard to find words to convey my reaction to the film, and I'm sure that my own words will fail in some way to do justice to what I feel about this documentary. In fact, I find I don't know how to convey how very much the film means to me. That is, the film means a lot.

After seeing Meredith in "Beyond the Prairie" I had to buy another film with her staring. I cannot believe how she let herself into this teenage flick. It's best to watch this one with the sound off but just concentrate on Meredith as she moves across the screen. Save your money until the TV network comes out with a DVD on "Beyond the Prairie". It's worth it at any price, this one needs to pay you to see. This pretty lady needs someone to put her into a script that can use both her talent as an actress and her beauty as a woman.

For my money , probably the best film - or at least the most purely cinematic film - director Ford has ever made. It is a film I would have loved when I was a kid, and would be sure to watch when I was older. Ford's film is, simply, The Searchers, the 1955 masterpiece from director John Ford that is arguably one of his best, if not his very best, films. I was reminded of this when I went to see the film at the cinema on Friday night and was shocked to see that the film had been re-cut to be more violent.

This probably ranks in my Top-5 list of the funniest movies I 've ever seen ! I was not a comedy fan when I saw this movie back in the 80's , and I ' m not really now. I ' m not that kind of a person that ' s really into the comedy type of movies. However I just recently saw it with my girlfriend who 's a huge comedy fan and she really loved it ! She said the movie is very funny and the comedy scenes are great. I 'm now thinking to get it for my list of funny movie .

Once again Elmer is faced with the dilemma of who to shoot . Bugs of Daffy . He 's unsure of where to shoot . Elmer would have to fire a shot into the crowd . He was afraid that he wouldn ' t even kill one of them . They were all in the same class . He wouldn ' t have any way of knowing which one he was aiming at . He 's afraid it 's going to be difficult to hit any of them with a bullet . He might hit somebody else instead . If he 's lucky , the bullet will pass through all of them .

Almost four years after the Iraq war started and we 're in a bigger hole than ever . That 's not to say that we won't come out of it, but it 's very, very unlikely. We will be there, I'm sure, in a year or two. And the worst part of that is, it looks as if we may have to have another war with Iran in a few years, and we will have to keep going in Iraq as we go in Afghanistan, because we are in such a deep hole there that we cannot pull ourselves out.

First of all - I hardly ever watch Swedish movies, and this is actually the second time in my life I watch a Swedish movie on cinema! Therefor, I believe it's one of the best Swedish movies ever! The combination of thrill and humour is OUTSTANDING, and sometimes you don't even know if you should be terrified or just laugh! The plot is about this man, a writer who wants to go to Germany after World War II and help the Germans to start over. On the way to Germany, he is trying to help his friends on the train, which is however a bad idea.

I finally received my DVD today, viewed it and I'm pleased to announce this is the original theatrical version of the film. As you may have read in previous reviews of "Rich and Famous" that the edited for TV version of the film that somehow made it onto VHS sometime in the late 90's but, now WB has corrected the error and released it on DVD complete with the airplane restroom scene, Matt Lattanzi's bare butt, and the scene in the Hotel room where Liz (Jacqueline Bisset) calls Merry (Candice Bergen) a C**t!

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are `` Blue '' . And the reason for being more aware of things is because of this Blue energy that has come through you, from you and into you. It is that you can be aware more, more consciously, more purposefully, more deliberately and more with intent. Because that is all that the Blue energy has. The Blue energy is all of those things. The Blue energy is awareness. It is being aware that you are being aware of what is being done in this world.

Awww, I love this! The Tale of the Cat and the Moon doesn't really need an synopsis, as that's what it is... the cat chasing the moon, to a Spanish poem. It's the artistry that's interesting. In fact, there was this animated short called the Fan and the Flower that was an Academy Award winner last year (2005)... yeah, almost same thing, which leads me to believe it might just be a rip off.But this is a really good short, with stark black & white shapes shifting and transitioning into beautiful motion and poetic seduction...

One of my favorite westerns and one of John Ford 's best in my opinion . No major stars , not even Jane Greer or Maureen O ' Hagan , but a good solid western with a few great moments . This has a lot of the old Ford feel to it which I like . This story takes place in the mid 1800's . The film opens with a young woman being whipped by a group of Native Americans in the middle of nowhere . We don ' t know how old she is , maybe 14 , maybe older , but her face has the look of an innocent young girl .

As a dedicated lover of all things Egyptian this is a classic piece from the 50 's , along with the other 3 items in my egypt collection, it is all the more reason to have all this in one package. The item itself is in great condition for a vintage piece , and I have never had a single problem with anything I have owned to this day. A must have piece for any collection. I am the owner of the piece and can personally verify that this is 100% AUTHENTIC and comes from the same original owner as all my other egypt collection.

After "Attack of the Fifty Foot Woman" with Alison Hayes opened the doors for women to be just as dangerous as men, there was obviously an open market for other movies to pick up and carry the torch and what more a lovely actress than Dorothy Provine from "It's A Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad World" to play the role. The downsize is that cute and blonde Provine may just be too sweet and innocent looking to step into Allison Hayes' size 50 shoes. This role really needed someone with an amount of smoldering sex appeal; Provine is more the girl next door type.

(My Synopsis) Rae (Christina Ricci) was a high school slut and nymphomaniac who connects with Ronnie (Justin Timberlake) to fulfill her needs. Ronnie must report to his National Guard unit and leaves Rae all alone. Rae is not alone for long, because she is the town tramp with a powerful need to hook-up with a man. After a party, Rae is taken home by a friend who ends up beating her half to death and throws her on the side of the road. The next day, Lazarus (Samuel L. Jackson) finds Rae and carries her home.

Alright so this episode makes fun of Al Gore. I'm sure it pisses a few liberals off. The thing is South Park makes fun of everybody, much like the Simpsons did. If you get offended that a politician you like is made fun of then maybe you need a better sense of humor and are taking the show too seriously. With that being said this episode is hilarious and one of the best. Al Gores portrayal is hilarious, Cartman's scheme goes terribly wrong and the results will have you rolling on the floor laughing.

`` The bad dreams always come back again like unwanted friends , '' says Marion Fairlie , who with her sister , Mabel , has just arrived at her sister's new house in London . When her sister dies suddenly , Marion learns that the new house , which cost her sister her health , was built on the site of an ancient , forgotten pagan temple , and as soon as she arrives at this house , there are weird and mysterious occurrences which start to take place . It is no wonder she begins to have strange and inexplicable dream , for this is the time when her soul has to take leave of her .

What can you possibly say ? This is the uncut hardcore , musical Alice ! It works too with a story about a girl in her room , and a guy coming to her door. She doesn't know him , and he's in the mood to fuck. So she opens the door. The next thing you know, she is on all fours , her ass sticking out . She wants to please her man , and she knows that she'll need to work on her technique . So , she tries it on her first , and she gets to work on his cock .

then you will be a big fan of this movie . Its almost the same basic concept , a nice looking film but the main issue is , there is no sex , no nothing , so why watch this at all

I watched this movie with the hope that it might be good or even great. It didn't happen. It is an OK movie, but you can tell that the director had zero talent. I'm surprised it was made at all, I'm not surprised it was made on such a small budget. Don't get me started on the casting.

A rather charming depiction of European union beginning to operate among the young generation as representatives of that group learn to interact with people of other groups. I was particularly fascinated to see that the EU had made a decision to adopt a name that was not only easy to spell and pronounce for an audience that wasn't fluent in Latin, but it was also a nice homage to the name used for the organisation prior to the formation of the European Community (EC). I didn't see this one at first but it really is interesting and I'm so glad I did eventually see this!

This was the second Cinemascope spectacle that Fox produced after the Robe . Notice how some of the Roman sets have been used in the recent X-Men. The production cost of this one was over $100 million. This is one of the few movies where the villain is clearly identifiable. It's the villain, and I can't remember her name... I'm not sure what's more interesting: that this film exists, and that it took this long to finally see it onscreen, or the realization that there are some things about this movie that make it, in hindsight, one of the best.

First of all - I 'm not one to go all sappy over movies . I saw Friends in the City, and that was my last film. I liked it very much, but the first time I saw it on video, I didn't even bother to go back to watch it again because I didn't feel like I would get a good laugh from the film. Then my wife told me that I was missing out on some great laughs and I gave it a second chance - and I was hooked!

I 'd honestly give this movie a solid 7.5 , but I clicked 10 to try to offset the 5.4 that this review scored. The acting was decent, as was the animation, and the movie had a decent plot. I'm not sure that this movie was a good movie though. Maybe it was just me and my expectations. I'll definitely see it again, as it is one of the few anime I've seen in theaters and I'd like to have more. This was also a good anime to start with. I'm going to have to go with 4.5/5 for this movie.

Our America is multi-cultural , with so many sub-cultures . This movie simply tells a story of a snapshot in time of a culture , a culture with a rich history . In many ways , they are a nation apart , with values and traditions , a language of its own . The movie deals with an inter racial marriage , with two white men marrying a black woman . In the beginning , it is almost like a love story , with the black woman as the object . But the story takes an interesting turn when the couple start having their first born son .

A talented high school graduating senior with a bad attitude is forced to play in the state all-star high school football game. When he meets and falls for an attractive local girl she helps him realize he has a shot at a 'full ride' scholarship if he plays well.All too often, these dramas fall into formulaic traps and tell the same old story of a troubled and confused teen. FULL RIDE's Matt Sabo certainly fits this profile, but below the surface is a much more unique individual than we usually see in this genre.

Obviously inspired by Se7en and sometimes even more gruesome ; more bloodshed and very graphic details ( a bit too much ) but this is still a very enjoyable read/watch. The best thing is that I've only read it and never seen the movie. It's definitely a creepy read. I found the beginning to be really tedious, but after a few chapters it gets a lot more action packed. I also found it really hard to read, the sentences are really short and hard to understand. It just really bothered me that the writing is so choppy.

In Mississippi , the former blues man Lazarus ( Samuel L. Jackson ) is in crisis , missing his wife , his mother and his daughter. In the middle of the night at the funeral of Lazarus's wife , who has been kidnapped , he has a vision that leads him to rescue her. After this rescue , Lazarus finds a new family with the help of his daughter . It is then that he discovers that his father has a secret that will shake the whole community . The film was written and directed by John Singleton , and stars Samuel L. Jackson , Vivica A.

After I 've seen this movie I find it hard to understand why so many people seem to hate this movie, but I'll do my best...I guess you can consider me a jaded film critic now! I'm going to compare it to two other movies of the 90s that are on my Top 10 list of all time; "Back to the Future", and "The Matrix". I'm just going to list what I saw that they have in common and the things they don't have in common. Let me know what you think.

The first time I saw "Alice in Wonderland  an X-rated Musical Comedy", was in the early '80 in a Movie-Theater in N.Y. City with some friends. I remember we actually enjoyed it very much, although we were left wondering why all the "goodies" were covered by in various forms shaped colored patches and why the movie was suddenly jumping from one scene to the next one, leaving us guessing...what we just missed. Obviously it was the soft-core edited (chopped) version, which left me with the desire to watch it again soon, but in its original integral version.

I first saw this movie on TV back in 1959 when I was eight years old. I knew nothing of westerns then but recognized Ben Johnson from the movie "Mighty Joe Young." What attracted me to "Wagon Master" were the great songs sung by the "Sons of the Pioneers." Merian C. Cooper, who produced the movie, was the first to commission original music to fit the mood of a specific scene and so created the modern movie soundtrack. Cooper hired Max Steiner to create the mood for his classic creation King Kong.

One of the biggest French success of the year 2002, "l'auberge espagnole" was also very well greeted abroad which is quite extraordinary for a French film. It is not difficult to define the reasons of this success. This movie made by one of the most interesting French film-makers of these last years, Cédric Klapisch, presents students coming from all over Europe and gathered all together under the same roof in Barcelona. These students are described like the ones you imagine or you see in everyday life: either untidy, either serious or with a sense of humor.

Hands down, the best drama/comedy show on television. A cleverly written show about a young mother and her 16 year old daughter exploring life and finding things out not only about the world but themselves too. Lorelai Gilmore (Lauren Graham) struggles to find a way to remain in close bond with her daughter but steer her in the right path, which through-out the show is becoming harder and harder. Rory Gilmore (Alexis Bledel) caught in a world of books and learning is just beginning to discover boys and her own sense of rebelliousness, which surprises them both.

'The Cell' is a journey into the mind of a serial killer and I mean this literally. The film is about the journey, about the world it shows during this journey, the destination does not really matter. In my opinion this journey through the mind gives such beautiful images other things do not really matter as long as they are not distracting. In fact, the story is pretty good.We start with Catherine Deane (Jennifer Lopez) in the mind of a catatonic boy. How this works exactly does not really matter, but it looks a lot like virtual reality.

Obsessed ! ! ! ! ! I have every season of Gilmore Girls and I think the reason I love them is because Rory is so adorable. If you are obsessed with GILMORE GIRLZ, you have to start at the beginning! The first episode of this show is amazing and I love Rory’s first season! I really liked the whole idea of the show being about Rory and not Lorelai and I always felt that this show was about the relationship between Rory and her father. Even if the show was not about them, I still would have watched.

Awww , I love this ! The Tale of the Cat and the Moon does n't really need an synopsis, but here is a little something to give a taste of it , and to tell you what it 's like :

The Tale of the Cat and the Moon is an old tale that was handed down from ancient times. In this story, a little cat is wandering around looking for her mom, who had left her. This little cat gets lost and is then found by the Moon who tells her to look through a window.

`` Side Show '' is one of the weirdest Horror movies ever made from Full Moon Pictures . Very gory and full of gore . The story is about a killer in a mental hospital who tries to find a way to get out . The problem is he is very dangerous and if he is able to find a way to escape he will cause mayhem . This one is really bad but also really funny . If you have seen all the other Full Moon films you know what I am talking about . It is all the blood ,gore , nudity and sex you will see .

The film begins with a cranky old Broadway producer ( exceptionally well-played by veteran character actor Richard Carle ) being interviewed by a reporter from a newspaper. At the end he says, 'I don't care who's president, we're still going to do business. We're going to make a play for the theatre. But this time, on the front page, there will be an advertisement.' In the next scene we see the same old producer and reporter in a room filled with a collection of other theater types; they're having a meeting to talk about plans for the theater.

Well its a great work by Aparnaji and some where people like this makes us believe that there is a God. I have seen some great work by Aparnaji and i believe he is a great teacher. But what i find is some people are trying to prove there are no Gods. And i really do not know why, i really do not understand it. Can anyone explain me? Last edited by vinod on Tue Oct 09, 2006 11:55 am, edited 1 time in total. "All good things come to those who wait.

`` Jaded '' should not be considered as en erotic thriller because the sex scenes are not for viewing pleasure, but to satisfy the perverts, and they're not even very good. The movie is a total piece of shit that I couldn't even finish. It's one of the worst films I've ever seen, and I'm fairly sure I was the only one to like the whole thing. If you've seen it and think that it's worth a watch, well, you're a better person than the rest of us who saw this film.

This is the story of a guy who went up to see a comedy and it turned out to be... well, kind of terrible. A lot of the jokes were pretty good, but not the jokes I was expecting to hear. Oh, they're good. They're even good jokes. Just the ones they were going for, and a few more. This is also the story of a guy who has never seen a live show. So this will be the first live show he's seen in his life. The second one will be on YouTube.

Adult version of the classic Lewis Carroll tale is much better than you might expect. Here Alice is a virginal librarian who falls down the rabbit hole and learns to love sex and her own self image. Made at the time when adult films were creative endeavors with plots instead of just a series of sex scenes, this is a good looking little movie more akin to the low budget films of its day. Despite what you may think this film actually has a good script with funny jokes and good songs. Its an naughty little tale for adults.

Susie Q. is one of those rare, and sweet movies that give you a warm feeling. It's bittersweet, but wholesome, and it's characters are fun, and captivating. At first, I thought the movie would be the cliché cuddly movie that would bore me after five minutes, but was I wrong. It made me tear up at times, and it's plot was enticing, making me root for the good guys. I loved the movie, and still remember it today, 9 years later!!

What can you possibly say? This is the uncut hardcore, musical Alice! It works too with a large energetic cast seemingly enjoying themselves to the hilt and whilst one could wish for a re-mastered version, I guess we are lucky to even have this video transfer. Pretty much a delight throughout. There are a couple of slightly off moments but this could have been embarrassing all through and it certainly is not. It also could have been and today would have been too camp. No, a very fine effort that is amusing, tuneful and just sexy enough.

In Crystal City , a group of Mormons hire the horse traders Travis ( Ben Johnson ) and Sandy ( Kate Bosworth ) as a way to get money for the Mormon temple they are restoring. The Mormons are a close-knit group, and the Temple is special to them because one of their ancestors was a pioneer Mormon. The Temple is on the National Park, which is closed to visitors while the Mormons are working on the Temple. There is no one there during the workday when they are on site and the Mormon workers sleep in trailers while they work.

Excellent entry in the RKO Saint series with well-written original script , good camera work and transitions , good directing, acting, and direction and sound, but there's a couple of points where I'm not totally convinced by them, such as in the fight at the end. Overall though it's a well-done film. I think you're a little harsh on Saint Seiya. I found it to be very well made (and a lot of fun), and while it didn't have the grand scope of the first series, it did a really good job of bringing that series to the screen.

I actually though that Black Snake Moan was great movie which takes place in the south . The story follows 2 characters , Black and moan . And they are really in love , they are really into each other , but there is a problem between their family and their love . Moan doesn’t want to hurt his father . Black has to make a choice . And he must choose . Black choose to stay with the girl he loves and leave his family and live away . That is the end of his story . Then a new story begins with a young girl .

Craig Brewer grew up in Tennessee, it is evident in his movie. Forget the Black guy on White Girl action. It happens, but it isn't Samuel L. Jackson on Christina Ricci. More importantly this movie is about the values and culture of the people in this Tennessee town. How they deal with divorce, abandonment, sexual abuse and psychological disorders. While shrinks make millions in the cities of the North, Midwest and West Coast, the town minister, who also grapples with his own problems, becomes the counselor and mediator.

These guys are excellent and anything they put out to the public is first class. The musicianship of this band is amazing and we should all be very thankful we live in a world where Rush exists. Future generations will never be able to see such mastery live and in person. Get this DVD and you will enjoy it throughly!! I was recently able to see these incredible musicians play in Houston, TX and was blown away. I have not missed a show since power windows and I have to say that they are better than ever.

This little picture succeeds where many a big picture fails. Because it was a little picture, John Ford was not harassed by the studio big wigs. He was happier with this film than any other because he was able to do it his way. He was also able to use his repertoire of gifted character actors that had played such an important role in his past successes. Some of them such as Ben Johnson had been discovered by Ford and given opportunity to show their talents. Johnson was recruited by Ford because he was an authentic cowboy from Oklahoma who usually did his own stunt work.

The Killing Yard is a great film , although uneven at times . Morris Chestnut puts forth a phenomenal effort and does a good job as a crack-shot police detective . But he can't seem to keep it together . One of the more impressive efforts I've seen in recent years . The story is based on a novel by Elmore Leonard . He wrote the screenplay as well and also directed . I liked it a lot . I'm sure you will too . A few years ago I bought the paperback edition of the novel . And now you can find it at your neighborhood library .

I had always heard about this great mini-series, but viewed it for the first time this week, July of 2007. I can see why it started the careers of so many young actors. The story is intriguing and gives wonderful insights into the period before and during the Civil War. I cared about the characters and how their lives evolved during this period. Some of them were stereotypes, but they still helped me see how people thought during the 1800's. Many historical facts were thrown into the story and it was interesting to see history books come to life.

When this show first came on the air , I saw it once or twice and thought it was another example of why so many of us, including my wife , are so fed up with reality shows that it's almost impossible for me to watch them. I knew I'd have to watch it more often because my wife and I have been talking about getting into reality TV ever since I started doing this site. We'd be great for it. I also knew that I had to be very critical of this show if I wanted to keep my sanity.

Pat Conroy 's autobiographical book `` The Water Is Wide '' proves to be something of a Southern `` Up North '' book. The setting is in the small town of Pembroke, South Carolina. In his last book Conroy, who is also a native of that state, tells of his early days in life. Conroy, who was an officer in the Air Force, describes how his family moved to the tiny town where his father had been raised. There the Conroy family took up life in the small rural town where all of them lived together in an old frame house.

This film was both entertaining and thought-provoking. I'd recommend it to everyone who wants to be moved and challenged. Great acting, directing - and it is Canadian to boot! For any family that has risen to overcome a challenge or an obstacle - be it financial or illness - this film strikes a resounding chord!

I saw it in Europe-plex . Great movie ! ! This film is an exploration of the Spirit and the soul , the physical and non physical realms . This is a very spiritual journey . Not just for the spiritually inclined . It is a film that will appeal to all , regardless of their spirituality , because it takes on all of them in its exploration of life , humanity , and the soul .

In December 1945 a train leaves the central station of Stockholm for Berlin . There are n't much left when the train leaves, but the train is full of people. A woman sits on a bench and thinks to herself. “What is so important that they travel to Berlin now” she says. “We have a very nice country, it has plenty of jobs, people are happy. The world has changed for the worst during the last war, but here everything has got even better.” A man sits near the woman, not paying any attention to her.

THE CELL ( 2000 ) Rating : 8/10The Cell , like Antz , must be watched twice to be appreciated. The first time , you'll laugh at all the unintentional humor that makes up most of this film . The second time , you'll understand that director Michael Bay didn't try to take any unnecessary risks , and that you're more likely to get a better grasp on his style of making a movie after watching the first time. If you just want to watch a mindless action film , you can do a lot better than this .

Together with the even more underrated , The Sun Shines Bright, Wagon Master was one of Ford's favorite films. It is a western of exceptional beauty and narrative purity, well acted by members of Ford's 'stock company', including Jane Darwell, Alan Mowbray, Ward Bond,and Harry Carey, Jr.Like almost all of Ford's films,it is a meditation on freedom and community. It is also noteworthy for a much more positive portrayal of Indians than in most of Ford's movies. Ford, for all his faults, remains the supreme poet of American Democracy.

With Nurse Betty (2000), acclaimed indie film-maker Neil LaBute (In the Company of Men, Your Friends & Neighbors) makes his breakthrough into the big-budgeted (Betty's $24 million as opposed to Company's measly $25,000), mainstream realm -- and yet remains true to his roots. While his cast is now composed of A-list Hollywood names (Renee Zellweger, Morgan Freeman, and stand-up comedian Chris Rock), his material remains just as bizarre and quirky as his first two features, proving that he just may be the next big thing.

` 5 Years ago if you were to watch an Australian film you would expect to see crocodile hunters , but this film is not about any of that, this film is about three brothers who live in the Outback in the most remote part of Australia , they live a life of crime in the remote parts of Australia , the three brothers are on a run for their lives . now there is a twist, they are on a run to save their life , as well as a little girl , they are on this run because their uncle has given the brothers a small amount of cash to start their own business .

This is a luminously photographed and unusually well-written western by veteran creator of `` Rawhide '' Charles Marquis Warren . In `` The Man with No Name , '' a gunfighter and former army sergeant named Tom Blake ( Richard Boone ) has been hired to find the killers of his former commanding officer ( William Talman of ``Dakota Jim'' fame). But once Tom finds out he has been sent to find not only the killer but the men who hired the killer to kill his former commander, Tom finds himself on an emotional roller coaster of self-revelation and self-hatred that will keep you turning pages long into the night .

Thank you Mario Van Peebles for informing us of not only the existence of black cowboys, but providing a compelling story that was easy to follow.The plot, backdrop, music and talent were all top notch. Almost 20 years before Frank Marshall brought tears to your eyes with his mesmerizing epic `` Alive '' , there was a man whose talent for capturing images with a camera had already established his status as the leading visual artist of the modern era. It took the form of a book, and was published, not surprisingly, by one of the greatest publishing houses of all time, Harper and Brothers, the house founded in 1820 by publisher and politician Horace Greeley. The book is `` American Scenery '' and it is still in print.

I am a history teacher and overall I was pleased with the movie. My teen-agers enjoyed it over the holidays. Is it 100% accurate and is it a little sappy in places? Wagon Master (1950) Dir: John Ford Production: Argosy Pictures / RKO Radio Pictures John Ford brings the stock company out into the Utah desert to film a western and comes out with this minor classic. They're horse traders who come into town to do some business just as a group of Mormons, led by Ward Bond, are being shown the exit.

Wagon Master ( 1950 ) Dir : John Ford Production : Argosy Pictures / RKO Radio Pictures John Ford brings together four of his most revered western heroes in one of his most ambitious and personal films. The story centers on an old lawman, who has lost his job to a young officer, who has lost his heart to a beautiful young woman. Together, they try to recapture a lost dream of their youth, which involves them going in search of an old lawman's gold, hidden by him when he was a young lawman in the Old West.

After I've seen this movie I find it hard to understand why so many people seem to hate this movie. I'm not saying it belongs in the top 250 of all times, but in it's genre it is a great movie. I know, not many people find it amusing to see how a legendary story like 'Robin Hood' is turned into a comedy. Many people still seem to believe that some things shouldn't be laughed with ... they are wrong. Mel Brooks has done an excellent job with Robin Hood: Men in Tights.

I would probably not have bothered to comment on this film if I had not been disturbed by the constant reference to the 'new world' which is in the film. What a stupid idea! Wells 'The Time Machine' (which incidentally is a great book to read if you are interested in this kind of thing). In the middle of the story the time traveler gets to the year 802,701.

Unfortunately, I've never seen the full version of this movie. I did see the 87-minute version twice, back in the 1950s. Even more floridly directed than is the norm with Julien Duvivier, this is a wonderfully out-of-the-ordinary piece, replete with sweeping tracking shots through, over and into Andrejew's magnificently atmospheric sets. Beautifully lit too by photographer André Thomas, Black Jack is nothing if not a connoisseur's delight. Reinforcing this imaginative visual style, is a script that allows a roster of our favorite actors, including Agnes Moorehead and Marcel Dalio, some brilliantly bizarre, full-blooded characterizations.

I love this film ( dont know why it is called Pot Luck in England - what a rubbish , meaningless name!) I think it is far too easy for the viewer to see through the ruse. What I really loved about this film is that there are no coincidences and things just happen for the characters. I found the film very moving. I had not realized that the actor playing the mother was pregnant and gave birth while filming. I found it so moving that she had had to give up the film, and had to leave her newborn daughter behind too.

Having just watched this with my mother ( Who got it for Christmas ) i was thrilled to find something that I can use too. Surprising, witty, funny and totally engaging, the film grabs a little-known reality: that of the student that goes studying in an Erasmus program. The beginning is great, as the story kicks off, of course it has a few lulls on the midsection, and the story drifts sometimes away from the main character, but the viewer won't bother - the movie is young, fresh, and light-hearted, even though I don't agree with the notion that when you do Erasmus and you come back you no longer make part of that universe. But that's just me.

There are a few things in life that we can't experience more than once and the college experience is one of them. Especially if we're living in a foreign country and in a apartment with 6 wackos from 6 different countries. Xavier the main character leaves his tidy life in Paris, his ex-hippy mother and his beautiful girlfriend and goes to Barcelona to study spanish in order to get a job at the embassy. He falls in love with the wife of a french doctor and he makes friends that make him look at things differently.

Renee Zellweger is Betty, a Kansas waitress who wants to be a nurse, who is infatuated with a soap opera actor (Greg Kinnear), and who is married to Del, a cheating, stupid male chauvinist who's trying to sell some stolen drugs. Unfortunately for him, he gets brutally, bloodily murdered instead, while Betty secretly watches. It leaves her unhinged, believing that Kinnear is really the character he plays, Dr. David Ravell, and that she is his RN ex-fiancée. She heads for LA to find her lost love, not knowing the stolen drugs are in her trunk.

Two Hands is a highly enjoyable Aussie crime caper, which ultimately succeeds by the way the film easily combines tense dramatic moments, with very funny characters and situations, to give the film the right balance and feel. The comedy of the film occurs naturally, and the laughs haven't been set up too elaborately & haven't been too worked at. It really is very funny, thanks to the fact that each character in the movie is excellently cast, and that each actor/actress recognises and can relate to the Aussie humor. They portray it very well and very realistically.

Do n't you ever miss the good old days when Disney actually made great movies that really moved you ? I don’t know why but when you mention the name Disney, everyone always thinks of the 90s and the good old days, which is quite ridiculous, but it’s true. It’s not even the 90s anymore, it’s the 2020s and they’re not doing what they did when they ruled the box office and every kid in the world wanted to see Disney movies, and I miss it a lot.

In one of the many Bugs Bunny-Daffy Duck cartoons, Elmer Fudd is out hunting, and Daffy tries to get him to shoot Bugs. Needless to say, Bugs has his own agenda. Moreover, "Rabbit Seasoning" makes interesting use of word order and pronouns (warning: it just might hilariously and royally mess up your speech).I think that probably my favorite aspect of this cartoon is the costumes worn by Bugs and Daffy. One of them seems like it would have been risqué for 1952 (especially in a cartoon), but they pull it off perfectly, as they always did.

Others have commented on the somewhat strange video arrangements. I think they were trying to capture what you'd be looking at when attending a live performance. The feet, the faces, the overall view. Unfortunately, it falls a bit short. But, having said that, watching Colin Dunne is nevertheless gratifying. It's an interesting contrast to Michael Flatley in the original video. The progression of the show is evident, changes from the original Dublin production are evident. "Trading Taps" is the highlight of the video, in my opinion.

`` Americans Next Top Model '' is the best reality show ! I was entertained 99.9 percent of the time . This is a great show and I love the girls , but I don't have time for all the bs that happens around the girls on a regular basis . If you want the drama , look elsewhere . Here's to the next season and keep it coming , I love this show and I love the cast ! WELCOME TO THE BIG TIME - THE ULTIMATE SHOW . WE'RE GROWING FAST AND THE BIGGEST THINGS ARE COMING TOGETHER .

One of the most pleasurable aspects of movie viewing is to get lost in a film . To have it unfold like a kaleidoscope in one’s mind, so the viewer can play out various plotlines and imagine how things could unfold in any of a variety of possible ways. As a young adult, one of my most favorite ways of enjoying a movie was by imagining that I was the lead character, and watching the film as though I were watching myself. For me, the film could have a completely different outcome than what my imagination was projecting.

`` The Cell '' is an exotic masterpiece , a dizzying trip into not only the vast mind of a great film maker , but also his great cinematic artistry . the Cell was nominated for eight academy awards , and won five , including best picture , and it also garnered two golden globes ( best screenplay and best director ) . and even though the film won more than it should have , the real triumph of the film is not in any of those awards . it's in creating an atmosphere that is unlike any other movie . there are no words for the experience of watching the Cell .

I 'll be brief : I normally hate films like this venomously ... but there is just something about this one that I like. It is the kind of story where you want to see more and more as it unfolds, where you want to learn more about these characters and their relationship to each other. For me to be able to talk about it is a real honor, so I 'll be brief ...

What I like most is how well this film is shot - the cinematographer seems to have a very keen eye when it comes to making a good looking scene.

Pity the poor reviewer who disliked / did n't understand this wonderful film . What a sad life he must lead ! In the UK, where this film is still in circulation, it can only be found as a cheap 'B' print, on video tape . There is no way you could have seen this film in its original theatrical run on the big screen , when it was first released, which is a tragic oversight. The film was shot in glorious Technicolor , and in full TechniScope , one of only three films of its kind made before colour television was introduced to British cinemas in the 50's .

Eager electronics whiz Brian Foster ( a likable performance by Wesley Eure of TV 's `` Land of the Lost `` ) creates a futuristic home to sell on the Internet. But he needs money so he can afford to build it, and so he gets an advance on a huge commission from a real estate agent to make the sales. Soon he is trying to juggle building a home and selling it. As he struggles to decide if he wants to build his dream home, he begins to feel an increasing sense of dread and foreboding about the future as he watches television with his son.

I caught this flick on the trail end of a tape I had used to capture a movie I truly love, The Big Gundown (1970), which starred Dean Stockwell, Robert Conrad, James Coburn and William Smith, as I noted in my review back in September. I had originally gotten this on a video I had shot back on April 7th, 2010, but had only recently gotten around to watching it. Well, it’s finally over, and it’s as good as I remember it being.

This 1959 soap opera film takes us into the lives and loves of three young women in the publishing world. These three characters are introduced to us when they first appear at a college lecture where an author who is a relative of theirs speaks about his work. As the lecture goes on, we see that this woman, a secretary in a local office, is reading his novel, which is about three women who live together. Her friend, a schoolteacher who has just returned from Italy, is also at the college and she is also reading the book.

Very good "Precoder" starring Dick Barthelmess, which in a way, kind of reminded me of Hawks' "Only Angels Have Wings" (1939), in which Barthelmess also acted. This film was directed by masterful William Wellman, who was responsible for the landmark aviation Silent picture "Wings".Barthelmess plays a devil-may-care airplane pilot, who is a blamed for an aviation accident. Afterwards he meets and falls for pretty Sally Eilers, who participates as part of an Act in an itinerant Air Circus; but when Barthelmess' brother appears in scene, a triangular relationship ensues.

I could n't believe that the Adult Swim guys came up with this character . I laughed for days just imagining it. In case you haven't watched it yet , Adult Swim recently aired a new TV show called Tim and Eric's Bedtime Stories , a collection of short parodies , one of them being Tim and Eric's Bedtime Story. This is the scene that got me laughing. The scene where Eric and his mom go into the bathroom and he sees a penis on the bath tub and says, "This penis doesn't want to talk to you."

The philosophical, meditative tone of this movie renders it one of a kind. I'd give it 10 stars for that alone. That being said, though, what hit me with particular force was what I take, possibly incorrectly, to be its Art Direction. Many of the interior shots feature a rich concoction of color blends seemingly based on very understated Munsell Color Model progressions and complementary juxtapositions. This makes the movie probably unrealistic to contemporary eyes, but, to me, very beautiful as an aesthetic work in itself.

I lack cable-vision and no longer have `` DirecTV '' . So being a rural resident I have to wait a couple of hours for a satellite service to show up over the house. And when it does, and I order a movie or a program I want to view, the selection runs to about 30 programs. There are many times when I've wished that there was a local cable provider, or one with better programming. It is very frustrating to have all your favorite programs off the air.I'm thinking about starting my own business with a satellite receiver.

I saw Chomps during the - approximately - 2 days of its theatrical release. It is a delightfully cute and funny movie in the spirit of 'Benji' though much improved and focused more on the actors than the dogs. The simple portrayal of life difficulties in a humorous way, followed by the bullies and villains getting their just deserts, is both sympathetic and heartwarming. It is also thought provoking. With deft subtleness this movie affects ones awareness of cruelty, personal behavior, and bullying. Movies have different genera's and different purposes.

The Truth and Reconciliation process in South Africa is a vital and probably unique human experiment. This movie does an excellent job of revealing the complexity of the task and the incredible challenges facing South Africa. I believe every one should see this movie as I think few people outside of South Africa understand its past and what is being attempted in the Truth and Reconciliation process. Almost every country has some part of its own history which is still a source of continuing hatred and bitterness. We all need to understand ways of dealing with the past. What's happening in South Africa should guide us all.

The first time I saw `` Alice in Wonderland  an X-rated Musical Comedy '' , was in the early 1980's. The movie is rated R for nudity and graphic sexual references. I was a bit shocked, but it was my first exposure to a movie like that. I was intrigued. I watched it many, many times. I watched it as a young child, and I watched it again in my adult years. The original cast was great, but the movie was a complete flop with the public. It only ran two months.

Wagon Master is a very unique film amongst John Ford's work. Mainly because it's the only one that is based on a story written by John Ford himself, the story that was elaborated by Frank Nugent and director's son  Patrick Ford and turned into a screenplay, and because of director's personal opinion regarding it, Wagon Master is the film John Ford called the one which `came closest to being what I had wanted to achieve', to say so is not to say a little, but as Ford confessed once to Lindsay Anderson, his favourite was nonetheless My Darling Clementine and not any other.

Blue Planet... Wow... Where do I begin? The years of hard work paid off in what is, without question, one of the best documentaries ever created.The sights and sounds presented in Blue Planet, like most documentaries with the Attenborough stamp, are rare and haven't even experienced by most people. That alone should be enough reason to buy this series, especially if you're the curious type who 'wants to know'.Blue Planet is not a perfect documentary, however. It does get a bit repetitive after the 3rd episode.

Michelle, Anicée Alvina, was so nice, and I really fall in love with her. She died a few months ago! Friends? Really the best movie of my youth. The "seasons reprise" of Elton and his arranger Paul Buckmaster sings in my head forever... Please, if you know where i could find a VHS of the film, mail me!! My husband of 26 years & I saw this as Juniors in HS. Yes, he was my boyfriend then and still continues to be. I think we both cried our eyes out.

I watched this movie at the first showing available in my area, and it was quite clear that most people didn't get the movie. Even if you don't, it's a good movie with some interesting character development. It is a thoroughly human story about some very imperfect people in a backwoods southern town, and really speaks to the root of the blues. If you don't know what the "Black Snake Moan" is by the time you leave the theater, you didn't get it. And no.. it's not just a song.

One of my favorite westerns and one of John Ford's best in my opinion. No major stars, but Ben Johnson shines in most everything he appears, and here he gets a rare lead as the title character. Matching him is Ward Bond as the crusty Mormon elder leading his people west. John Ford's stock of character actors, including Harry Carey, Jr., Jane Darwell, Russell Simpson and Hank Worden, provide ample support, as does eerily silent James Arness, a member of the outlaw Clegg clan that joins up with the wagon train.

Graphics is far from the best part of the game. This is the number one best TH game in the series. Next to Underground. It deserves strong love. It is an insane game. There are massive levels, massive unlockable characters... it's just a massive game. Waste your money on this game. This is the kind of money that is wasted properly. And even though graphics suck, thats doesn't make a game good. Actually, the graphics were good at the time. Today the graphics are crap. WHO CARES?

This is a better-than-average entry in the Saint series - It holds your interest and, as mysteries should, keeps you guessing until the end and has several suspects to choose from.Many films from the Golden Age are not for all tastes, especially younger viewers. They date themselves by clothing, cars, settings, etc. Who nowadays asks for a highball? Or wears a suit and tie everywhere? And the legal process was so much simpler - must have been a dearth of lawyers back then. Frankly, much of value is missing from those days.In any case, go with it and enjoy.

The Hookers was to me a great everyday people story, Like someone you might have known. Just trying to make it, my big shot is right around the corner. Then Life's little temptations creep in, the spoiler, stumbled again. How much, can your love take, and give, to the guy who's really not so bad, after all, just Human. I liked it, I was also a paid extra in the movie. Played the drums in the bar shots, with the band, did several walking shots, my green 66' corvette was in the motel party shots.

A remarkable film, bringing to the surface all sorts of feelings I had when I was much, much younger. I loved it, and the Elton John music. I remember seeing in in the movies when I was a kid, and for some reason (limited release?) I've never known anyone else who saw this film when it was released.The dreams it inspired in me from decades ago have never left me, and seeing the film again recently brought it all rushing back, I confess, however, that my kids (in their 20's) have not experienced a similar emotional rush.

I'm not the type of person to watch T.V. shows because the acting normally sucks or it's unrealistic or TOO dramatic! But this show is perfect. Everyone can act, and you can relate to the characters and their situations. Everyone has their own personality and Lorelai Gilmore is the best for her sarcastic comments that can make any bad situation seem a little funny. Rory Gilmore is a good role model for all girls. She takes pride in wanting to attend Harvard and boys/boyfriends always come second in her book. She's a loyal friend and always the peace maker.

comeundone , I love you ! I could not have come to a better conclusion than you did about this whole matter. I am truly thankful for your blog and what you have shared , and wish you all the best . Thanks for sharing this wonderful information and do keep writing,

Your article is really very informative and very useful for me, I have read many article on this topic but this is the most reliable article to improve my knowledge on this subject, may be I will come back again here, thank you for this great article, any help can be appreciated.I am glad I found your site.

This story has held a special place in my heart for the last thirty-one years. As a boy, I enjoyed stories of mountain men and the wilderness. Books like "Call of the Wild", "White Fang", "The Frontiersman" and "My Side Of the Mountain", influenced me tremendously. I wanted so much to live like a mountain man, but nothing inspired me more to do so, than when I saw this movie on television in 1975. I wanted to be just like "Trapper".

Onstage John Osborne's adaptation of "Picture of Dorian Gray" is a fine tribute to Oscar Wilde's talents as both novelist and playwright.On screen with some editing it becomes a bit sloppy due to the cutting of 3 crucial scenes from the play (one being an important scene between Basil and Henry showing that time has passed. )The acting however is brilliant. Sir john Gielgud return's to his Wilde roots as lord Henry,and although about a decade too old for the role,he totally becomes the enigmatic,life loving cad and cynic that Wilde brought to life so meticulously in his novella.

15 Park Avenue, well the name mystifies initially being an address from New York and film being set in Kolkata. However as the story unfolds, one realize the thin line that director tries to walk between Relationships, Social Cause and of course the world of Schizophrenia. I would say Aparna Sen is one director who has so much more to say and has so less time at disposal. Well no doubt she has managed to make a good movie. In a way she makes us realize that probably each one of us is looking for our own '15 Park Avenue'.

The Box is one of the strangest movies I have ever seen. To explain my experience, let me use this word picture: Imagine that you have been binging on pixie sticks and paint fumes for the last month while watching nothing but Twilight Zone reruns. The resulting coma lands you in a hospital, where the nurse seems to get a kick out of shooting adrenalin into your IV. The dream that you have while in the coma will be something like this movie.SUMMARY: A man shows up at the door of a couple. He gives them a box with a button on it.

when I first heard about this movie , I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the year . I'm a guy who doesn't watch movies just to read about them the next day . I'm not sure why . I have a hard enough time watching the movies without reading about them as well . I am a very visual person and a lot of movies don't translate that well to the written page . so , when I read the movie's plot description on its official website , I found it to be a bit of a disappointment .

This was the second Cinemascope spectacle that Fox produced after the Robe. Notice how some of the Roman sets are redressed to pass for Egyptian sets. The film is produced with all first class elements, beautiful photography, stirring soundtrack (Alfred Newman and Bernard Herrmann - see if you can tell which composer scored specific scenes). However, the principal acting is a bit weak. Edmund Purdom seems to have a limited range of emotions and is uninteresting to watch. The best performances come from Peter Ustinov as the one-eyed slave and Polish actress Bella Darvi as the Babylonian temptress "Nefer".

I think the problem with this show not getting the respect it truly deserves is that it comes after Seinfeld,after ELR and after Friends. Those three sitcoms were the star shows of their time.KOQs came at the end of this special time in TV. But don't let that dissuade you.King of Queens is as good if not better than two of the three mentioned.Seinfeld started it all and was and is a timeless classic. I never laughed so hard than I did at Seinfeld. But KOQs comes real close.When it comes to laughing, I have to rate KOQs second only to Seinfeld.

Craig Brewer is now officially a writer/director for whom I will see any film by , no matter how bad it is. He did a series of short films for VH1 called I Hate My 30s, which I saw on DVD. The premise behind the shorts is that the main character wants to live like a teenager in their 20s, and has to come to grips with the reality that they are in their 30s, so that they won't get their hopes up in the vain expectation that life is still going to be great in a few years.

I remember seeing the trailer for this movie when it was first released and it looked pretty cool. I never got the chance to see it though. When I went to Blockbuster to rent some videos, I figured I should watch it. After all I did love "Silence of the Lambs" and "Se7en", and if you enjoyed those movies, you might get a kick out of "The Cell". The whole story concept is very interesting. Going physically into the mind of a killer, I can't imagine the world they live in.

Ignore the bad reviews on here , this film is awesome ! `` Just Before Dawn '' is a great horror story that has a great concept and I can not wait for a second film . If you have never seen it , you must watch it . It is well worth it and if you get a chance do not pass this one up . Don't let the critics get to you because this movie has many redeeming qualities . If you can get your hands on a copy of this one , do not hesitate , rent , buy , watch it right now !

This show is really great . It 's smart.It 's funny.It 's great acting and writing . This show is really good and I think they should continue this . It 's really good

This is an amazing series and I really love it. The characters are just so real, they're so different from one to the other. I've been watching it since the beginning and now I'm so happy I did. It's just a really funny show. I have been watching this show since episode 1 and it just keeps getting better. Its a great show with a really interesting premise and great characters.

This is definitely one of the better Mel Brooks movies, along with Spaceballs(although I will openly admit to not having watched many others, at least yet). It's very silly and thoroughly funny, there are hardly more than a few minutes throughout the entire two hour run-time, where you aren't entertained. Almost all of the gags have a great comical effect, few of them fall flat. I saw this movie right after seeing and reviewing Spy Hard, and comparing these two spoof movies, I realize exactly of how high quality this movie really is.

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are "Blue". The Blue State mentality. This is supposed to get us off the hook for what is/was happening during the last few years in our country (The USA). It doesn't get anyone off the hook but it makes us feel better, as though we aren't benefiting in any way from living here and getting all the good stuff that a US citizen gets just by being a US citizen. But I'm so sick of bitching about this. It doesn't do any good.

( My Synopsis ) Rae ( Christina Ricci ) was a high school slut and nymphomaniac who connects with Ronnie ( John Doe ) at her high school reunion and later they hook up at a local bar and get intimate on the dance floor. But when she learns that Ronnie works in porn she becomes determined to get him to make a porno starring her. First off, I have to say that this film is in the style of the classic Italian horror films from the 50s-70s. The sets, the makeup and the way they are shot are all from that style.

These cartoon writers are unrelenting with their corny (and fun) puns. The first shot we see in here is an island prison with the following written above its big gates: "Alka-Fizz Prison - No Noose Is Good Noose." Inside the prison, the first sign we see is "Welcome: have a seat." They then show an electric chair.Corny gives way to clever, however, as our favorite wolf is seen behind bars. With pen in hand, he literally draws a door next to him and then escapes through it!

I just want to say that Chris Diamantopoulos's role as Williams for that entire show, was Emmy worthy. It was uncanny how well he did. And to be as rapid-fire and as random and as creative as Robin Williams really is....WOW. There were scenes where Diamantopoulos had to say probably 20 rapid fire lines and do 15 different characters while delivering those lines, all while sounds as much like ROBIN WILLIAMS doing those characters.....well, that my friends is impressive acting. Its one thing to do a Robin Williams impersonation for a couple of minutes.

Well, okay, maybe not perfect, but it was pretty close. This movie jumped from crime drama to romantic goofball comedy and back again so quickly all the way throughout that it seemed like two different movies that played simultaneously and then joined up again at the end. But they did it smoothly, and some in the theater found the bloody parts (like the scalping scene) to be funny as well. I just about threw up, but I guess that's just me. Greg Kinear is perfect as a soap opera actor.

I 'm not gon na lie . To say that this movie is confusing is like saying the sun is yellow. The confusion arises because we are dealing with a piece of history. The movie is supposed to be entertaining, and I believe it does that , but if you're going to be entertained, it better make some sense, in my opinion. So here we are, with the story of how a bunch of young guys got together in their mid 20's, and formed a band, to play rock and roll music.

There 's a brand new killer on the loose , and he 's doing God 's work . Yeah right. It doesn't have to be a god, either. It could be someone or some thing who thinks he 's a god. There 's a big difference between the two. I just don't see how anyone could claim to know what happened to him. He 's not an eyewitness. I think it 's pretty safe to assume he 's not alive. He 's not around any more. If he is dead, I can understand why people are saying he 's God.

It's funny because I read all the reviews on this page after getting this movie and it's either a love it or hate it reaction. You'll probably either love it or hate it too. I think the best films are the ones that divide people because obviously they have some kind of impact. I'm in the five star camp because this film did a real number on me and made me want to go back and find out more about Afghanistan and Iraq. I have to admit that I was pretty tuned out when all that was taking place.

This was an excellent show. It came on PBS back home in Chicago and I remember Cindy Herron (From EnVogue) played the teen aged daughter. The show dealt with subjects such as sex, peer pressure and puberty.
