It is not. To be a sexual predator IS gender neutral. The nudity of this film is not erotic. The rape is brutal not sexual.

GREAT, Chris Diamantopoulos has got to be the best Robim Williams that I have every seen.. He acts it up, perfectly. This was like watching Robim Williams as he really was and is.. It almost made me cry watching him.I had no idea that Robin was as close a friend to John Belushi as he was. The portrayal of this relationship was very good and could almost stand on it's own merits.. Very sad, what both of them went through.I really felt for both Val and Robin during his rough times.

I saw this movie for the first time a little over a year ago. I've seen it 4 more times since. I had never heard of it before and I consider myself knowledgeable of classic cinema. A true, polished, diamond in the rough.This gem of a movie revolves around Jon Voight (lead character "Conrack") as a young schoolteacher assigned to Yamacraw Island to teach the islands' children, all in one school. At first, the students reveal they know very little of the world beyond their island home.

This movie is VERY LONG, but totally worth splitting up over several nights. It has an all-star cast, and if you are a Patrick Swayze fan, this will get your heart to throbbing! :-) My mother is a Civil War buff, and a history teacher, and every summer we would watch this movie (we had recorded it off TV), over several, several nights until we got through the whole thing. We had every line in the movie memorized, lol. Pop some popcorn, sit back, and enjoy the action and romance.

I don't usually like to see movies while they're still in theaters because of high ticket prices but I saw a poster for Some Things That Stay and I thought, "that young actress looks intelligent and mysterious, not like the usual blonde teenybopper BS". So I decided to take the plunge and see this movie on it's opening night. I must tell you, I was happily surprised. I went to this film with no expectations. I didn't really know what it would be about, but the raw emotion and honest teenage experiences expressed by Katie Boland left me feeling rather satisfied with my decision.

I too saw this movie when it first came out. I was a teenager at the time, and I saw it with my girl friend who later became my wife. I remember the movie made me feel it was possible to beat the odds. The cinematography was very well done if memory serves me correctly. The boy was a little much, but the girl character was very interesting. I thought it was very romantic and that might have been the intro to the first time with my then girlfriend. I have not seen the movie since and I wander why it has gone to the wayside.

Hmm , is it right to compare Tiffani Thiessen and Mark-Paul Gosselaar 's post Saved By The Bell acting ? I saw Tiffani in Saved By The Bell. It wasn't her acting but the voice of her character, Lisa Turtle that caught me, and made me love her character. I also loved Mark-Paul in Saved By The Bell . He was just so cute and cool. He played a character that I've never read about in a TV series before. In my opinion, he was the most perfect person I had ever seen in all the TV series that I'd watched.

Although dated, this film is definitely worth a watch. I saw it about eight times as a teenager when it opened and it changed my life...I just HAD to live in New York. It has great opening shots of the Manhattan skyline with Johnny Mathis crooning "Romance is still...the best of everything..." that rival those of West Side Story. There is a rather stilted performance by the world's REAL first Supermodel, Suzy Parker (sorry about that, Janice D.), but it's great eye-candy!

what was the quote by archbishop tutu at the end of the film about a person's past? this film was very disturbing to watch in the sense that it was a true story and to think that humanity is still so cruel after all these years makes me ashamed everyone is human and everyone has the right to live their life in peace and harmony live and let liveif anyone knows the quote please let me know Thank youthis film should be shown a lot more publicly as true events as horrific as these shown in the film should be known to all in the hope that things will change sooner rather than later.

Having reviewed 3 of the 4 Perry and Croft sitcoms , I thought I would get them all done now in one post and share my thoughts on their strengths and weaknesses. In order of appearance:

Perry and Croft in The Two Ronnies - BBC - 1983-1988. This was the second sitcom I had seen which featured a pair of double act comedians (though in this case they played more than two characters) and the first one I had actually seen. It was the first BBC comedy I ever caught, and it was one that has stuck with me since.

Having been interested in Akhenaton for many years I was surprised to learn about this film via E-bay and bought a copy on DVD for 99p. I enjoyed the film, the twists and turns in the plot and that the file was mainly about the main character Sinuhe makes it more of a "family saga" rather than an action film. The costumes and attention to detail was remarkable for its time (1955). The back projection during the chariot ride now looks clumsy. My main interest was in the character of Akhenaton and his monotheistic religion.

This was another great episode from season 11 of South Park . Cartman fakes having Tourette syndrome in order to make his teacher Mrs. Crabtree go insane. It's one of the most hilarious episodes from the last few South Park seasons, so let's get started right away with the full episode below, including the full South Park credits in the top section, and an embedded video after the jump for those who want to watch the full thing, but don't have time to wait for a regular video post. Meanwhile, Kyle has gotten in trouble for having a porn magazine on school grounds.

The hurried approach that Lewis Seiler takes with King of the Underworld establishes a deeper plot, while still maintaining an efficient run-time. One of the clearest examples of this is the transition between poverty and wealth for the married medical couple. The audience is instantly transported from a shanty medical office to a luxurious suite at the city's most prestigious inn. This development is critical to understanding the position the doctors have been thrown into. The story suggests from the intro that these two people are generally happy with providing medical practice to those who are less fortunate.

I was expecting this movie to suck , but what I got was a pretty good slasher/gore film . Most of it was shot well and had a nice flow to the story . And the story line was really well put together . The acting was ok but some were really bad . But the one thing i didnt care for was the gore , i would have prefered it to have been less , or even just as intense as it is now . I did like the characters , and they all looked pretty good in some way . And i liked how they tied everything together .

It may have been inevitable that with the onslaught of `` slasher '' movies in the early 1980 's , that there would have been a sequel to the 1979 film The Texas Chain Saw Massacre (TCSM). The film was a surprise success for AIP , and was the last big money film that the company would produce . A few years earlier , AIP had made the infamous The Hills Have Eyes , a movie that was a big flop . But in the year following the release of The Texas Chainsaw Massacre, they found themselves back on top with their next film , The House on Haunted Hill.

I would probably not have bothered to comment on this film if I had not been disturbed by the constant references made to it here in North America as a porn film. Our obsession with what is, or should be, regarded as pornographic remains a relic of the 'guidance' provided to film makers by the Hayes committee many, many years ago and it is now really time that we relegate it to the past. So far we have not progressed far beyond establishing a somewhat arbitrary division between what we now term 'soft' and 'hard' porn, with both carrying the same pornography label.

This film , released in 1951 , has the usual elements typical of the westerns released during the 50 's : a hero with his gun, an evil man , a beautiful woman who falls in love with him... and a little girl who becomes the heroine. It begins in 1885 in a town in the west, a time and place that is still remembered with nostalgia. In this place lived a little girl ... and that little girl will change the lives of many people . This little girl is Emma, the daughter of a poor farmer, and her mother died giving birth .

On watching this film, I was amazed at how media perception can mould a persons opinion of a celebrity. Karen Carpenter was a carefree, but very unconfident young lady, whose wonderful voice helped her and her brother Richard to soar the charts with wonderful songs. As with all celebrities of today, they were often criticised about their music as well as their looks, styles, etc. THis had a huge effect on Karen who raged a battle against her eating and drastically lost weight, which eventually caused her death. This heart felt film was not initially something which I would have thought of watching.

This film blew me away. I thought I knew a little about the Attica prison riot. After watching this, I see I knew nothing. The story is told through the relationship between the attorney and the black inmate. Both the personal story of these two men and the unfolding courtroom drama were riveting. The flashback sequences in the prison were awesome. It's hard to believe it wasn't documentary footage it was so real. It was not only a great piece of drama, it was an incredible lesson in an important chapter in American history. I'm with Ebert and Roeper.

I have not seen a better comedy than the King of Queens for many years . I rate it one of my top 3 comedies of all time. It is just so easy to watch. It's funny. It's about women. And I love it because it takes place in Queens. It's just a funny show, and I love that it has a woman's perspective on everything. I have seen every season of that show from the beginning and it will always be one of my favorites. I had a great laugh when I read that the new season would have a woman's POV perspective.

"The Cell" is an exotic masterpiece, a dizzying trip into not only the vast mind of a serial killer, but also into one of a very talented director. This is conclusive evidence of what can be achieved if human beings unleash their uninhibited imaginations. This is boldness at work, pushing aside thoughts to fall into formulas and cliches and creating something truly magnificent. This is the best movie of the year to date.I've read numerous complaints about this film, anywhere from all style and no substance to poorly cast characters and bad acting. To negatively criticize this film is to miss the point.

A good old-fashioned flight-and-revenge western, given a twist and a touch of gravitas by injecting a little black social history into its plot. Lead by Mario Van Peebles, who does OK, the gang of misfits on the run from Billy Zane's (seemingly unstoppable) army bigwig all acquit themselves well, their adventures plausible yet fun and exciting. There're some nice moody flashback scenes setting up the hero's character and backstory, a good shoot-out ending as our heroes defend the town from greedy white landgrabbers, and even Stephen Baldwin isn't bad in this enjoyable, quite powerful western.

Hallelujah ! ! ! ! Finally , a true Colombian film crosses the border ( s ) to shows how life is ! In the movie "El Hijo del Pasionaria" directed by Pablo Hidalgo and produced by Juan Pablo Rodriguez ( who was one of the writers and actors ), a young journalist who is looking for a job , finds the door of an abandoned building where he encounters a gang of boys , who he quickly becomes friends with and in the process , discovers an incredible world of violence that will make us think, laugh and cry.

See No Evil With Kane . The Movie Has a great storyline But it just was n't a Hide my ass movie. It was a Hide your head in the sand. It got boring quickly. I just could not believe that he could be so bad. I thought he would have something better to say. I mean I just could not believe that he was so bad. It was so predictable and the story line was so unbelievable. I could not believe that the character he played would say or do those things. So I just did not believe him.

honestly.. this show warms my heart, i watch it EVERYDAY on fox family and now that the new season has started i'm even more hooked than before.. the characters are so well-developed and their relationships are so real.. i would recommend this show for any woman or mother and daughter.. the Lorelei's are super fast talking witty girls that will, truly inspire you and the show is hysterical at times and never too too serious, but serious enough for it to be completely addicting.. it's an hour long which is a major PLUS because you can't ever get enough Gilmore!

This movie was so cool ! I saw it on a Friday night with a couple of my friends . I like the action and the story .The actors were pretty good , I think . One of my friends said he thinks the actors who are in this movie will be the ones to replace the ones in the Spider-man movies . That is true because of the actor's that were in this . He thinks they will be great in the Spider-Man movies . This movie was one of the coolest . If you like Spider-man movies and you have seen it before , you will probably like this .

So we saw this on DVD at our apartment here in Paris. We're all here on an exchange program. We all laughed so hard cuz so much of what was going on in the movie happened to us! I mean yeah sure some of it was pretty clichéd but still true, know what I'm saying.I think I related more to the quiet guy (the Italian) than Xavier because I'm more of the observer in our group. Anyway, I wish I had a hot roommate like Cecile de France.

I have been watching King of Queens from the beginning , and have felt it is overlooked at the award show. The show is so much more than the sitcom it is known for being. It is the perfect comedy. It is funny, poignant, touching, ridiculous, and sometimes disturbing. It has great guest star turns and is well done. In addition to being a great sitcom with a great theme , it is a show about family , about love and life. There is no sex on the show , and no sex talk , at least that I remember .

Well, I'm a few days late but what the hell....! Anyways, the word that best describes my reaction to "See No Evil" was....SURPRISE. The film is actually pretty good. There is definitely an ample amount of blood, gore & action in the film with a modest amount of suspense. It hearkens back to the good ole' slasher days of the late 70's & early 80s. Think "Madman" meets Leatherface with a dash of Norman Bates and you'll get a good feel for this flick.

This film was both entertaining and thought-provoking . I 'd recommend it to everyone who wants to be moved and to those with a strong belief . I hope that this movie will encourage you to do more and to take more action against the corruption in your country, and that you and your children will be the next generation to make a change . Thank you for doing your part for your country and humanity! I loved the fact that it was a movie that didn't make you feel sorry for anyone. It was real, and it showed that corruption can exist in any country.

Watching The Wagonmaster is not likely to result in deep thoughts , unlike many other great Ford films , like Dances with Wolves or The Man With No Name , but it is well worth a viewing. This movie is not only entertaining in many respects , but also contains a good deal of accurate historical information , and it is very easy to follow . So here it is , for those of us who love Ford but don’t know much of anything about the American West (except for the stuff in High Plains Drifter) .

After getting hooked on the mini series, "North & South," I could hardly wait for the continuation, "North & South II." Then years later, along came Book III, "HEAVEN & HELL - NORTH & SOUTH - BOOK III." FINALLY, the last installment came for the on-going saga of the Maine and Hazard families. I was so enraptured by this series that I taped each part off of TV and then managed to get family and friends hooked and I watched it AGAIN, each time someone new wanted to see them.

America's Next Top Model is a great reality show in every sense. It has a great hostess, has great guests, a great production and some of the best professionals of the modeling world contributing for something they hadn't achieved yet: present a true America's Next Top Model. Of course this is not something easy to do, therefore USA and the world already would have 10 top models concurring and fighting between themselves in this cruel world.But it's obvious that its intention is not to present the America's next top model, but yes, the America's Next Pop Model.

This as the first of the Ma and Pa Kettle flicks. Marjorie Main (Ma) steals the show in anything she does. Funny to see Ida Moore as Emily, the daffy old lady on the train.. god she was ALWAYS old; she was in "Desk Set" and "Alfred Hitchcock Presents". Their new house is also a co-star here -- its the house of the future with some really cool inventions that Pa doesn't care for. LOVE the painting gag. Keep an eye out for TOM... he starred in "Nanny & the Professor".

This twisted comedy is well acted and directed . Very funny and the production quality is outstanding . It is also well researched and written . The story is told in three sections with each section beginning as a flashback and then progressing forwards to the present and finally back again as a flashback . This is a great idea and it is carried out extremely well . The characters are well drawn and it is the script which gives them character and the humour comes from their actions and interaction . A great piece of cinema which I strongly recommend to all .

Our Family and friends enjoyed this movie very much . The theme was well handled by the Director with great humor and entertainment . I recommend this movie to all . Thank you for making it . I would like to share this movie to you if you are interested to see a family movie .I liked the movie with my family and friends . I like the character of the main actor in this movie and he performed it well , the story was also interesting and the main actors were good .I like the family movie because it has comedy and romance also .I would recommend this movie to you .

First of all - I hardly ever watch Swedish movies , and this is actually the second time in my life where I have watched a film that is written in Swedish . I usually end up watching English movies or other foreign language films. However , I decided to watch this and I am happy that I did. This is the story about a group of students at a university who start a fight against a teacher , a woman. The teacher had a relationship with one of the students , and that student ends up killing himself .

I caught this flick on the trail end of a tape I had used to capture a movie I truly wanted to wanted to see again. When I saw Raquel Welch's name in the opening credits, I decided to watch it. It was actually mildly entertaining, and took me back "in the wayback machine" to the farcical movies that Hollywood churned out during the sixties, much in the same genre as the current Austin Powers stuff. Oh the acting was not superb, nor was the plot, but it was worth watching.

If I 'd only seen the poster for Nurse Betty , I probably would n't have touched it with a ten-foot pole. That 's not saying it was a bad movie - far from it - just that I wasn 't expecting to see much of Nurse Betty 's story on the screen, not that it 's completely irrelevant. The film is about Betty 's quest to get her nursing license and she is accompanied on that quest by three of her friends and one of her "friends" is a fellow nurse who wants to get in bed with her.

spoiler -- In 1993 , African-American director/actor Mario Van Peebles followed up the tremendously popular urban-action film New Jack City with a big budget sci-fi-comedy starring Ice Cube and James Woods, as well as a talented young actress named Angela Basset. In the movie, the main characters are kidnapped from Africa and taken to a secret underground military laboratory in the US, where they're used to fight in a never ending war. Unfortunately, after the credits roll, the story ends there, and it's up to the viewer to decide for themselves what actually happened next.

when I first heard about this movie, I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the 1970s. I noticed the music was by Elton John, so I figured I had nothing to loose, so I got it. What a Surprise!!! The movie was awesome. It was true love is all about. The characters (Paul and Michelle) had no luxuries, no money, and sometimes no food, yet they were still happy. I recommended this film to all my friends, but they all critized my tastes, and even called me names, becuase the movie featured two minors naked.

I couldn't believe the eye candy from start to finish. Being a fan of movies directed by music video masterminds. I am happy to report that the photography in this motion picture is a splendor for the eye to behold. There are so many rich, full images that are put before me, that each and every time that I see this movie, I find something new that I had not seen before. As with previous movies that I have seen, such as Blade and Mystery Men, also by former music video directors, the use of color to capture one's attention is utilized extremely well.

I resisted watching 15 Park Avenue despite of recommendations , discarding the movie as a clichéd topic of extreme emotional breakdowns. After having viewed the film, I must say I was completely wrong. This is not an ordinary film. It deals with the problems of a wealthy family with a very complex and interesting plot, which I could not possibly explain in one sentence. It is a must see film, if you dare to watch films from this genre, which I would recommend to most of you. However, I have a few reservations regarding this film, as I have seen a few films with similar topics.

Most of these reviews are dead on , so I 'll cut to a different chase and answer a couple of the more interesting questions I've been asked. What kind of gear should you expect to be spending $500 on? What are the key features to look for? I 'll give you my thoughts on the top ten of each type of bike and what I 'd say to the buyer. If the price is right and you like what you see, go ahead and grab it. Let 's roll. Road:

I have to admit, some of the bikes on this list are a surprise to me.

I remember seeing the trailer for this movie when it was first released and it looked pretty cool . I was wondering when it would come out on dvd and got lucky as the movie was released in the US on December 21, 2006. I was really looking forward to the movie and it came out on dvd the following day so it was a day early . There is not any extra features that I know of as the movie was released on dvd with the film. I watched the movie at home and it was a pretty decent dvd .

Yes, this is one of the better done television movies and I wouldn't expect less from Joe Sargent. One thing for this reviewer is that I was also a great fan of The Carpenters, I got to sing all of their material in elementary school and middle school choir and I got to do much of the solo material of which Karen sang lead. I thought she was one of the most wonderful pop singers of the 70's - and being a child/teen singing these songs and learning music - the one thing I was looking forward to was meeting this woman.

I'm certain that people from USA don't know anything about the rest of the world, but I think they mustn't talk about what they don't know. And they must remember that the rest of the world is not as hypocrite as the USA. The only places where consented sex between teenagers are illegal are the USA and Islamic nations. In France, for instance, the age of consent is 15. In Brazil it's 14. In Spain it's 12. So the teenagers actors, 16 and 17 years old by the time of production, aren't doing anything illegal.

I have not seen a better comedy than the King of Queens for many years. I rate it one of the best ever. I've just returned to Ireland from Arizona on American Airlines from a biz trip and by chance they showed several episodes. I laughed my head off and later I asked the stewards to play again and they did. Thank you AA. The acting from all the team is first rate and especially from Kevin James, Leah Remini and Gerry Stiller, but from all of the cast in fact the acting is superb. I love all the cast, they are so funny.

I first saw this film when I was in the 8th grade and I remember that it had a profound effect on me. In fact, I have seen this movie more than a dozen of times since then and that is saying something! This review of the film was written prior to seeing the film with the intent of writing a review which could stand up to any of the recent reviews that I have seen written on this film. I have read a number of reviews that were written prior to this movie's release.

This comment discusses `` North and South Book I '' dealing with 1842-1861 periodThe 19th century history of the USA is covered in a book titled `` North and South '' by the Pulitzer Prize Winning writer William Manchester. The book is written from a left-wing point of view and paints an image of a society in which blacks were held in slavery while the northern states enjoyed a high standard of living and free education. It is based on the best-seller book by the same title published in 1958 by William Styron. The book is very well written.

I remember seeing this movie for the first time with a friend while on vacation in Anaheim , California in 2005. We were both surprised by the quality of this film. When we first saw it , it wasn’t until after we had returned home from that vacation and went to my local theater that I realized this movie was based on a true story and not just fiction. I remember that it was just before I graduated high school and the movie was released in theaters a couple of years later that I came to realize how this movie might not have a happy ending.

One of the best! As being a fan of the civil war, I was very pleased with the first installment of the North and South trilogy. Patrick Swayze gives and extraordinary performance, as well as James Reed and Leslie Ann Down. In watching this fabulous story unfold into a time never forgotten, the subjects of love, passion, grief, shame, harmony, and cruelty come to life. I was first introduced to this series when I was in the eighth grade. Being a young boy, you would think that I wouldn't have been interested in this civil war soap.

The show is GREAT . No words to describe it . Wonderful music . Incredible dance . The editors could do no wrong. You can tell that this was just for fun for the viewers, but they pulled out the stops and put it on a high level for sure . I’ll have to say that it may have been my favorite show of last year because it’s just a great show that I love being there and watching every week. It really is one of the top rated shows in terms of entertainment and music.

Inarguably one of the most interesting filmmakers of the last 50 years, Werner Herzog has been pushing the boundaries of cinema perhaps more so than any other commercial filmmaker. I've been acquainted with Herzog for a few decades now and I've never not been impressed by both the man and his work. Last year I went to see Rescue Dawn and was somewhat surprised at how relatively mainstream the film was, yet couldn't help but imagine Herzog taking his actors and crew into the actual jungle to not only make the film, but to live it.

Along with virtually every Republic Picture ever made, "Murder in the Music Hall" seems to have undeservably faded into oblivion. A shame, because this lusciously produced, expertly directed and written, and crafty mystery-suspense item spins an enticing whodunnit thriller against the setting of Radio City Music Hall. A murder in one of the building's posh penthouse apartments casts suspicion on the luscious Rockettes--among them, Vera Ralston (who besides giving an appealing performance of subtlety and vulnerablity, provides a few dazzling ice-skating production numbers), Helen Walker, Ann Rutherford, Julie Bishop, and several other delectable B-movie starlets of the '40s.

i really love this movie , i saw it for the first time when i was working a video store , this was when it was a new release . the movie is about an actor who has an affair with his assistant . the actress who played his mistress is a very beautiful young woman , her name was rita . she has a baby with her lover , the actress was very upset about her baby ,
she took her boyfriend away from her baby , she never had time for her ,
the boyfriend got married with her , then the actress was told that their baby died when he was only one years old .

This is one of those movies that was never publicized and therefore was missed when it originally played in the theater (and on television). It is an extremely funny comedy that will not disappoint you. The film stars Robert De Niro as a New York city cop who makes a mistake and goes to jail. He goes on a jailhouse date with a girl (Kathleen Quinlan) and she helps him. In the film you will see some great performances by the leads, a lot of great music and a lot of comedy.

My wife and I saw this when we were 17 . The only good thing my father ever did (besides being an alcoholic) was to raise us and we owe a lot of who we are to him. I was a bit of a misfit, a bit of a punk, and my dad gave me a place to be it. And I have tried to return the favor by helping others in similar positions. But it's not enough for me anymore. I want a little more. I really don't have anything to offer. I want to go out with the old crew.

I watched this film in a Singapore theatre yesterday (4 February, 2006)and came away with a better understanding of what schizophrenia patients and their loved ones go through.Ms Aparna Sen must be congratulated for not only taking on a difficult subject, but also treating the mentally challenged with a deep understanding of their predicament that is necessary to help them cope with the trauma of disorientation, hallucinations and the storm of turmoil raging in their minds.We have had Hollywood movies on this subject such as "One flew over the cuckoo's nest" where Jack Nicholson carried away the honours.

This is a luminously photographed and unusually well-written western by veteran creator of "Rawhide" Charles Marquis Warren. Direcxtor Gordon Douglas is its chief help in this regard. Its strong plot line can be told in a few sentences. A hard-nosed by-the- book, Cavalry officer, Captain Richard Lance, captures a leader of the Indian enemy after a massacre at a fort. He insists on bringing the man back for trial, to be sent toTucson; his commander sends another man to try to take the prisoner for trial and the patrol is wiped out.

At first I couldn't tell if it was an art film or a documentary. The day after I had a unique movie after taste experience or perhaps a revelation. The film is a human quest to destroy everything that exists, including life on earth. The lead is clueless and cold. He is like all of us he wants to get rich, to laugh, to travel, to eat and be entertained. He moves from one place to another in a giant RV without direction or motive only to pass time and entertain himself. By the end it's too late.

This movie was awesome, if you want a movie with non-stop puns and laughter then this is right for you. This movie was great because it took the serious Robin Hood and made it something the whole family can enjoy and get a good laugh at. I first viewed this movie when i was around 10, and got most of it. This movie is also great because it makes fun of everything involved, "By order of the kings financial secretary H and R Blockhead? "Everyone needs a little Cary Elwes(Robin Hood)in life, whether or not its Liar Liar with the "Claw" or Saw.

This is definitely one of the better Mel Brooks movies , along with Spaceballs ( although I will openly admit that the Mel Brooks Spaceballs movie is more fun ) and History of the World, Part 1. For some odd reason, though, I have a hard time seeing it in theaters. Maybe I'm just a fan of old-school comedy, but I've found that the new breed of comedy just don't get the laughs for me like the old, black and white flicks used to. But that's all a matter of personal taste.

Fata Morgana , the 1971 documentary-like film by German filmmaker extraordinaire Werner Herzog , filmed over several years in the early 1970s, was one of the most challenging, frustrating and ultimately rewarding films of all time. It was made at the very peak of Herzog's powers as a filmmaker, in the early-to-mid 1970s - the same period that saw the release of Fata Morgana , the 1972 film from which the film drew its title . For the most part, the story goes something like this. Werner Herzog is an extremely talented, well-regarded German filmmaker who is well-loved among both critics and audiences for his adventurous and experimental style.

A question immediately arises in this extremely idiosyncratic film: Who are the crazy people?The answer become less clear as the film goes on.Renee Zellweger loses the whiney note in her voice and, while her voice is still high, she is incredibly effective as the shell-shocked Betty. In fact, she is so effective I almost wanted her to be just a little more crazy because her created reality was so believable.This is the first time Ms Zellweger has been called upon to carry a film and she is more than equal to the task.Chris Rock  though as foul-mouthed as usual  is fairly subdued as Wesley.

The above summary really is n't meant as a slam against this film , as the series followed a very specific formula , and this film really sticks to that form . i do have to admit though as i said , i really am not a fan , but it is very well made , and i do have to say i liked it . i can see why it did well , but as i said earlier it would have made much more money if it would have stuck to it's own formula , and not tried to go outside it .

Believe it or not, the Mona Lisa actually got stolen once, and was missing for nearly two years. In 1911, Leonardo da Vinci's 'La Gioconda' (better known as the Mona Lisa) was taken from the Louvre by a petty thief (and former Louvre employee) who allegedly sought to return the world's most famous piece of art to its native Italy. His actions after the theft make it seem more likely that he intended to sell the painting for his personal profit. (Of course, he had no hope of finding a buyer.)

I watched the first few moments on TCM a few years ago but stopped after about 15 minutes. I saw it listed on the schedule at the Stanford Theatre in Palo Alto, and I vowed I would make the 40 minute drive. The Stanford is an old fashioned movie house that starts each movie with the curtains still shut Yes, they have curtains. They opened as the Fox logo fanfare began to play. When "The Best of Everything" appeared in huge pink letters spread against the New York City skyline, I knew I was right for waiting.I lapped this movie up.

***SPOILERS*** ***SPOILERS*** THE CELL / (2000) **** (out of four)"Do you believe there is a part of yourself, deep inside in your mind, with things you don't want other people to see? During a session when I'm inside, I get to see those things." --Catherine DeaneAnd so do we. One of the most visually stimulating films of the year, "The Cell" is a love/hate movie-either you love it or you hate it.

I 'm astounded and dismayed by the number of reviewers on this site who did not get the point of the title. I guess you were all too busy trying to find something to bash or criticize, instead of listening to the actual words in the book and understanding the message in them. If you don't like it, don't read it, but you'd better stop bashing the book or you'll be sorry you did. This book was meant to be taken seriously, and I think you all took it as a joke. This is not a book for kids.

I love to see a female protagonist, in this movie her name was Rose. Rose brought out a lot of interesting questions in her journey of fulfillment.Is is possible to attain peace and internal fulfillment through external means? Does our society teach this? Can one be a victim of memory which may lead to victimizing others? Is one responsible for being a product of one's environment? To what extent can one control or take control of one's environment? How is a "typical" human alike or different than Rose? Lastly, would the outcome or story change if it were from another country like France or Italy?

I saw this movie with my girlfriends and we all loved it ! It is so sweet and heartwarming , the acting is great, and the cinematography makes this movie even better ! There are 3 main characters in this movie . The first main character is Henry (played by Owen Wilson ) , the guy who is having trouble with his marriage and his love life , because he is not really attracted to any girls . He doesn't understand women and he has no desire to have sex , so he is trying to avoid all women and just stay at home.

Fuckland is an interesting film. I personally love the Dogma movement. I wish it had lasted longer. It seems to have already died. Many critics tried their damndest to shut it down. I don't know why. It's the most interesting movement to happen in the cinematic world since the French New Wave. Besides Fuckland, I've seen the first three in the series, Festen, Idioterne, and Mifune. They were all great, Festen being a masterpiece, in my opinion. Fuckland isn't up to those others. I was just fascinated with the filmmaking.

Just Before Dawn is one of those really good slashers that send chills down your spine every time you watch it! This movie has great suspense, great acting, very well done camera work (nice job Mr. Lieberman!) which makes a extremely well made slasher! Though low on gore for the 80s, it still has the effect on you after it is over. The opening kill (machete through the crotch) looked so real! And the fist to the mouth death left me stunned! Overall i give this lost classic 10 stars out of 10 stars!

Cliché-avoidance is one of this film 's main achievements . When you hear a vague outline of the story  the boy goes on a journey into the woods to find his mother, is attacked by a creature and saved by a wolf  it's easy to picture it. What you do not picture is the fact that you are watching an actual story . The characters , the dialogues, the actions, all of it has been done a thousand times, in a thousand different films. It's all been seen before . And yet , for some reason or other , it all works very well here.

This film predates the Australian films Road Warrior and Priscilla of the Desert, and its influence on them is obvious: in the dialogue, locations, photography, direction and political philosophy. The photography is notably confident. The direction is stylish and for the most part well done. If you liked the early Australian films by Bruce Beresford, Peter Weir and George Miller then you'll love "Oz". The direction also reminds this reviewer of Edgar Wright's contemporary work. That similarity suggests that "Oz" was far ahead of its time.

I'll be brief: I normally hate films like this venomously ... but there is just something about this one that just draws me in and won't let me go. Granted, there are some major flaws in it (some of the acting is below par at best and the dialogue is sometimes so poor it's funny) but there are enough redeeming features to make it watchable to the end.But what are they? Well, it's got a cool little plot - by no means is it original, but it is better presented than other films of its kind.

The Karen Carpenter Story shows a little more about singer Karen Carpenter 's complex life . Though it fails in several ways to portray the artist as a whole, it does capture the essence of her life and music . This is a documentary about Karen Carpenter's early life in California , her rise to fame, her untimely death at the age of 30 , and the legacy left by the pop music classic "I Want You To Love Me." It is a very well-made tribute to the late Karen Carpenter's career and life .

Every time I watch this show I just want to turn it off and curse the makers for wasting my time with such a stupid show and its ridiculous plot twists. It's not a very entertaining show and it's pretty bad. I love this show. I can't stop thinking about it and I can't stop talking about it. It's like the best show on television and I can't imagine ever giving up watching it until the end, even when I'm tired. The best thing I can think about is that it will keep on getting better.

Well , okay , maybe not perfect , but it was pretty close . This movie jumped from crime drama , to sci-fi , to drama , back and forth without much consistency . It's a movie that was a lot better than it had any right to be considering the talent involved . I'm sure there will be those out there ready to give the thumbs down to this movie . However , there are still some very positive things about the film that make it a very interesting thriller . For example :

The premise . It's actually one of the better ones out there .

I do n't think I have ever seen a better movie parody . Mel Brooks is insane . EVERY time he is on screen . . . he has his own style which is like no one has ever done before. It's as close to the way he would actually do it if he could do it . . . or the way it would have to be to do it and make it believable . . . as we can ever imagine. I did not think "History of the World: Part I" could possibly be any more ridiculous . . . but .

Had the pleasure to see this film at the Big Bear Film Festival where it won the Audience Award . It's not often that I'm so happy with a film but I am happy to have this film in the library to watch. A great film that shows how a young man in his 20s is caught in a world of lies and deception. A few days later I found out that this film was made in Italy by a couple of good friends of mine, Marco Santagata and Luca Rizzo. This film is so good I can't believe it was only made for 1 million Euros!

North and South is a miniseries from the "golden age" of television miniseries in the 1980s, which was a time for long, sweeping epics with high production values and lots of star cameos. It is, for the most part, excellent for what it is, although I personally prefer the less soap-opera like elements of the story and the overall sense of history.James Read and Patrick Swayze deliver excellent performances--especially Read, whose George Hazard serves as kind of an emotional anchor in the midst of the often melodramatic story.

We saw this film in Toronto at the Film Festival last year . It was a truly moving experience . I had only the barest knowledge about the artist’s tragic death , I was surprised that I felt so deeply for this film . This is the life story of the American artist Jean-Michel Basquiat who committed suicide aged 27 and whose work has become an iconic symbol of New York City’s post-modern art movement, the graffiti culture, and the emergence of hip-hop culture. This film follows the trajectory of his life and his art over the course of two years until his death.

Minor spoilers follow, but nothing you won't have learned from reading the back of the DVD.Held together by a wonderful central performance from Renée Zellweger, Nurse Betty is a dark yet deceptively good-natured comedy.Suffering from an emotional and mental breakdown after witnessing her sleazy husband's murder, already-troubled and desperately unhappy waitress Betty becomes convinced a character on her favourite daytime soap is her long-lost fiancé and sets off from Kansas to Hollywood to find him.Instead of making jokes at the expense of Betty's mental state, writer John C. Richards is very sympathetic, with Zellweger portraying her as a lost innocent, not entirely helpless but tragically vulnerable nonetheless.

You will be able to tell within the first 30 seconds of this film whether you want to finish watching it. The film opens with images of planes landing at an airport, one plane after another diving into a mirage-filled runway. You will be able to accurately guess that this movie is not about a "story." At first viewing, it's even easy to think the opening images are repetitive shots of the same plane. The initial drama is in the acuteness of your perception, which is built on your willingness to experience the film simply as a series of images.

After `` Attack of the Fifty Foot Woman '' with Alison Hayes opened the doors for women to be just as good as male wrestlers, many women who have followed in her footsteps have been left out in the cold. It seems that women don't get the respect that they deserve as wrestlers and, while they have been slowly gaining some popularity over the past 20 years or so, they still have a long way to go. In a way, women's wrestling is still in its infancy. But they have come a long way.

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are "Blue". The Blue State mentality. This is supposed to get us off the hook for what is/was happening during the last few years in our country (The USA). It doesn't get anyone off the hook but it makes us feel better, as though we aren't benefiting in any way from living here and getting all the good stuff that a US citizen gets just by being a US citizen. But I'm so sick of bitching about this. It doesn't do any good.

`` Boy Next Door '' is a hilarious romp through male neurosis . In just over fifteen minutes , the characters in the film come together and then split apart again and again like so many pages from a madcap mystery novel . all the while , we follow the action from the point of view of an audience member who has never met a gay man before but is forced to deal with them after they are thrust into an uncomfortable situation . as the plot unfolds , we watch as the main characters , played by an all-star ensemble , struggle to get through each and every day while dealing with their sexual issues .

Great Movie ! The sound track is awesome ! Very relaxing sound . Elton was ahead of his own time . That's all I have to say . Great Movie ! The sound track is awesome

Reviewer:

Great movie! Great Sound Track! My husband and I love the movie and we love the music on the soundtrack!! Reviewer:

this is one of my favorite movies, and one of my favorite soundtracks! it has the perfect balance of musical styles: classical, rock, pop, jazz, soul, etc.

Wow! An amazing, lost piece of Australiana AND a lost 70s glam-rock film rolled into one. This film warrants viewing simply to see what can be done with next to no budget but a lot of enthusiasm. As a retelling of the Oz story, the film borders on becoming too obvious but it is saved by it's eccentricities. The chance for a glimpse at how glam rock manifested in Australia will delight fans of the genre. This film used to be double featured with the Rocky Horror Picture Show, an indicator of the type of film that Oz is.

Robin Hood; Men in Tights is worth watching, I recently watched it because I've just become a Cary Elwes fan, and this is one of of his lead-roles. Some moments really made me crack up so hard! I didn't expect them you know, it was so funny, Even the 2nd time around you'd still fall off your chair The cast is great, of course especially Robin of Locksley himself,Cary, but Blinkin and the Sheriff and Little John (Don't let the name fool you, it's veryy big!

My kids loved this movie. we watched it every chance we got.it was fun a fun movie. we watched it as a family and everyone of us enjoyed it. it was a movie you could watch without any uncomfortable spots that you would have to explain to the younger ones. my boys loved this movie and they would love to be able to see it again. even after all these years they remember it. that Amy Jo Johnson was a very cute girl. all my boys had crushes on her. they loved her as the pink power ranger which is why we watched this movie to begin with.

* * * SPOILERS * * * * * * SPOILERS * * * THE CELL / ( 2000 )



In the first part of this article, we examine the basic elements of a story-based game. We’ll look at the plot, the characters, the setting, and the overall game mechanics. The second part will delve more into the mechanics of The Cell itself, while the third section will look at how to run a session of The Cell. The Cell: Basic Elements

First, we’ll start with the most basic element of a story-based game… the plot.

The film begins with a cranky old Broadway producer (exceptionally well-played by veteran character actor Richard Carle) being driven by a man hoping to sell him a story for an upcoming play. However, there is a bad storm and their car becomes stuck in the mud and so they are forced to look for some place to spend the night. Fortunately, there's a mansion nearby though it seems pretty odd that the people inside know the writer and he says he didn't realize this was the home of a man he knew (and despised).

On their way to a country house to hear a new play being read a theatrical producer , his secretary , and his chauffeur are attacked and kidnapped by masked men. As the kidnappers threaten the chauffeur with torture and death , the play is being read . The play has a strong political subtext , and at one point it reads , "I believe we have reached a new period of history , and there are no longer any safe places , that is why I , for instance , do not go out unless my bodyguards are with me. "

This epic brings together a superbly-gifted cast and crew , a narrative depth superior to most novels , wonderful music , and a story line and pace that will keep you glued to the pages for two and a half months. I recommend this book to all fans of science fiction, and anyone looking for a well-written, non-superheroic tale of survival, friendship and survival. It is a novel about what would happen after a nuclear war. It is an epic that deals with survival, human decency and the human spirit . The characters are wonderful and they have a life of their own .

comeundone, I love you! I could not have come to a better conclusion than you did about this movie and it's ending. My family has not seen this movie yet, but I know them too well; they will hate it. But this time, I watched it alone and I found that it affected me greatly. Although the movie is long in length, I was tied to the story and amazed by the ending. I initially thought it was weird as to how she just vanished, but on some level, it makes perfect sense.But like comeundone said, this movie does not make sense of reality.

for a movie like this little hidden gem to come out in the 80s, its shocking how not a lot of people know about it.this movie is definitely worth a look. it has all the things you need for a horror movie. especially the good old chills.i remember watching this movie for the first time about 15 years ago, but i couldn't remember the name of it, so i came to IMDb a few years ago to ask for help on finding the title. i eventually got the name of the title, and bought the movie.

A remarkable film , bringing to the surface all sorts of feelings I had when I was much , much younger. The film deals with issues such as death and loneliness, but also with the meaning and purpose of life itself. I have never thought much about such things, so I cannot tell you if this film is a success or not in the end. If you like it, be prepared for some serious reflection and even sadness . The film has quite a bit of black humour , and is not without its light moments.

I 'm not the type of person to watch T.V . shows because the acting normally sucks or it 's stupid. I am the kind of person that likes a good drama, like a good comedy and the good comedy shows that I 'll watch have great acting. I 'm not saying the acting is awesome on that show or something because there 's not that great of an acting on most of the T.V shows. The thing about the acting is that in all three shows, I feel like I 've seen these people before, if that makes sense.

*spoiler* *spoilers* *spoilers* I found the film amusing.It was weird and I enjoy it,I laughed a lot so the bottom line is that I recommend the film.However I have problems with what LaBute wanted to say.The plot is very simple.Betty(Renee Zellweger), a hard life house wife watch her husband being murdered and while having forgotten everything she had seen,she follow her "true love" for a soap series character,Dr. David Ravell (Greg Kinnear). Simple enough but not enough to hold a 95 minutes film.

If you overlook the fact that the plot has been done many times , this is a hilarious and gleefully subversive film that takes a look at what happens when you have a group of people gathered together for a game that they all want to win. A group of friends who play the game of their dreams (and not their real life) come together to play for the big prize and things go awry very quickly. The main thing that I like in this movie is that we get to see all the characters that the audience would know from the TV show get to say some lines and do some scenes .

This show is my absolute favorite . This show is intelligent , entertaining and always full of surprises . Lauren is an amazing actor and singer . I love this show and it is a must see if you don't like reality TV . Great job to all who worked on this show this season . You will be missed on the next one . I really hope I see all of you on the next season . I want to thank my mom and my dad for taking me to see this show . If you love music , you gotta see this show!

Brilliant film ! I am sorry to say that it resembles to me a bit like Pulp F. but thats only because I saw the original when I was 14 or so. It has got to be seen to believe ! I saw it on cable yesterday and absolutely loved it. I was pleasantly surprised that it was so close to the book. I didn't see that it was a movie. I really didn't think it would be that good, but it really was. Maybe I should have been paying attention to the ads and trailers for this movie!

Strange enough, shorts like this get a 10. Why? They are hilarious. This is hilarious. Notice a lot of the quirky humor. Dated and childish to toon naysayers, but they don't know what they're talking about. They got to know that cartoons aren't just for kids. The art in this is probabley the best non-Road Runner art of the 1950's Looney Tunes shorts. It's hard to come across something better than the art in "The Great Piggy Bank Robbery", although nothing ever will. This probabley runs a close 3rd or 2nd.

It came before "the ten commandments" "land of the Pharaohs" "Ben Hur" and it's overlooked today.How unfair!Based on Mika Waltari's mammoth novel ,it doesn't cheapen it!Waltari's novel was so huge only a miniseries could have done it justice (I hope it will be done some day).Waltari,whose message is essentially Christian remains intact(another of his books "the secret of the kingdom" (first part) takes place after Christ's death in the Holy Land).

This is definitely one of the better documentaries I have seen looking at family relationships and marriage . I saw this when I was looking for a documentary to see if my daughter would like it and she loved it. I would highly recommend this for anyone looking for an interesting look at relationships. I loved that it was a true story and was told in the order it happened rather than in some of the other documentaries which start out with an idea of how the family would end up or why they are divorced and go on a little too long about what happened in the past.

I have been a "huge" rush fan ever since "moving pictures" and this concert is simply and example to everyone who is a fan why Rush is so popular. They completely admitted to playing their biggest concert yet, and, despite the rain in a soccer arena, they still manage to give an outstanding performance from start to finish. A real example of this is during "yyz" the entire crowd start to sing along to it in a real classic manner, in perfect sinc. They really play all of everyone's favorite songs with a real powerful "lust" that rarely happens anymore.

Tex Avery's tenure as director of cartoons for MGM was in the 1940s and 50s was one of the brightest moments in cartoon history. His cartoons were exceptionally inventive and surreal with MANY weird touches that were later celebrated in the movie THE MASK. Eyes popping out when a guy sees a girl, impossible stunts and non-stop action were the trademarks of these films.This is one of several Droopy cartoons that Avery was responsible for and it's among his best. Droopy is a Mountie and he is determined to get his man,...though in this case it's a wolf who has escaped from prison.

Had the pleasure to see this film at the Big Bear Film Festival where it won the Audience Award. And I have to say, it was well deserved because Boy Next Door is a very funny short film! The script is well written and keeps things escalating. It also has a great current of suspense coursing through it. You don't know what's going to happen next as the main character tries to deal with the realization that his new neighbor might not be the most ideal person to be living across from him. The jokes are quick and unexpected.

The four signs on the road say "If You're Looking For Fun.....You Don't Need A Reason....All You Need Is A Gun....It's Rabbit Season! "In the woods, we see hundreds of "Rabbit Season" signs posted on every tree. We see more and more signs pointing exactly to Bugs Bunny's hole. Who's putting up all these signs? Daffy Duck!Daffy puts the last sign up, tiptoes away and says to us, the audience, "Awfully unsporting of me, I know.

The Tempest has been interpreted in many different ways ranging from more or less traditional views as dealing with Art to more post-modern approaches that like to dissect the play along post-colonial, feminist, gender or deconstructionist lines. The reason why Jarman's version left me fairly cold is that I didn't have a clue what he was on about. What is the underlying vision/idea/concept behind this rendering of Shakespeare? The previous reviewers do not get much further than revenge tragedy, punk show, but surely there is more to it, isn't there?

Very good `` Precoder '' starring Dick Barthelmess , which in a way , kind of reminded me of Hawks' films. The picture begins , as most of these does , in a little town , somewhere in the Midwest , which has been reduced to utter ruin through war. A family of three , father and mother and their son , have taken refuge there with the hope that they can live in peace , when suddenly the father is shot by the American army , but the son escapes by jumping out of the window of the house into the arms of a passing army truck.

Style over substance . But what a style it is . `` The Cell '' is the internal version of a new model, which will come out on sale a few weeks

After a period of stagnation, the market of electric vehicles is experiencing an extraordinary upsurge. The question is whether this renaissance will last. It will depend, in part, on whether or not the Chinese market will return to its old growth patterns or, on the other hand, will the global market for electric vehicles continue its upward climb? It has just been over two weeks since Elon Musk’s Tesla made its debut in Beijing.

With all the dreck out there, this is a gentle movie about young love. Yes, it's true that young love often makes more out of something than it deserves, but why aren't people down on "Romeo and Juliet"? Paul and Michelle are models of good behave compared to them.Yes, they run away, and set up an ideal life, but this is a movie, not real life. Paul is more sexually interested than Michelle, who has been come onto in a bad way. Eventually, they have sex, but no one is forced into it.

Wagon Master is a very unique film amongst John Ford 's work . Mainly because it 's the only one that I can think of off the top of my head that isn 't a 'western' , or even an action-adventure film. The closest to it would be The Quiet Man , which has a very similar structure. I think I would love to see a remake of Wagon Master , and I'd probably love it even more if it was in 3D ! There's so much to like in this film , but I don't know that it 's even the best John Ford 's film .

This epic brings together a superbly-gifted cast and crew, a narrative depth superior to most novels, wonderful music, philosophy and a connection to LIFE that I find difficult to explain. To immerse oneself in Die Zweite Heimat is for me akin to a spiritual experience, similar to the awe one gets when looking at the stars in a clear night sky. The language, and use of both colour and monochrome segments adds to the dramatic impact. The film inspired me to go to Munich and visit some of the locations, including the Edgar Reitz office.

One of the most pleasurable aspects of movie viewing is to get lost in a film. To have it totally wash over you, so that you absorb it as it is, and thus, experience it to the fullest. Every time I see it, 'The Egyptian' is such a film. Over the years it is a picture critics have loved to hate. Many have thrown darts at its vulnerabilities. But perhaps it is because of the very tone the film brings with it rather than its most obvious characteristics. It is at once forbidding, remote, possibly dangerous; beware of what lies within!

Just Before Dawn really surprised me when I saw it by being far less of a gruesome horror adventure than I expected. Instead the director Jeff Lieberman conjures up a wonderfully evocative and disquieting atmosphere for great stretches of the movie, building the suspense constantly until I was really unsure about what was going to happen but wound up tight as a spring waiting for it. The lack of action in many parts gave it a very Deliverance mixed with The Texas Chainsaw Massacre kinda ambiance, and when the action really kicks in, its truly shocking and dramatic, without ever even really needing to be gory.

"The bad dreams always come back again like unwanted friends," says Marion Fairlie, who with her half-sister, Laura, lives in a vast mid-Victorian country estate. "And last night I found myself in Limmeridge churchyard. Normally, people who are dead stay dead, just as normally it is the criminals who are locked up rather than the victims. But then, there was nothing normal about what happened to us..." And we're off on a first-class Gothic story of madness, deception and villainy, based on Wilkie Collins' great novel of Victorian mystery.

It's interesting to watch how late 1950's society is depicted in this film. Men are lecherous, chain-smoking boozers with one thing on their minds (time hasn't changed men all that much, but "sexual harassment" has) & women are in the workplace only passing time until they find a husband & settle down. Some of the dialog is cringe-worthy but yet it's charming in an innocent, passé way. I love the opening credits that show a romantic, exciting view of Manhattan with Johnny Mathis singing "The Best Of Everything" on the soundtrack.

The film starts with promise because there is more interaction between Spanky and Buckwheat , but as the film progresses the interaction dwindles. Spanky and Buckwheat do not talk to one another and when Spanky comes into contact with new characters Buckwheat seems more of an afterthought. Spanky the Great is a series of comedy shorts featuring Spanky, a dimwitted kid, and the world of kids, adults, and other people. It was created by Warner Bros. cartoonist Hal Seeger, who also provided the voices for the title character and a few minor characters. Most of the voices are provided by the cast of the MGM animated series.

See No Evil With Kane. The Movie Has a great storyline But it just wasn't a Hide my eye's, Scream Out Loud Horror Flick I thought it was going to be from watching the WWE Superstars on Monday Night Raw When The Movie First Came To Theaters. I Did ENJOY The Movie Though I Loved The Story It Played Out.GREAT MOVIE EXCELLENT WOULD LIKE TO SEE A PART 2 It Doesn't Matter If Kane Gets Killed At The EndOr Not They Have Killed Off Other Horror Stars In Every Movie They Have Out And They Still Comeback For More So a part 2 wouldBe Very Interesting.

I could n't believe the eye candy from start to finish . Being a fan of movies directed by music video directors I was pretty excited about this one. I will admit I had some reservations at the beginning. I had no idea what they were doing with this movie and I wondered if it could ever live up to the greatness of their other music videos. Well after seeing the movie I can see what the guys were aiming for and this is a great film. It has all the music videos that fans have loved all the way up to now.

Neil LaBute takes a dramatic turn from his first two films, In The Company of Men & Your Friends and Neighbors, with this funny and original thriller/comedy/road movie. When Betty (Renee Zellwegger) witnesses the brutal murder of her no-good husband (Aaron Eckhart), she develops a bizarre sort of amnesia, and flees in his car, not knowing that there is large stash of drugs in the trunk. Morgan Freeman and Chris Rock are the hit men who follow her.What Betty is chasing, besides a new beginning (although she can't remember the old life) is her beloved, Dr. David Ravell (Greg Kinnear).

One of the better made for TV biopics , I just wish it had told us more . I have never seen this film . But the fact that it was made as a TV show and was made by one of the biggest TV networks was a good thing for this film . A lot of this film has been made for TV , and it shows . It has to make sense for people who might not even watch a TV show , because this is how they would see it . There are so many little things , which are so perfect for this film , that it was almost unreal .

An Intelligent and well obtained film worth to export! In this exiting and really intelligent movie filmed entirely in Bogotá, you can feel the total meaning of the word "Bluff"(although is a Colombian film, the title is in presented in English); ! The story is about Nicolas Andrade (Federico Lorusso), a photographer who find his girlfriend Margarita (Catalina Aristizabal) having an affair with his boss Pablo Mallarino (Victor Mallarino), owner of a magazine; after this Nicolas is left without girlfriend and without any job.

I saw the Messiah:- The First Killings and I thought it was absolutely one of the best programmes I have seen, ever. It was one of those programmes that you think that oh, no, I cannot watch the rest of this but you feel compelled to watch it just to see who done it. Jamie Draven was an absolutely amazing actor in it, to be able to switch between two totally, totally different characters one of which is the evil, nasty person that did it and the other person who is Jez Clifton, the cop.

I didn't personally know Karen Carpenter, nor, Richard for that matter, so I must go by how the movie portrayed her. I think a better person to ask about it's accuracy would be her brother Richard. However, from what I did see and learn of Karen, I felt her pain, share her sadness, and she was a very special person to me growing up. I know that I wasn't born until 1965 so I didn't get to know her as much as some of you older fans but I definitely grew up listening to her music and I have fond memories of her music.

I was on my way out one morning when I was checking something on the T.V. and came across this film. I don't ever remember seeing this or hearing of it. What a fun and interesting one to watch. Well, my meeting was pushed back, because I couldn't get out of this film. It had some real interesting things in it that marked it's time in history, and some fun things that they don't have people do in today's film because it's not pretty. Well, there was a lot of realism in it.

Police officer Dirk Hendricks (Jamie Bartlett) files an amnesty application Alex Mpondo (Chiwetel Ejiofor).A member of the South African Parliament who cant remember the torture he once endured as a captive political activist.South African born attorney Sarah Barcant (Hilary Swank), meanwhile, returns to her homeland to represent Mpondo.As well as Steve Sizela, Mpondo's friend who was arrested along with him, and never heard from again.This film is one of the best films to come out about the South African regime of Aparthied, in the past.Everybody should watch it.

THE CELL (2000) Rating: 8/10The Cell, like Antz, must be watched twice to be appreciated. The first time I saw this film I thought it was mediocre, but the film had such a lasting impression on me after viewing, I decided I had to rent it again. I did, and I found the film to be much more likeable. The Cell is not for everyone, but it divides its stories up with quality and is a visually intelligent film that dreams up images and plot ideas that could not be matched.

I just want to say that Chris Diamantopoulos 's role as Williams for that entire show , was Emmy worthy in my opinion . I hope this is the first and last time I write a letter about him, but I felt his portrayal had a lot to do with the great chemistry on set, and his work on set was impeccable . He would come in on time, and work until the last take. He was always willing to listen to feedback from the producers, and even if there was nothing to change he would say so.

Don't you ever miss the good old days when Disney actually made great movies that really moved you? Growing up with Disney I always found myself being captivated by the characters. Every single one seemed truly talented and knew how to act their way through a movie. I remember Friday nights and running to turn on the TV just to watch their newest movies. Susie Q was one of my all time favorites. I never forgot this movie. Even till this day when one mentions the song "Susie Q" I always remember the movie.

Working at a movie theater as a projectionist , I have the opportunity to watch basically every movie that comes out . I’ve watched all the Star Wars movies, as many as three a week. I saw Star Wars : The Force Awakens before it was released, and saw it TWICE. I’ve seen the entire original trilogy at least five times. I saw all the Jurassic Park movies in theaters, for free . I was in the right seat when Spielberg released them all on the same day on DVD, and watched them all over again at home.

The make -or-break of a love story for me is whether or not I like the characters and also if they click with each other. Matt is pretty unlikeable: aloof, braggart, seemingly lazy, and a misogynist. He's been hurt badly by his dysfunctional mom and this makes him a little easier to take. I guess I liked the details of his dysfunction--he was believable. He overcompensates by bragging that he'l nail Amy. He acts so cool around Amy that he strikes out twice. When they do talk he can't show her who he really is.

Just Before Dawn is one of those really good slashers that send chills down your spine every time you watch it. The first time I saw it I was so scared and that was with just the trailer and I was even more scared when I went to see the full movie. This movie will make you cry and it is really emotional when you are watching it. I recommend watching it if you are one of those people who are scared of horror movies or if you have a heart and you love scary movies.

The best of everything . Just what is the best of everything ? It is different for everyone but for me it is . It’s easy to explain but hard to define, but I think that if you ask people what it is that they enjoy the most then most of them will give you the answer that you are looking for . That is what I try to do, in my own words , I try to look to see what is good for me and to share that with those who would like to read it .

I have been watching King of Queens from the beginning, and have felt it is overlooked at the award shows. This show has the best humor, you can identify with the characters, we talk about it at work a lot, because I work at a company a lot like IPS, (DHL) and we just love the Teamster plugs!! Carrie is my hero, she is the best, she just puts it out there, no matter what the subject is. Arthur well what can you say? He just cracks you up, and really puts a spin on things.

A lot about USA The Movie can be summed up in its title. It draws parallels between the attitudes of this country in the face of war and a kind of Hollywood-like falseness that glorifies things that shouldn't be glorified. I'm not sure I agree with the filmmaker's take on recent events (although, truthfully, I can't always tell exactly where he stands) but I admire the unusual and artistic way of getting the point across. Audio tracks of speeches, radio interviews, poetry etc. play as large a role here as visuals.

"The Honkers" is probably Slim Pickens best performance of all time. When we were shooting, everyone connected with the production figured that Slim was Academy Award material. Unfortunately, United Artists had a James Bond picture in release at the same time and did not devote much attention to "The Honkers". I personally feel this film was under-rated by most critics. Sam Peckinpaw's "Junior Bonner" was out at the same time and seemed to impress the critics more than our film. Also, Cliff Robertson had a rodeo film out a few months before our release and that might have hurt us, too.

A train holding union soldiers is transporting $300,000 of gold, along with a banker Clayton, who's there to see it reaches its destination, but it's suddenly robbed by the bandit Monetero. However Bahunda nicks off with the gold and hides it, but when Monetero tries to get it out of him, he's killed by soldiers. The only clue is that of a medallion, but Monetero is captured and soon would be executed. A stranger dressed up as a priest comes by (who after the bounty of Monetero) and offers to save his life for half of the gold.

Neil LaBute takes a dramatic turn from his first two films , In The Company of Men & Your Friends & Neighbors , in which his protagonists are always at the mercy of a hostile universe. In The Shape of Things (2006) and This Is My Family (2009), the focus of his concern is himself, and the universe seems benign. In The Break of Noon, he once again portrays a world that he knows well. But he does so in a novel way. "In the beginning there was darkness and, with a roar, the darkness exploded into light.

I can't comment on the accuracy of this production, historical or literary, but I can say that I enjoyed it. If there is a God, the sound track will be released, Ilona Sekacz' work is truly enduring. Twenty years on I am still moved by the haunting themes of this production and return to it frequently.The story surrounds the entry into society of Catherine Moreland. Somewhat awkward and possessed of an unhealthy interest in Gothic stories (early pulp fiction? ), Catherine descends on Bath in the company of Mrs Allen where she meets Henry Tilney.

I had always heard about this great mini-series , but viewed it for the first time this week , July 9, 2011. After watching Episode 1, i have to admit i'm impressed by the script, acting , direction , editing and the whole experience of watching the series. I think it's a must see for all . I'd give it a 7/10. The best of the series to date is the Episode 3 , Episode 4 and Episode 3 , all of which are excellent. The rest , well not so much , i'd give a 7.

Inarguably one of the most interesting filmmakers of the last 50 years , Werner Herzog has been pushing the boundaries of cinema for decades with his unique brand of cinema verite and docufictions. His most famous film is called 'Agua y arena', about the making of 'Nosferatu' in 1979 which has been used as inspiration to a number of people in the last years. Werner Herzog is a fascinating character who has created quite a cult and he has managed to stay relatively unknown throughout his career, with only a limited amount of his work available in English.

Eager electronics whiz Brian Foster (a likable performance by Wesley Eure of TV's "Land of the Lost") creates a computerized watchdog called C.H.O.M.P.S. (an acronym for Canine Home Protection System) for his boss Mr. Ralph Norton (nicely played by Conrad Baain), whose home security business is floundering. A rival company hires a pair of inept criminals to get their grubby hands on C.H.O.M.P.S. ; said task proves to be easier said than done. Director Don Chaffey relates the endearingly dopey story at a constant brisk pace, maintains an amiably silly and lighthearted tone throughout, and stages the goofy slapstick gags with considerable flair.

This if the first movie I've given a 10 to in years. If there was ever a movie that needed word-of-mouth to promote, this is it. A $4 Mil box is a disgrace. People don't know what it's about. If you have any appreciation for the Blues, or just a good use of excellent music, that alone is reason to go see it. How many people knew Jackson could sing, and damn fine too. You hear books and movies taunting that they're about salvation. After seeing this, you'll never be able to forgive such trivial use of the word.

I resisted watching 15 Park Avenue despite of recommendations, discarding the movie as a clichéd topic of extreme emotional dramas and over-the-top acting.Once in a while, movies like 15 Park Avenue come by and sweep you off your feet.The movie grasps your attention pretty early on and there is no moment to rest after that. Aparna Sen has done a wonderful job of gluing the audience to every line of the movie. The impeccable character development, "just right" amount of emotions and an enigmatic end to match it all...I have a renewed respect for Konkana Sen Sharma, who convincingly plays the schizophrenic Mithi.

wow! i just have to say this show is super cool! i fell in love with the show from the beginning! the idea of the show is very original and very soothing! it's also a pleasure to watch the performance the two lovely leading ladies give, Lauren Graham and Alexis Bledel! they're simply wonderful! i'm especially a big admirer of Lauren Graham! she's not just a pretty face, she's a "monster" of an actress as well! i'm not saying that Alexis isn't a wonderful actress as well... i just happen to like Lauren better!

There are a few things in life that we ca n't experience more than once and the college experience is a good example of this. We learn how to manage our time, work in a collegiate environment, and become independent as well as more social by participating in clubs, organizations, and student government. Another thing that you'll have the opportunity to experience many times while in college is that you'll probably have to live on campus. There are a variety of things you can do with your college experience, but these are my top ten most fun college things:

1.
