i really love this movie , i saw it for the first time when i was working a video store. when i went to buy it they told me it was out of print and i couldn't order it so i just today thought i would look. and then i found it they put it out in Spain on DVD under the name "Algo Mas Que Amigos" and you can buy there it is in English and Spanish on the DVD....hope this helps ..... i know how hard it is to find movies that we love that they haven't Released to The U.S Market.

This is the best movie I have ever seen . It has it all tragedy and happiness love and hate . It shows us how we all should be. It is hard to sum up this wonderful film in two sentences. It is a story that shows us what it is like to live in wartime. It also shows us how hard it is for a mother to live in the world she is forced to live in by the people who are running the show. It is so realistic that you can not help but feel it is your own life that is being depicted in the film.

I'm not the biggest fan of westerns. My two personal favorites though are Unforgiven, and Tombstone. This movie though, I loved! It was great! The plot was well done, and it was a fun movie. Everybody who had a part in this movie did excellent! I even think it beat out both movies in someway. Well, not really Unforgiven because that was a superb movie that these two can't compare with in the long run. I do think it beat out Tombstone though. Both had its strong points.

Finally a true horror movie. This is the first time in years that I had to cover my eyes. I am a horror buff and I recommend this movie but it is quite gory. I am not a big wrestling fan but Kane really pulled the whole monster thing off. I have to admit that I didn't want to see this movie, my 17 year old dragged me to it, but am very glad I did. During and after the movie I was looking over my shoulder. I have to agree with others about the whole remake horror movies enough is enough.

when I first heard about this movie , I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the time . how could that possibly be ? not because it was poorly made , or had a poor script . i mean , who could possibly object to the notion of a young man having a dream girl , and that dream girl being a vampire ? no , it was a matter of taste , a matter of opinions . the critics had spoken . and i had heard their opinions . it's a shame , i thought . and , frankly , i couldn't have been more right .

I guess my husband and I are a little slow. We don't usually warm up to a series until they are almost at the end of their production life. In this case, we didn't start watching KoQs until almost the 6th season. I'm not sure how it escaped our radar for so long. Other than the fact that we are not big fans of "appointment" TV viewing. Our schedules our such that we don't like to commit to watching series every time they come on (and we didn't have a DVR yet).

Having grown up in the typing pool era and dealing with office politics and men who were apt to make comments about my appearance, I learned to be quick with a pen and quick on my fingers. I could make a lot of money in a hurry, but not as quickly as I could have in my daydreams, which meant that I was not going to get rich. If I hadn’t come to know my limits, I’d be broke now, too. The only thing that’s ever changed for me was my perspective.

I love to see a female protagonist , in this movie her name was Rose . Rose brought out a new type of a female character in the movie. There is one scene in this movie, which I want to mention, it's the part when she has a talk with her mother about the men. The scene goes like this .

" You know mom , the man I'm going out with tonight, he is a very kind and gentle man . He's been a friend to me from when we were kids. When I told my friends about him , they just laughed.

Unfortunately , I 've never seen the full version of this movie . I did see the 87-minute version twice , and I know some of the events that occur at the movie's climax . And I think you can get that from what I 've written here . I have to admit that as an adult , I 've had a bit of an " ack " reaction to this movie . This was a big deal when it first came out . Many parents were afraid their kids would see this film and think that it was okay to do things like this .

Well.....I wouldn't want to lecture anybody but I do feel the urge to say some things I consider important about this BEAUTIFUL film. I saw it for the first time in 1976 (I was 14) and then one more time a year later. That was it. The rest of it was the pink LP of Elton John's soundtrack getting the music and the story deeper and deeper inside my heart. How deep? A week ago my cousin gave me a VHS copy as a present. (No DVD's yet). Boy....was I surprised!!

Great period piece that shows how attitudes have changed in 40 years . Great production design , appealing stars , great dialogue and a great theme song . This movie is for those who are old school , like me , and want to relive their youth . The special effects and costumes in this movie will wow anyone who sees the film . The special effects in this movie are amazing . This movie has it all , great music , great costumes , and great production . This movie will make you laugh and you will not be able to sleep once you hear the song .

Gosh , I am learning pretty fast that sometimes when you see a film as a youngster and then again as an older person, it doesn't necessarily mean you have changed in the time that has passed . As a boy, I saw it as a campy adventure ( which it was ) , while as a man , it is a great film and has stood the test of time well . But I have always said this film , like many of his films , would have been better had it been written by a man .

In dramatising Wilde's novel, John Osborne has condensed events, eliminated a number of characters, and generally implied rather than shown Dorian's essential wickedness. If you want a more explicit rendering, see the 1945 film. Wilde and Robert Louis Stevenson lived in about the same time frame, but were certainly vastly different men and writers. This story really treats of a theme similar to Stevenson's "Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde", but note that Wilde chose to treat his story as fantasy, whereas RLS took the scientific route.

Please be aware that this film has nothing to do with the Radio City Music Hall ! As an archivist, I've seen a lot of great films I can't help but share, even when they're not mine. This is one of those. For those that don't know the film is based on the true story of George and Gracie Hart, an American musical-comedy couple who married in the late 1940's, with Gracie singing, George playing drums. The film tells the story of their marriage and early years, as well as how they rose to fame.

I saw this movie for the first time a little over a year ago . I 've seen it 4 times already in my life. And each time I see it I get more and more excited as it approaches closer and closer. I 've heard so many good things about this movie that it 's almost guaranteed that I will watch it yet again this time around. And if you 're thinking about this film then you 're doing it at your own risk . There 's a lot of blood and guts in this movie . and it may get a little violent .

This enjoyable Euro-western opens with a scene that predates a similar scene that Sergio Leone wanted to shoot for ``The Good, The Bad, and the Ugly.'' An elderly couple sit in a small train station cafe. A man and a woman come to meet the couple, only to be greeted by the old man. The man and the man's wife then exit the train and head back down the platform. They are joined by two men, one with a gun. Suddenly the man and his wife jump onto the car and start shooting.

One of the better made for TV biopics, I just wish it had told us more. I have read many biographies and seen other things about the Carpenters, and this movie did what it could, based on the constraints placed on it by the family. Cynthis Gibb did a wonderful job trying to bring Karen to life. One of my disappointments is that there was not more insight into Karen's anorexia. In the reading I have done about the disease (especially Cherry Boone O'Neill's wonderful book, Starving for Attention) anorexia appears to be a disease of control.

POSSIBLE SPOILERSNo one is likely to pick up a DVD of Red Dust without knowing that it is about South Africa's Truth and Reconciliation Commission. Hilary Swank stars as a South African exile who returns to her home town as a lawyer representing Alex Mpondo (Chiwetel Ejiofer), a member of the South African parliament who was tortured by a prison guard, Pete Muller (Ian Roberts), who is seeking to escape prison by testifying before the Truth and Reconciliation Commission. They could certainly have found an actress who has or could imitate a South African accent; Ms. Swank makes no attempt whatsoever to cover her unmistakably American accent.

If you are a fan of early Duke movies , this Lone Star oldie is a good one . What was the movie about ? A wealthy Texan wants to purchase land from a poor Indian . The Indians want their lands back , but they also want some kind of reward for giving it up . When a group of them ride up to meet the rich man , they are stopped at gunpoint , and then the rich man offers to help the Indians find their land , which he thinks is in Colorado . Of course , the rich man is secretly planning to sell the land to the government .

This is a film that is far more enjoyable than its rating of 7 would suggest. In many ways, it's like a 50s version of VALLEY OF THE DOLLS--with much of the excesses and sleaziness of VALLEY polished up a bit for the audiences of 1959. Like this later film, both are about three young ladies who are on the fast-track to success--though this time it's in the publishing world instead of the entertainment industry (though one of the ladies in THE BEST OF EVERYTHING does have aspirations of Broadway).The film begins with Hope Lange coming into the company for her first day of work.

I loved this movie ! OH MY GOSH ! This movie rocked so hard ! I found it amongst some old movies and never watched it again :/ But now I feel like I should have seen it a 100 times more than I did. So glad I found it now ! Love it ! I think I might be a bit weird but just like everything else by this amazing director :/ I love all his movies, I saw a couple of them for the first time years ago and they still have not lost any of their magic !

Working at a movie theater as a projectionist, I have the opportunity to watch basically every movie that comes out. When I first saw the trailer for 'Black Snake Moan' I laughed and thought, "Great. Another 'Snakes on a Plane' Samuel L Jackson movie". But of course, I wanted to see it for the laugh factor. Many people have judged this movie too quickly based on the innuendo in the title, the images on promotional ads and on the fact that Justin Timberlake is in the film. Personally I loved every second of this movie.

I did n't have very high expectations about Just Before Dawn . I do n't know why I keep buying books by authors that I have no interest in whatsoever. But I did make an exception to this rule, and I enjoyed it. The book starts right where the first one left off. And it was an interesting ending, but a sad ending in some respects. And we get a little bit more exposition, a lot of flashbacks, and then we get the next part of the book, which I did n't enjoy as much. I found it a bit hard to connect with.

I loved this movie! OH MY GOSH! This movie rocked so hard! I found it amongst some old tapes and didn't know what it was and after having read the back of the cover to see what the summer had to say about it (Which btw, mentioned the fact that Elton John covered the soundtrack for the film more times than it mentioned what the film was actually about. ), I thought it sounded interesting, and I was even more interested in seeing it because it was an older film. "What controversy?"

"Jaded" should not be considered as en erotic thriller because the sex scenes are not for viewing pleasure unlike movies like "Indecent Behavior" or "Friend Of The Family". "Jaded" is not an easy watch as it's story is difficult to conceive and it's not that common in society. From the beginning of the movie, with the first scene, you expect more strong scenes. The raping scene wasn't (in my opinion) a well created scene. I think that the director didn't use proper camera techniques overall in the movie.

It 's hard to know what to make of this weird little Aussie crime flick - on the one hand, it 's all over the place, with a plot that makes no sense, a tone that seems to be trying to be multiple genres at once. And yet, there 's an energy that keeps me going through the whole thing; and I can 't help feeling there 's some good stuff here. The cast is a decent mix, and it 's interesting to see them trying their hand at all this stuff.

I absolutely ADORED this movie as a child and still do as an adult . To say that is even close to "good" is a huge understatement. Even though most of the "good" ideas in this were actually pretty stupid, there were also several good ones in there. My favorite is the one at the beginning where they try to figure out how a person's soul moves through their body, and one of them says something like "well, if I think really hard, can I move my arms?" The other guy answers "No".

I was expecting this movie to suck, but what I got was a pretty good slasher/gore film. Most of the death scenes are adequately brutal. The teens are decent, with Penny McNamee definitely the best of the bunch. Rachael Taylor looks like a young Christie Brinkley, but doesn't bring much to the movie other than that. Kane was good as the killer, and is totally believable as a fearsome juggernaut. I saw the "twist" coming from miles away, but I still enjoyed the movie.But what really stood out to me was the direction.

One of the most entertaining of all silent comedies is Pudovkin's short 'Chess Fever', a mad tale of how a rigorously intellectual board game could disrupt even the most carefully planned central economies. Such an unpromising comedic subject as chess found an earlier outlet in this delightful short. Two young men play the game earnestly against an artificial background, a painted set. This is in contrast to earlier Lumiere shorts such as 'L'Arrosseur Arrosse' or 'Repas du bebe', wherein the human activity was deliberately framed by a natural setting.

This film had me spellbound this evening . Thanks to Fox Movie Classics for showing it uninterrupted . John Voight is exceptional . He's a true actor who can make a performance work . And it was so good to watch again , now at age 84 , after many years . I love his performance . I don't even like John Wayne but this one was so good I've watched it again, a couple more times. This is a very good film. It is one of the few where you can see Wayne's true acting skills and not just his cowboy-ness.

After seeing Meredith in `` Beyond the Prairie '' I had to buy another film with her staring . I had seen parts of the other movies she has been in. This one had a little bit of comedy and it showed how much she enjoyed acting. It took place in the 60's. I thought she had a good acting ability in this movie. If she is going to be in more movies I hope her acting will improve. I found the movie to be interesting and I think anyone who is a fan of Meredith will enjoy it.

King of Queens is comic genius . Kevin James , whom plays IPS deliveryman Doug Heffernan is extremely funny , as we've seen on the show for many , many years. In one scene , Heffernan gets a new haircut , which , if you look closely, is exactly like his older brother , played by Paul Michael Valley . If you have a little time , watch the episode , in which Paul goes to visit the Heffernan brothers and finds his older brother's hair in Doug Heffernan's . I've seen the episode twice already , and it's still hilarious .

I don't think I have ever seen a better movie parody. Mel Brooks is insane. EVERY time I watch it I find something new and it makes it even more funny than the time before. Cary Elwes is perfect for the role of Robin Hood. It has a great and unexpected ending that leaves you cracking up. Every character is great from Little John and Will to Maid Marian and Broomhilde. I laughed the whole way through and will never get tired of it. Watch it! !If you liked Cary Elwes in this Movie, you must definitely see The Princess Bride.

Adult version of the classic Lewis Carroll tale is much better than you might expect . Here Alice is a college girl in trouble who finds herself going back in time through a wardrobe into the White Rabbit and the rest of the book is her search for the White Queen and the Red King

Alice in Wonderland was originally written by Lewis Carroll. It was originally published in 1865. It was adapted as a movie by John Huston in 1951 and also by Walt Disney in 1951 and 1953. This book was also used in the first episode, season 1, episode 7 of the television series Wonder Woman.

I lack cable-vision and no longer have "DirecTV". So being a rural resident I have to wait for DVD releases. Being a lover of blondes but not blonds, I of course not only have "Barb Wire", but I have "Stripperella: The Complete First Season". I've not yet found "VIP" or a second season for Stripperella. I have the "Baywatch Hawaiian Wedding" DVD. I have the issues of "Playboy" that Pamela Denise Anderson posed in. I could go on. I love Pamela!

How can anyone DARE say anything BAD about this film ? Pardon Mel Brooks for being a brilliant comedian and for having a great sense of humour, but this film has EVERYTHING you can want from comedy films and more ! A brilliant cast, brilliant characters, great dialogue, great songs, awesome characters, and some of my favourite moments in any film ! A film that makes the audience feel a bit sick in the stomach, but in the most enjoyable way and you can't help smiling and laughing because it is SO FUNNY !

`` L'Auberge Espagnole '' collected the audience wherever it was shown . It gathered audience awards on many film festivals around the world and won the Academy Award (Oscar) as Best Foreign Language film. In 2004 it was ranked as the best film ever made by the IMDB (Internet Movie Database ) . The film, directed by Claude Chabrol was written by the French playwright Jean Gruault. The movie won the César Award for Best French Film . It is widely believed that Truffaut's friendship with the film's leading star, Brigitte Bardot , is the reason for the film's Oscar .

I have been a `` huge '' rush fan ever since `` moving pictures '' and this concert is simply amazing . There is nothing like a rush show and this one tops it all . For anyone who thinks rush is not that great because of his voice, you're kidding yourself and you're not listening to this concert and the rest of his concerts . He has the best voice out there and every concert he gives is a treat for anyone listening . He has a fantastic stage presence and he tells stories and jokes that are funny to everybody .

I own the miniseries on DVD because I love this story so much. This is one of the best period pieces on the Civil War that I have seen that tells a story of friendship divided by the war. The costumes are great, the story lines are great, I love how the story jumps around from character to character to keep you guessing as to what's going to happen next in their lives. There is a great balance of good and evil. Some of the characters that are evil in my opinion are too good not to watch.

If this is not my favorite movie of all time, it definitely is in the top five. I love this. Everything about this is perfect--the clothes, the set, the lines--yes, they're not how normal people talk, but... Right down to the small scenes, especially at the beginning of the office girls changing their shoes, picking a wedgie, watering the office ivy plant, putting lunch in the fridge... Identical to what us office girls do today in the year 2005. I think all the minor characters are wonderful.

The Gilmore girls is about a mother who had a daughter when she was 16 . Now the daughter is in college and mom is getting older. She is trying to figure out a new career for her mother and daughter. She wants to be a doctor but her daughter is a social worker. What I think the producers did right was they showed Lorelei as a fun, outgoing person. There are some good scenes between the mom and Lorelei. What was wrong was they showed the mom as an annoying person. There are some really annoying moments where the mom is being obnoxious.

This if the first movie I 've given a 10 to in years . If there was ever a movie for the masses , it is this one . It has everything you could want in a movie these days . It's action , it's comedy , it's a little romance , it has all the good stuff . The action scenes in this one will knock your socks off ! I could go on all day long with my gushing about how much I love this movie . It's really a great way to spend a movie-watching night with your friends and family .

I saw it in Europe-plex. Great movie!! This film is an exploration of the Spirit and the Flesh in modern times. Protagonist Jim Kirk, drives an unwieldy RV across America, stopping often to fill his gas-guzzling tank. He is middle-aged and confused . He fuels his thick, diabetic body with cups of coffee and radio chatter. He is the Flesh: agitated and sometimes spaced out, fairly oblivious to the growing tension around him but feeling it as twinges of discomfort. The Spirit suffuses the film through speeches and other sounds, as well as what appears and goes by in the visual field.

The entire series , not just The Blue Planet , is nothing short of amazing . The best nature series I have ever seen . If you want to understand life, ecology , the planet and how the planet works , then Blue Planet 2 is the show to watch . The whole concept of the show is brilliant . A small team of researchers are taken out to see the ocean from the surface to the deep ocean and learn all about them . Their job is to go and film all the fascinating things they find . I think you would be absolutely enthralled by this show .

This movie has a lot to recommend it. The paintings, the music, and David Hewlett's naked butt are all gorgeous! The plot, a story of redemption, forgiveness, and courage in the face of adversity is also very interesting and touching -- and it's not predictable, which is saying quite a lot about a movie in this day and age. But, the acting is mediocre, the direction is confusing, and the script is just odd. It often felt like it was trying to be a parody, but I never figured out what it was trying to be parody *of*.

I not only consider this to be the best film that Jon Voight (Midnight Cowboy, Coming Home) has ever done, but a real tribute to teachers.Despite incredible odds, Pat Conroy (Voight) managed to reach a group of students and bring them from nowhere to a basic literacy and awareness of the world. His methods made be criticized by bureaucratic dinosaurs like Mr. Skeffington (Hume Cronyn), but teachers like Conroy will always be winners.Voight really showed that he had a love for teaching and that it was a natural high for him.

Having grown up in the typing pool era and dealing with office politics and men who were apt to make a banquet of beauties into a delightful meal day to day, this movie hits the mark. Good afternoon fare. I understand that Louis Jordan wanted to work in this movie to play opposite the quintessential GORGEOUS Suzy Parker. Everyone wanted to be in and I believe it has done well and held up over time. Best on screen kiss between Hope Lange and the late Stephen Boyd.It may not appear that anything of this is plausible but actually it was and probably still is even given the scare of sexual harassment.

When I watch a short like Boy-Next-Door, I find myself with a kind of bittersweet feeling. On the one hand, I'm happy. I'm watching something that has been well thought out, seamlessly executed and just daring enough to be interesting. On the other hand I find myself lamenting the level of comedy generally produced. TV and films are so consistently packed with easy, condescending crap that we find ourselves judging excellence within a scale of mediocrity. Then you see someone like Davis, who, without the "benefit" of studio notes or substantial budget; can create a really cool little comic gem.

This second full-length Lone Ranger feature doesn't measure up to the 1956 classic but is a fine film with enough rough and tumble action and moves along at a good clip. The Ranger looks into a series of mysterious murders which have a sinister pattern to them with peaceful Indians being the victims of a gang of hooded killers. There are more killings and violence usually associated with Lone Ranger adventures and the film has an undercurrent of racial insensitivity, the comments of which are sprinkled throughout the screenplay. The Ranger uses disguises as only he can to piece together clues and expose the outlaw band and bring them to justice.

I too saw this movie when it first came out . I was a teenager at the time , and I felt like I was in a parallel universe . It was like I was watching Star Wars for the first time again . I had not seen it before and I was blown away . This time , it was even better than the first one . There is no question . It is a good movie that is fun to watch . I saw it with my kids , and my 11 year old son thought it was a very good movie .

I not only consider this to be the best film that Jon Voight ( Midnight Cowboy , Coming Home ) has ever made , I believe it's the best film I have ever sat through. The story is based on real events , which makes it more interesting for the audience . There are many twists and turns in it . The story is very well written and the characters well developed . There are so many funny scenes in the film that the audience can't help but laugh . In the film we get to watch a young boy fall in love and get married .

First of all - I'm not one to go all sappy over movies. I saw Friends in the 70's when it was first released. I was about 17 years old at the time. Even now, at age 50, I still can remember some of the scenes. The movie is sweet and sad and may actually be too tame for teenagers today but I loved it. The story is about innocence, the purity of young love and the determination of 2 young people to make a better life for themselves then they had at home.

Having read the other comment about this superb piece of TV drama I felt compelled to balance things a little. If you like you murders, to be signature and serial, and your cops to be British, and shout a lot, and the gore to be bloody and have a religious slant then this hits every button. Not quite enough 'gov'ing to put the shouting into the Sweeney's rarefied heights, but otherwise highly rated. Ken Stott is excellent as the 'cop on the edge' and the guest stars are also well cast, including Edward Woodward and Art Malik. Recommended.

Text Taken from 2001 Melbourne International Film Fest Guide.fuckland The title is a pun based on the film 's lead character's name, which literally translates into 'one and all'. This is a film that is not for the faint hearted. The director has stated that he wanted to make a documentary about a subject that was not covered in any depth: the rise, fall and rise again of one of the most notorious gangs in Melbourne's violent underworld. At least two people have died at the hands of 'The Family', and a third is in jail with two other members.

I 'm not usually into dark/psychological thriller type things . However , SEIZING ME is really an amazing piece of work and I can highly recommend it. The characters are really interesting and the script is well written with some very surprising and interesting twists. It also has great action, great special effects and a great ending. If I'm going to be picky, I did have one slight disappointment with the dialogue. Some of it could've been reworked to give it more impact and emotion. But the story itself is great and I hope this is the start of a long and wonderful series.

there's only so much that i can take of Filipino films, especially nowadays where the trend is sex, action and slapstick comedy(which i hate). the fact that Nasaan Ka Man made me think and made me gape during the movie was a big plus. It's got good cinematic scenes and editing was great, especially the cinematography. i think that Claudine deserves the best actress here rather than getting one in the movie Milan. the fact that there's only so few Filipino movies that i really like. i think Cholo Laurel did such a great job in this movie.

Two horse traders arrive in a town and meet up with the leader of a group of Mormons who are bound for a valley where they can settle and live in peace. The scenes of the corral in the town where Ward Bond and Ben Johnson negotiate prices, and Bond introduces the idea of them (Johnson and his partner played by Harry Carey Jr.) leading the train to this valley, are some of the best in the film, as Johnson, a real cowboy, whittles a piece of wood while he banters with Bond.

The Truth and Reconciliation process in South Africa is a vital and probably unique human experiment . This movie does justice to the whole process, from the time when the Truth and Reconciliation Commission first began its work in 1996, when the Truth and Reconciliation Commission released its report into apartheid, to present day. The Truth and Reconciliation Commission did two things: they documented the truth behind apartheid, and they listened to the stories of those who have suffered because of the Apartheid regime. These people gave their testimonies over the course of six years.

An extremely down-to-earth , well made and acted `` Rodeo '' Western . No gussied up stars needed here as you see them and the rest of the performers . In fact , the best of this movie are the actors who play real people in a real town , a real rodeo and an authentic rodeo arena . There is good music too . A great film to come out of Canada in a long , long time . . . Read More

This is a fantastic Canadian Western with a wonderful cast of local Canadian talent and an authentic rodeo arena.

One of the genres that flourished during the decade of the 30s was the variation of crime fiction known as the 'hard boiled' detective. During this period, crime writers and critics, such as Ellery Queen, Raymond Chandler, Dorothy Sayers and even Dashiell Hammett, came to define the hard boiled detective as one who investigates crime while remaining unaffected by it. These hard boiled detectives are often characters who, due to circumstances, circumstances that often include being the target of a criminal himself, become hardened by the world around them and their inability to affect it.

That's a bad, raunchy, predictable, tacky, salacious soap opera? "The Best of Everything" is just such a guilty pleasure for me, something along the lines of "Valley of the Dolls". I mean, "Best" has everything. Somebody gets pregnant out of wedlock (when's the last time you heard THAT phrase? ), there are affairs everywhere, drinking, backstabbing, jealousy, and even a tragic but not altogether unexpected death.Caroline Bender (Hope Lange) and Mike Rice (the delicious Stephen Boyd) are the centerpieces of the goings-on.

On their way to a country house to hear a new play being read a theatrical producer, his secretary, and the playwright end up stuck in the mud. They make their way to a nearby house, only to end up at the home of the playwright's fiance. If you can't guess that murder and mayhem are about to take place then you haven't been paying attention.This is a a good entry in the old dark house genre. Not only does it have a good mystery, you also have some very funny one liners wandering through it.

Usually , Alan Alda plays characters that are too `` soft '' and overly verbal -- it 's probably how you knew who he was in the first place -- so in that respect this character is pretty different. I had to work hard to make him hard -- to get that character down, but once he got it right he became the person that he was when he first started the show -- the guy who you could not help but feel for. And I felt, as the first person in this show, you have to understand why people do what they do, and why they act the way they do.

This was the one movie to see about the Civi War . My aunt actually played in this movie as a little kid with her dad. She and my other sister and I used to spend hours in my grandmother’s attic playing with the props from this movie (which are now up in a museum!). One of my most memorable moments as a child was watching this with my dad in the theater. I remember him being shocked that I didn’t know what the Civi war was about, and after seeing it, I still don’t.

This was an excellent show . It came on PBS back home in Chicago and I remember Cindy Herron (I believe that is right) was one of the guest. If I could have had more than 30 seconds to respond. I would have thanked everyone for making such good music. Thank you. I would have added that we need more people who can bring to us new music. We need people who are willing to support and help others do more music. There are more people who are willing to help. Just need the help of people to get things going.

Just Before Dawn came out during the golden days of the slasher film. The backwoods slasher pretty much started with films like Friday the 13th, The Burning, and Madman. Just Before Dawn is a step ahead of the typical backwoods slasher flick. The cinematography is gorgeous. The acting is top notch. The heroine of the film is not your typical 'final girl'.Constance is a 'woods' girl, but when it comes down to the primal instinct of survival, she's a step behind. Not until it comes to saving the life of her and her boyfriend, does the primal notion of survival kick in.

Pat Conroy's autobiographical book "The Water Is Wide" proves to be something of a Southern "Up The Down Staircase", yet despite the teacher-going-against-the-odds formula, "Conrack" really does move the audience with each little breakthrough and creative flash. These students (uneducated black kids on an island off South Carolina) are actually shown learning, and their collective wide-eyed innocence is remarkably sweet. The one actual actress in the bunch (Tina Andrews, an amazing performer) plays the "tough nut" Conrack has to crack, and once she falls under his charms, it all seems a breeze.

Well , I 'm a few days late but what the hell .... ! Anyways , the word that best describes it for me is “Fantastic”. I was a little leary about purchasing this game from Gamefly online because I’m not too familiar with their history, but it was totally worth it. There was no problem with the credit card charge , and the package arrived at my house right on schedule with the game. The game is really a blast, and the graphics are beautiful. My only gripe is that the game can be beat in about 2.5 hrs.

I saw the movie in 1972 , and like other people who have commented on it here ... I went into the theater with little expectations. However, the movie made a big impression on me -- and the next time I had a chance to see it again , I took it. I am sure that the movie is a lot better than I remember it being -- I was too young, and hadn't seen many movies. I remember liking it in the theater, but it is even better now on TV -- but it has lost nothing by being seen now -- if anything , it is even better .

The film starts with promise because there is more interaction between Spanky and Buckwheat, but as the film progresses, the two boys have fewer scenes together. This slows the pace considerably. Billie "Buckwheat" Thomas gives a very strong performance in his early scenes. When he is left behind on the riverboat, his fear and abandonment are palpable and his tears are truly heartbreaking. When he goes from man to man asking for help and is repeatedly rejected the viewer really begins to wonder if this is a comedy or not. Watching a children's birthday party through a picket fence is another moving moment.

does anyone know where i could get my hands on this video or the film for this. I have been searching for it for a long time to show my daughter to show her and i can not find it anywhere. probably because it was only on video and they never made the DVD or VHS or idk.i saw this right off Disney back in 1996 and i think it would be the best video to show her. such a good movie that has every type of emotion displayed throughout the whole movie. also has a lot of actors that started their careers with this movie.

I have remembered this cartoon for over 50 years - what staying power it has! It was funny and creative; I wish my children and grandchildren could have seen it. It ranks right up there with Winky Dink - another favorite. I was pleased to find out that one of the creators later worked on Rocky and Bullwinkle. These early shows had a lot going for them that todays cartoons for kids don't have. Today's cartoons seem to push the idea that one needs something special, some magic formula or talent to be able to succeed against evil or dangerous circumstances.

As a European , the movie is a nice throwback to my time as a student in the 1980 's. I remember watching it at the time when it came out and it's always stuck with me. It was also the first movie that made me want to see movies outside my own country and in this case to watch them as soon as I got home from the cinema. I remember seeing it when I was about 9 and really enjoyed it, so I thought it'd be a good starting point to see what the rest of the movies that were out in the '80 's are like.

This is what porn used to be, this is a true classic. I mean, it is an x-rated musical based on an actual book! There is a real plot to it and how many x-rated movies can boast that these days? This belongs in an exclusive short-list of true pornographic movie classics, including Debby Does Dallas, Deep Throat, and Behind the Green Door. I think the problem with "pornographic movies" these days is that it's all about the "pornographic" and not about the "movie".

MCBOING BOING is one of the cartoons that have stuck in my head over the years and finally decided to give a try. The cartoon itself is based on an episode from the 1960s, a show known as ‘The Family Dog Show’ that originally aired on Sunday mornings on CBS. The reason why I am writing about this cartoon and episode of this show is two fold. First, I wanted to share this video with you all because I think it has the potential to be hilarious. Secondly, because I have a feeling that most of you have probably seen the show.

I saw this film at the 2005 Palm Springs International Film Festival . I went in with the assumption that it was going to be another one of the “Twilight Saga” knockoffs, and I was completely wrong. For one, the story is actually more compelling than the ones in the “Twilight” books. Secondly, I found myself liking the movie’s lead characters. And finally, it was the best movie I saw that day! It’s a coming of age story set in the 1970s. The setting was the midwest, as you can tell by all the cornfields.

What can I say ? You expect only the best in drama from the BBC and MESSIAH is not an exception. It is so well cast and so touching. You will not be able to watch this series without shedding a few tears I can guarantee. The ending is just so heartbreaking. If you have been watching British drama on the BBC over the past few years, you may be aware that MESSIAH has been running since the first series of MURPHY BROTHERS back in 2008. This series, as its name suggests, is the final one.

A lot about USA The Movie can be summed up in its title . It draws parallels between the attitudes of the people of the USA toward their government and the attitudes of the citizens of a typical developing nation toward the governments of the developed countries . The United States , in its history , is one of the leading nations in the world , and for all practical purposes , it has been . Its influence and power have spread , through its armed forces , from the sea to the mountains , and even the air . As a consequence , its name has been heard and read throughout the world .

Forget about Donnie Darko. I open with this because it seems that a good portion of the reviews I have read on The Box amount to the simple but weak argument that it doesn't hold a candle to Darko. It isn't that I disagree with that necessarily, I just feel that this movie is a different animal altogether and deserves its own analysis. There are points of comparison to be sure, but they are peripheral concerns when you consider that the key to the heart of each movie is different. In Darko, the driving force of the narrative is existential.

Ok , maybe Posse ca n't compare to other popular cowboy/western movies . But that 's because it did n't have any "western" qualities at all . This is more like the "mockbusters" of the '70's . And yes , it was released at the end of the decade and had to be made for the summer movie season . But it is the only cowboy/western spoof/comic of the decade . And I 'm glad it is . . . The movie is a comedy spoof, but the plot is so bad that even when it's not being ironic it's unintentionally humorous.

I got this movie with my BBC "Jane Austen Collection" (5 DVDs of old BBC adaptations) and didn't like it at first. It's completely different from the others and it lacks, or so I thought, one of the qualities that I enjoy in all other Austen movies: cheerful common sense. The nightmare scene in which Mrs. Richards apparently sews her fingers together was especially upsetting.I still don't like to watch the finger-sewing scene but I do love hearing Mrs. R. saying, dreamily, while she sews, "My only acquaintance...tore my gown."

Renee Zellweger absolutely shines as Nurse Betty, easily one of the most charming, off-beat, and lighthearted comedies of the year.When soap opera obsessed waitress Betty Sizemore witnesses her insensitive husband's murder by two hitmen (Morgan Freeman and Chris Rock), she snaps and thinks the cast members on A Reason to Love are real. She decides to travel to Los Angeles to find famed heart specialist Dr. David Ravell (a character on the show).As the two oddly paired Hitmen, the caustic Rock and the pontificating Freeman generate some very fun chemistry, and Greg Kinnear also has fun with his smarmy offscreen actor persona.

The year 1950 saw two very different and interesting westerns : 'The Gunfighter ' by Henry King , and 'Wagon Master ' by Henry Hathaway , which was an American production based on a novel written by William Boyd. The latter film , directed by Hathaway, won the ' best picture' oscar in 1951 , a distinction it shared with King's film . This was an achievement the western genre in its early years was to enjoy no more and the period of the late 50's , early 60's saw the advent of a new wave that would transform it from a genre to an art form .

I was mighty impressed with Nurse Betty all the way through . It has a great ensemble of characters , a little bit of everything . It has an edge , a little bit of everything , a great story to it all . I have only one or two notes to make about it . I felt like it should have been a bit more developed . I thought that Nurse Betty's love life was somewhat one sided , that is she was going out with the other nurse . I would love to see more of that side of her .

Having just got the "Loony Tunes Golden Collection"(which i HIGHLY recommend, by the way), I'm going to try to comment on most if not all of the cartoons individually. As such the starting statement might seem redundant for those whom read multiple reviews of them, for this i apologize.Rabbit Seasoning is the middle short in a trilogy of like-minded shorts (the other two being "Rabbit Fire" and "Duck! Rabbit, Duck). Bags and Daffy argue about who Elmer Fudd should short. It makes me laugh EVERY SINGLE TIME!!!

In the midst of a documentary about his parents , the filmmaker 's mother dies , but he continues making his movie . soon thereafter , the filmmaker's father dies . this is the simple outline of the plot of david f. nolan's "the dark knight ." there are other complications , but this is the central storyline of the film . at least that's how nolan describes his film in interviews . at first glance , one might think that nolan didn't know what his film was all about , but after seeing it , it makes perfect sense .

Jordan takes us into the seedy crime side of Sydney , Australia , following the desperate attempt of nineteen year old schoolgirl, Chloe Sullivan, to smuggle cocaine into the Sydney airport with her best friend in a bid to impress an older man she loves. She has just been kicked out of school and her family is about to disown her as she tries to find the man who she loves before her family finds out. But things are going to get really ugly for her because a drug lord has other plans for Chloe.

After Mrs and Mr. Iyer this is yet another very good film by Aparna sen(mostly in English). In the earlier film she treated a contemporary political environment and its effect on individuals. In this film it is the impact of mentally disabled member of the family and its impact on the family. As a parallel sub theme she treats a philosophical concept on "reality". It is a film which leads to thinking after seeing the film.Mithee the younger sister (Konkana Sen Sharma, the daughter of Aparna Sen) is suffering from Schizophrenia being taken care of by the dominant elder sister Anjali (Shabana Azmi) .

Just Before Dawn really surprised me when I saw it by being far less of a gruesome horror adventure than I expected. It was actually a kind of sweet, heartwarming and fun movie about a girl who moves into an old mansion after her parents die and she is suddenly thrust into a weird world and people she barely knows and who don't seem to want her around. I like that there's a happy ending here, but not one where she just gets taken care of and that's it. There are issues to be resolved here too, like what was that thing that happened with the little boy?

The Karen Carpenter Story shows a little more about singer Karen Carpenter's complex life. Though it fails in giving accurate facts, and details.Cynthia Gibb (portrays Karen) was not a fine election. She is a good actress , but plays a very naive and sort of dumb Karen Carpenter. I think that the role needed a stronger character. Someone with a stronger personality.Louise Fletcher role as Agnes Carpenter is terrific, she does a great job as Karen's mother.It has great songs, which could have been included in a soundtrack album.

Our Family and friends enjoyed this movie very much. The theme was well handled by the Director with great performances from Shabana Azmi, Konkana Sen and well supported by good performances from the other cast. The climax was built well but for the ending which was a far from being called "Good". We are still trying to understand what was the Director trying to convey? Were they short of ideas or was the ending beyond the understanding of common movie lovers? A better ending would have created a lasting impression on the audience and increased the viewer-ship.

i love this show ! it is amazing ... i can never miss an episode even if i 've already seen it... the cast is the best in my opinion....and the stories are funny and real...and they are always different ! if u watch it u wont miss the next episode and will be looking for it all the time ! i hope this show never ends !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! i love the show its awesome!the cast are amazing!

I have remembered this cartoon for over 50 years - what staying power it has ! It was funny and it showed what is wrong with the government of the UK today. Here is the cartoon I refer to - taken from 'The Times' and it was published on 27th April 1979:

I can't quite work out what they are trying to say... maybe this cartoon sums it up? I agree it was a good cartoon, but I think it's time the cartoon stopped being funny because it's just as bad now (or was even worse in 1979) than it was in the 1980's.

I LOVE this movie . and Disney channel is ridiculous for not playing it anymore . I think they should make a sequel to this movie as a tv show , it is way better than most other Disney shows that have been on tv . I don’t have the energy to write a lot about this movie, but it is something I have enjoyed from the get go. While watching it for the first time with my daughter, she started to cry everytime a song or character was coming on screen and I had to tell her to put in on pause, then stop and give me that look.

I 'm seen this documentary in its feature-form , in a movie theatre . And ... wouah ! The pictures were great in that format . You know how they are , with those big , deep soundtracks ... the ones with all the wah wahs and the harmonics and the vibrato ? Well , this one is no different ... and I liked it . The pictures are even better than they sound in this case . But even if they were not , this documentary about the life and music of George Harrison is one of those that can't be missed . So here it is .

Surprising , witty , funny and totally engaging , the film grabs a little-known reality : that of the student-teacher relationship in modern British higher education . unlike many previous studies of the issue , " a day in the life of a student " takes a fresh , humorous and provocative look at the real-life challenges facing those in this unique relationship in the university environment . set in an english department , it follows several students as they take their exams and try and get through a typical week of college life . one of these is laurie , played by jonny lee in a brilliant and touching performance .

Ignore the bad reviews on here, this film is awesome! "Just Before Dawn" is a great example of what can be done in a film with a minimal budget if you have a dedicated crew, decent script, and a cool idea for a film. It's a hell of a lot of fun.I enjoyed it a lot more than most other 80's slashers because the killer is so unique. "Wrong Turn" ripped this movie off something fierce! There's plenty of blood and scares. My girlfriend was freaked out and she watches almost everything with me and doesn't flinch.

I can barely even remember what DECADE I saw this film . It was when I was a teenager , and my mother took us to the movies . As the lights came up, I realized I was sitting in a theater full of strangers , all looking at me. So I sat back and listened. And, I listened. Because, what the hell. It turned out that my mother had put the film on as an extra feature , and we were sitting in the middle of it . And, you know, it was really really good !

Strange enough , shorts like this get a 10 . Why ? They are hilarious . This is hilarious . I had seen this movie a million times before , but never knew I was in the presence of such talent until I finally watched it this year , at a friend's movie night . The concept is simple : this guy is a super rich guy who goes out in the desert to test out his new invention : a flying saucer . The only problem is he's going out in a small plane , which he can't find . So he has to fly in his saucer .

when the gilmore girls started in Germany i did not want to watch them because for me it was just an excuse to go to bed and read some books while they were on tv

i love the gilmore girls and it's great when they have episodes that are worth watching

for me, they're a lot of fun to watch. i like them as a comedy, and not as much of an acting showcase as some people like them. i like how each gilmore has a different personality and i think they are all cute in their own way, and they look so different.

I must say it was a let down . Overall its great to see the way Aparna Sen has handled the project. The movie is very well made in many ways. But that doesn't matter. I just want to say this.. I think it would have been better if they had shown some more scenes from the book. To be honest, it seems like a lot of time is spent on her growing up in the house. We should have seen much more from her in her early years in the family. I am not saying that her childhood was unimportant.

Where this movies differs from traditional Hollywood movie is that it shows a true depth of feelings . In Europe there was a law that says all movies that are shown in cinemas should be at least 18 years old. The law was created because kids watch movies all the time with the intention to learn how to behave. I’m sorry for being a bit off topic but that’s how the law works here in my country. Anyway this movie was rated 18 and it’s well worth watching. If you are interested this is the link to the trailer and the official site.

Fata Morgana is an absolute masterpiece. It's Werner Herzog's most unconventional film. It doesn't have a plot or story. Instead of a story, we're given a collection of images, words and music that work so wonderfully together. It's not a documentary either. Some of the people in this film are directed and given lines to read. It has some of the most beautiful and haunting images. Herzog shoots real mirages and we see cars and people floating around in the middle of the desert who aren't actually there but hundreds of miles away reflected like in a mirror.

I bought this movie because of Raquel Welch. She was gorgeous in this film as she played the role of Harry (Mike Wagner) girl friend. Harry a robber down on his luck trying to make one more heist. Harry goes to a funeral where he meets Vittorio De Sica and takes him for a ride. When things don't work out on the ride they put there mines together to figure out the fastest way to get money. Harry and his gang decide with the help of Vittorio De Sica to from there on mob.

what was the quote by archbishop tutu at the end of the film about a person 's past ? this was the quote that came to mind for me as the movie was unfolding. quote : we don't know exactly who you were , but we know what you've done, and we'll never stop loving you. and that is who you will always be with us . i can't think of the words that he used, but he said there is someones past that no-one wants to know , but it does define who that person is .

I first saw this one afternoon in the 80 's on network T.V . I think I was like 9. I remember I was watching the show and my dad had come home late that night from work. I was at the kitchen table with my sister and another little girl, when I heard my dad talking to my mom outside. Then he walked in the house and went straight to the kitchen table. He then told us to get ready for bed. He then noticed me and my sister were not ready for bed. My sister got ready, but I didn't want to go.

Susie Q is a great romantic prom Movie. Amy Jo Johnson (Susie Q) is a great Actress. I think she did a great performance. I hope that sometime that the Disney Company could put this movie on DVD. I think it's kind of cool and a little bit hilarious. It's kind of sad when Susie Q dies in a Car accident in the beginning at first it makes you want to cry or sob. But in the middle when no one suspects Susie Q it gets kind of funny and surprising. There is a little bit of mystery in this movie but not much.

This as the first of the Ma and Pa Kettle flicks . Marjorie Main ( Ma ) steals the show in the role and is so great that the role was played by her for several years afterward. The rest of the cast is not up to par with Main , which is not surprising given the era in which the film was made. It is entertaining, and I recommend it to you. The story opens with Ma taking an elevator to the office of her stockbroker . She has $25,000 in stock and wants to sell her shares and make money .

After searching for 6 months, I finally found this DVD. All I can say is it was damn well worth the wait! "Rush in Rio" may very well be the greatest rock DVD in existence. I'm not joking. It's incredible! All the fuss about the sound being crappy is true, however it doesn't make the concert unwatchable. I find it makes you feel like you're actually in Rio watching the concert from the audience. That's one of the reasons I love this DVD. It makes you feel like you're actually there.

Loved the shots of airports -- Dallas, Phoenix, Fresno, etc., just single buildings with the name in block letters on the roof. And the tri-motors, and the well-dressed passengers. Fast-forward 75 years....But what really got to me was the hammer and sickle emblem and what appeared to be a Chinese ideogram adjacent the logo, aft of the pilot's seat on the starboard side of the fuselage. Remember when the mutual acquaintance Neil and Jill encounter says that Jim'd become a general in a Chinese rebel army?

A lot about USA The Movie can be summed up in its title . It draws parallels between the attitudes of the USA – which is more powerful than every single other country in the world – and the attitude of the USA when it comes to its own citizens. In a world of “everyone for him or herself,” America is about the opposite: “for them, but not for everyone.” And like the title of the film suggests, this theme of self-absorption and privilege is not limited to just a few members of the country’s elite; it permeates the entire country.

Robert Altman , Nicolas Roeg , John-Luc Goddard -- you were expecting a fun film the entire family could enjoy? Sorry, no. You’ve been warned. Don’t say you weren’t. “Quiet Place” is a film where everything that should’ve made it fun, fun, fun is missing. You’ve seen it coming. You knew “Quiet Place” was about a family who moved from the city to the “country” (they were city people, of course). That it was supposed to be about what happens when a family moved.

This movie is a piece of the time in which it was made..... Realistic. Movies were not candy coated during the late 60s and early 70s. The producers did not try to create some happy ending that didn't exist. The lack of a happy ending would create agitation in the audience that, hopefully would spur them on to action. At least that's how it seemed at the time. In today's movie world this movie would probably not be done. There would, definitely, not be this ending, however realistic.

Fuckland is an interesting film . I personally love the Dogma movement . I wish it had lasted longer . Its nice to see the same ideas expressed through a different creative medium. The story is interesting, the characters are believable and the visuals are a pleasure to look at . The film is well put together and the acting was good. Its got a good plot , an interesting concept and the visual design is top class. Its a must see for any fans of the genre . For those who haven't seen the film here is a bit of a summary of what happened in it .

"Two Hands" is a good addition to the Australian Film Catalogue.It is that curious mix of real life, surreal life, comedy, tragedy and love the Australians have developed on their own.Heath Ledger is basically a good if naive guy. Wanting to get on he falls in with a local "Big" Man Pando (Bryan Brown). But at the very moment he sets a first toe on the dark path to crime he meets Alex (Rose Byrne). Here is the cause of the error to change his life in ways unexpected.

Tex Avery 's tenure as director of cartoons for MGM was in the 1940s and 50s was one of the most prolific periods in the history of animated films. He produced over 400 cartoons during this period, beginning with 'The Egg and I' in 1941, continuing with 'Tom and Jerry', 'Mickey Mouse', 'Donald Duck', 'Popeye', 'Cinderella', and his most famous, 'Bambi', all in the '40s, and including 'The Three Caballeros', 'Casper the Friendly Ghost', 'The Atom Ant Adventure', and 'The Fox and the Hound'.

I first saw this film in 1959 at the Hoyts Double Bay cinema in Sydney when fifteen years old . It was only recently that I came across the film on a late night TV show and got so excited I couldn’t get back to sleep until I watched it. I was so happy it was on TV. It was then that I realized the film was being screened as part of a late night series of classic B films . It was a great thrill to see the film after all that time. This is the film that I would love to watch over and over again again .

This small John Ford western with no 'stars ' but a cast of character actors is one of his masterpieces, and a timeless classic. John Wayne is his usual hard-boiled, self-reliant, taciturn, no-nonsense, law-enforcement man, but he also finds time to do a little philosophizing. The film has an interesting plot, a good script, interesting cinematography, and a great score by Victor Young. But what really sets this apart from everything else he did is that there is a good deal of humor injected into the plot.

I 've seen 'nurse betty ' twice in september 2000 on the international film festival 'films by the sea ' in spain . I think it was called spain in the early 80 's . I'm not sure if the second time was 2001 . I don't know if she's been there in september . It may have been a few years since I've seen it . I don't remember the year . I haven't heard about a film named 'nurse betty ' with september 2000 . There's no september , I'm not sure when the film was made .

Up And Coming was a very positive sitcom , which brought a tool/and or channel that opened the young minds up to all different kinds of possibilities. When the show went off the air in the 1990s, there weren't any more shows with this concept, and now we see the same thing happen with Glee and The New Normal. I hope we see some new sitcoms with positive messages and concepts soon, so the kids and teens out there can still relate. I can understand the hate towards that show. I don't think there's any way around it.

I first saw this on the big screen with my girlfriend. It was a fun romp with some cool music. Kristine was on the Playboy cover, and the centerfold, as I recall. She's really cute and perky and has lots of charm. The movie made me want to see more of her and so I kept a look out for her in other stuff. She's in Steven Spielberg's "I Wanna Hold Your Hand" and Barbara Streisand's "The Main Event" and Bill Murray's "Meatballs", plus lots of TV shows like Night Court and TV movies.

This was on odd film. I liked the adventure of it though it seems to be aimed at children. (SPOILER AHEAD) Ironically, the main character murders a federal official. Then he's a fugitive on the run. They later blow up his house and then he finally commits suicide. Seems like they should have just made it a film for a more mature audience or made it more family friendly.This was on odd film. I liked the adventure of it though it seems to be aimed at children. (SPOILER AHEAD) Ironically, the main character murders a federal official.

There is a clever little scene in The Karen Carpenter Story , where both Carpenters are in a recording studio. They are sitting across a table from each other. They are about to begin their final song together as a duo. As you can imagine, it is a very romantic, heartfelt, heartwarming and tender moment between these two. This is the scene that you see in many home movies of the Carpenters as they performed as a duo. It’s a cute, romantic, touching scene between Karen and Dick and that is how I would describe it to you and that is the way to view it.

Police officer Dirk Hendricks ( Jamie Bartlett ) files an amnesty application Alex Mpondo ( Chiwetel Ejiofor ) .A member of the National Police Service ( NPS) in South Africa , Dirk Hendricks ( Bartlett ) is an honest and brave officer caught up in the violent and corrupt world of SARS . When he is suspended without pay over allegations of rape and corruption he goes to Alex Mpond ( Ejiofor ) who is his friend. He tries to get Alex to join him. Alex is a man who has committed a serious crime of murder and is in the system.

Bluff I really think this movie is very good.Is basic a different kind of Colombian movie . Is hilarious and it's a great way to see the country. It's also one of the best comedies of the year. The movie is very well made and funny. The main character is a very funny and charming guy, and I think the story would be much better if we could understand the other side of the story. He is not a bad guy at all. We can't know what he will do and we are very confused about that, but at least there is some humor in the story.
